Each one is between 1 and 2 inches tall. The unique art is 100% hand painted and hand carved, made with love and excellent attention to detail by Guatemalan artisans from the town of Chichicastenango. The wood these masks are made from is conscious and approved by the Guatemalan forestry department.  E-book version of the book:   Downloadable version of our book for electronic devices.30-minute Skype Session w/ the Vagabroads:  Ask us anything!  We'll tell you anything you want to know about how we started our adventure, the gear we took, stories from the road, etc.20-minute Skype Session w/ a Woman Featured in the Book:   Meet the women!  Depending upon who is available and not on a mountain somewhere, we will choose a woman featured within the book to speak with you over Skype.*Each perk is "while supplies last" and may be substituted for another reward of equal or better value. DON'T FORGET TO CHECK OUT THE CAMPAIGN VIDEO AND PHOTO GALLERY! Follow us and keep in touch!Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/vagabroadsInstagram:  https://www.instagram.com/thevagabroadsWebsite:   https://vagabroads.com

story:
I’m a writer living in Sausalito, California and the author of several books of non-fiction. If you are curious about these, please visit my website at www.mariafinn.com. I’m asking for your help with a novel I'm working on, “Sea Legs & Fish Nets” based loosely on my experiences working on a commercial fishing boat in Alaska.

The crew is four young women who spend a season commercially fishing for salmon on Kodiak Island in order to earn money to pursue their dreams. Some of them become entangled in romantic escapades with men out on the fishing grounds but are also competing with them to catch the fish.  My elevator pitch for it is a literary version of “Sex in the City meets the Deadliest Catch.”  This novel explores how women approach this adrenaline-fueled industry, and how men and women encounter each in places where traditional roles are challenged. As well, it explores how the humbling laws of nature force them rely on each other.

An early draft of it was a finalist for Pen/Bellwether Award that was founded by Barbara Kingsolver for novels that address issues of social justice. My goals with this novel are to encourage all people, but particularly young women, to pursue their dreams—no matter how difficult, poorly thought out, or financially impractical those dreams may be. Also, during my adventures on fishing boats, I fell in love with the Pacific Ocean and I that hope readers also come away with a sense of awe and respect and we all work towards protecting it.

I’ve been writing this novel for the past three years, in-between paid writing work and teaching. It still needs a lot of help, and so at the recommendation of a colleague, I hired a professional editor. Her services are expensive, but she’s edited best sellers like “The Help” and is really good at helping develop tension in the plot and making my characters stronger and more vivid.  I could only afford to hire her for the first 50 pages. I’d really like to work with her on the entire book and also be able to take a few weeks off work to fully concentrate on writing this novel. And so that’s why I’m having this Kickstarter campaign. I’m asking for your help to make this book as good as it can be before I submit it to editors, and to the competition again this year.

Even if you can’t contribute financially, I’d be grateful if you helped by spreading the word and wish me luck.

story:
You have a fantastic body.  Amazing.  Glorious.

Don’t buy it?  Feeling skeptical?  That’s all right.  I have a book for you.  It’s called  52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever.

The truth is your body is utterly awesome and I know it.  It doesn’t matter what your body’s like.  If you have a body and you’re interested in having less body-related doubt, worry, and self-loathing and a whole lot more happy confident self-accepting badassery, 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever is for you.


What is 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever?

52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever is the latest body-acceptance project from Hanne Blank, author of Big Big Love: A Sex and Relationships Guide for People of Size and Those Who Love Them and The Unapologetic Fat Girl’s Guide to Exercise and Other Incendiary Acts.  It is 52 weekly chapters, each on a different subject having to do with bodies, radical acceptance, and an abundance of gleeful shenanigans.  Readers get a book delivered in weekly doses, each one bringing a dose of body-loving perspective, insight, strategy, experiments, Zen, and badassery to help you revel in the amazing skin you’re in.


Who is 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever for?  

Do you have a body?  Then 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever is for you!  

Body-image and self-esteem books are often marketed as if they were only of interest to women, and as if the only body-related issues anyone ever had were about weight and size.  52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever was created because we know better.    

All kinds of people have body issues, and they have issues about all kinds of bodies.  Some have to do with weight or size… and some of them aren’t!  52 Weeks is about things like the stuff people say and the ways people act about bodies… how we move our bodies through the world… feeling sexy and happy in your body… how we care for ourselves, dress ourselves, feed ourselves… how gender shapes how we feel about our bodies… how our body histories shape our lives today… how to respond to body critics… what to do when you’re having a crappy self-esteem day… and a whole lot more.


Is 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever a diet?

Nope.  52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever is not a diet. Yeah, there’ll be some stuff about food.  Mostly about figuring out how to eat in the ways that make your pelt glossy and keep you purring.  But no, no diet business.


Is 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever an exercise program?

No, although you will be warmly encouraged to experiment with moving your body in any and all ways that intrigue, delight, or amuse you.  But I’m not about to blow smoke up your gym shorts about exercise being some kind of magic wand that will cure everything that you don’t like about your life.  This isn’t that kind of party.


So just how is 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever going to
change my life, then?

It’s not.  (It’s just a book.)  But it might just help you change your life.  

52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever is all about what happens if you start thinking about your body with the assumption that being a fierce fabulous force of nature is your birthright.  It’s a little bit Zen, a lot pragmatic, and full of all kinds of radically self-accepting and body-respecting juju.  It knows you do not suffer fools gladly and wants you to have to suffer them as little as possible.  52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever is a full year of kick-ass personal body positivity, no matter what your body is like.  


What kinds of subscriptions are there for
52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever?


There are 4 kinds of subscriptions.

Subscription Service is the basic subscription.  For a dollar a week, you’ll get 52 chapters sent to your email inbox, one every Sunday for a year.  At the end of the year, you’ll get a collected edition, with all 52 chapters in one place, in both PDF and ePub format.

Join the Private Party if you’d like to get the basic subscription service plus exclusive access to a private online forum where you can talk body shop with other subscribers to 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever.  (Hanne will hang out there some too. She makes great margaritas.)  You’ll find friendly body-positive community where you can share experiences and compare notes… all in a moderated, troll-free, private forum where all kinds of bodies are respected.

Quality Time takes it up a level, and gives you the basic subscription service, access to the private forum, and gives you one (1) hour of Skype or phone consultation with author Hanne Blank at some point during the year of the subscription (arranged at mutual convenience) to talk about your amazing body and all the badass body-lovin’ goodness you’re creating in your life.

Last But Not Least is the budget-friendly option for those who are willing to wait.  You won’t get the weekly subscription, but you will get the complete book of all 52 weekly chapters in one place, in PDF and ePub formats, at the end of July 2015.


Can I give subscriptions to 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever as gifts?

You bet!  Shortly after the funding period for this project closes you will receive an email asking you to provide the name and email address of your gift recipient.  Later on, one month before the subscription begins, you will receive a special e-card that you can send to your lucky recipient, explaining exactly what the gift is, when it will start, and how it will be delivered to them.


Who benefits from my subscription to 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever?

You do, or so it is my very sincere hope!  And so do I.

By subscribing to 52 Weeks to Your Best Body Ever you’re enabling an independent writer and activist to try something new in terms of bringing her work to the public.  

By creating a book as an independent subscription-based project, I get the benefits of being able to write outside the boxes of traditional publishing… benefits I can pass on to my readers.  

By creating a book as an independent subscription-based project, I also get the benefits of being able to communicate with readers while the book is being created, making the process of writing more responsive… and I get to pass that on to my readers too.

By supporting this project, you are supporting new directions in bringing body-accepting thought and language to the people who want it, and helping to expand the range of ways that people can get access to radical body acceptance ideas and practices.

story:
Who am I, and what am I wanting to do?

My name is Tony Faville, and I am the author of a zombie novel titled Kings of the Dead, published by Permuted Press. I am starting on a new project tentatively titled Avery Nolan: Private Dick of the Dead. The idea is based in New York City in the late 1950's and surrounds a KGB plot to destroy the United States from the inside utilizing the living dead.

My needs and what can I offer you in return..

It takes a few things to produce a quality story, a good writer with the ability to create the story, an editor to help him polish it, proper research, a good cover and the time to do so. If you help me, you will help me with the editor, the research, the cover artist,  and the ability to write it. I am not going to lie to you, my computer has failed and with everything happening in my life, I do not have the funds to replace it. You will primarily be helping me purchase new means to write, and paying for my editor. At $500 she can be expensive, but she is brutal with the red pen and worth every penny. The artwork itself, for a quality job will run $300-500.


In return, every donor will receive an electronic copy of the book and a thank you in the acknowledgement section of the book. Any donations of $50 will receive a signed paperback copy. Any donations of $100 will receive a signed hardback copy. 


Please, don't forget to share this project with your friends, even if you do not choose to back me, they may find it to be right up their alley. Thank you!

story:
Here's a Short Summary:

  My name is Jackson and I am an aspiring novelist. I finally have an idea that I feel is worthy of becoming my debut novel - now I just need the financial means. As passionate as I am about writing, I must acknowledge the fact that when it comes to getting published, writing is a business, and one that if I wish to be successfull in, I must be prepared for.
 

  This campaign is very important to me because it will dramatically help me realize my dreams and will help me convey things through my writing. Writing has always been something I've been passionate about, but recently I have been looking seriously into writing as a career; I can realistically see myself doing this. I hope to be able to find a way to use my writing to help others, as well. For example, a future goal of mine is to write an eBook and donate all of the profits to charity.
 

  As a contributor, you will play a pivotal role in my life and in the life of my works. If I go on to be a best-selling or even relatively successful author, I will owe it to you!

What I Need:

  To fund my aspirations, I can work with a flexible amount; this is one of those things where anything helps and everything is appreciated.

  If you apply reference texts, a printer (not one of those high-tech 3-D ones, but a printer capable of printing in a quantity comparable to the length of my manuscripts), MS Word, and a MacBook (which isn't something I really need, but I tacked on mainly to meet the minimum goal to be on indiegogo and because if I am fortunate enough to raise the funds necessary, I would probably purchase one), then my goal amount is accurate. However, if you take the MacBook out, then you can cut down my goal amount by at least half.

 Here's a prioritized list of potential expendatures:

  • MS Word
  • Printer
  • Reference texts
  • If I have enough, a MacBook
    If not, the remainder goes to charity and my college fund/savings
  • Any extra funds covering the above (including a MacBook, if enough) will go to charity and my college fund/savings

 

   If my goal isn't reached, I will use whatever I have obtained to do what I can and I will establish an alternate method of obtaining the other funds, if needed.

What You Get (PERKS):

  Most of my perks are writing-based and involve me writing something tangible for you, so you'll really get your money's worth! I have to admit, all of my perks are pretty awesome, check them out! ---------------------->

  I have options all the way down to $1

  Aside from the tangible perks, you also get my genuine thanks and the knowledge that you helped fund someone passionate about writing and helped that person to become successful.

Examples of my Work:

  Here are a few short excerpts of my work. I wrote these and several others while thinking about short stories to write, but the works that these excerpts are from haven't been released yet:

 

  The sound of wailing monitor alarms drilled through my brain, igniting within me an advanced stage of panic. I instantly jumped up, leaving my pathetic lunch of a granola bar unmanned, and sprinted down the corridor. I knew the exact origin of the piercing noise, which elicited a painful lumpiness in my throat.

 

 

  I took a long drag from my half-gone cigarette as I shot the person across from me an intimidating look. It was five o' clock in the morning, and I had spent the past thirty-four hours tracking down this prick. As the lead detective on the case, it only felt right for me to be here in this blank interrogation room, sitting down in a cold metal chair, with the ability to do what I needed to; what I wanted to. He met my glance with one just as intimidating, but he also tensed his muscles, flexing, as if to say try me. And try him I would.

 

   The doors to the emergency room burst open with a sound like that of fire from a Civil War cannon. There was a group of EMTs surrounding a gurney which they were pushing down the hall at what seemed like a hundred miles an hour; and towards me. I was the on-call physician at that specific moment, so whatever disaster was about to roll into my section of the E.R. would become my problem. As the mob of people fast approached, I caught a glance of what may have been, in twelve years of doing this, the worst thing I've ever seen. On the gurney, I could make out a man; or at least what was left of a man. I must have looked like I had seen a ghost because 1) I was just standing there with this dumb expression on my face, and 2) the nurse who was assisting me firmly nudged me on the arm, her facial expression letting me in to the fact that she was cognizant of my inner distress. I could finally actually make out the details of the approaching gurney's occupant. What I saw next would haunt me forever.

I could finally actually make out the details of the approaching gurney's occupant. What I saw next would haunt me forever.

story:
Short Summary

Thanks for reading checking this out, i'll try to keep it as brief as possible.  I'm a film director and script writer and although it sounds grand, i've been fortunate enough to make three films, all with micro budgets and great people around me.  I came up with the idea of Amelia when I was quite ill and confined to my bed for a couple of months, unable to walk.  I had just my imagination for company and after a week or two, had Amelia meeting an Elf who lives in a tree in her garden, well where else would they live?

It was intended to be a film, as writing scripts is a lot more straightforward than a book, but the ideas kept flowing and the story was soon developing into a series of challenges on her first adventure with the Elf, Erivon.  It took me a while to get the actual writing going, as had work commitments first, but she was always there, nagging me to start her adventurers, so last year, I began writing Amelia and the Mental Elf.

To date, i'm a little more than half way through and the adventures are coming thick and fast and i'm being helped by working with the most talented and creative illustrator I could have hoped for, Lynn Adams.  She loves the ideas and concepts behind the first 'Amelia' story and her work inspires me to write in greater detail and with more colour.

The sample chapters have so far been well received and i've had some amazing feedback, even comparing me to established and recognised names, which is all very humbling and awkward, but nice nevertheless. Having a certain 'Boy Wizard' brought tears to my eyes.

By helping me financially, it allows me to finish the book without cutting corners, to deliver it to the publisher as agreed, on time, fully illustrated and ready to go.  I've had no support to date and i've been at it now for three months, actual writing that is, the planning and schematics took a little longer than this.

Thanks again for getting this far, I really appreciate it and by helping, you have helped bring a book to life.

What We Need & What You Get

The support I have asked for is just enough to allow me to work properly, full-time on completing this book. We will obviously need materials for the artwork, which is being worked on now, but the bulk of it allows me to work on something that is incredibly dear to my heart.

I guess it's more impressive to ask for special equipment, technical support or fancy software, but the reality is, I need to be able to work on this completely, to have the time that the support will allow and to be able to write the remainder of the book to the best of my ability.

As for perks, well i've done my level best to offer something unique, including signed films that I have made, first edition illustrated copies of the book, signed if you'd like them to be and hopefully, there's something there for everyboby as a 'thank-you'.

If i don't reach my goal, then it's still helped, in fact it will help me a great deal, just to be able to write without interruption, without worrying about other aspects of life that get in the way too easily.

 

 

The Impact

I'm passionate, obviously, about the book, but it goes a little deeper than that.  With the rise in popularity of computer tablets, books are now more accessible than ever to children and young adults and worlwide literacy at an all time low, so by engaging an young audience, as well as the grown up children amongst us, I believe I can help, just a little bit, to get people engaging with a subject that is enjoyable, fun, moralistic and above all, a good read.

Personally, I still love a good book, on paper, with a cover and enjoy turning the page to read the next line, but by making it acccessible in both paper and electronic formats, means we can access more readers, which is the reason behind writing a book in the first place isn't it?

I was given a copy of the Hobbit when I was young, and it opened my eyes to well written fantasy fiction and i'll always be grateful, just as i'm sure the millions who purchased Harry Potter books will be when they look back and relive their time spent with the young wizard.

I guess i've been reasonably successful as a writer, although previously, it's been scripts, not books.  I have made three films and have another script optioned with a leading independent production company in the UK, who are hopefully going to go into production sometime soon.

I know that many of these campaigns have very impressive videos and all seem very worthwhile, so i'll say it again, "thank-you" for sticking with me and getting this far.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand completely if you are not in a position to help, it's a tough time for everyone concerned financially, but if you want to support in other ways, i'd love to have you give me just a little time.

We all have social networks now, twitter, facebook, in fact, there seems to be a new one every week, so if I could ask you to take just a few minutes out of your day to post this to as many pages, groups, followers as you possibly could, it would really help me in the long run.  The more people that know about the book and what i am trying to achieve, then the better it is for the long-term goal of getting this and future 'Amelia' books onto the shelves.

Indiegogo has some pretty easy to use share tools too.

Lynn and I are passionate about Amelia and both consider it our 'dream job', to be able to develop her and future book titles and you are directly helping us to chieve this, so again, from both of us, we say a very big 'Thank-You".
story_txt:
Short Summary
Thanks for reading checking this out, i'll try to keep it as brief as possible.  I'm a film director and script writer and although it sounds grand, i've been fortunate enough to make three films, all with micro budgets and great people around me.  I came up with the idea of Amelia when I was quite ill and confined to my bed for a couple of months, unable to walk.  I had just my imagination for company and after a week or two, had Amelia meeting an Elf who lives in a tree in her garden, well where else would they live?
It was intended to be a film, as writing scripts is a lot more straightforward than a book, but the ideas kept flowing and the story was soon developing into a series of challenges on her first adventure with the Elf, Erivon.  It took me a while to get the actual writing going, as had work commitments first, but she was always there, nagging me to start her adventurers, so last year, I began writing Amelia and the Mental Elf.
To date, i'm a little more than half way through and the adventures are coming thick and fast and i'm being helped by working with the most talented and creative illustrator I could have hoped for, Lynn Adams.  She loves the ideas and concepts behind the first 'Amelia' story and her work inspires me to write in greater detail and with more colour.
The sample chapters have so far been well received and i've had some amazing feedback, even comparing me to established and recognised names, which is all very humbling and awkward, but nice nevertheless. Having a certain 'Boy Wizard' brought tears to my eyes.
By helping me financially, it allows me to finish the book without cutting corners, to deliver it to the publisher as agreed, on time, fully illustrated and ready to go.  I've had no support to date and i've been at it now for three months, actual writing that is, the planning and schematics took a little longer than this.
Thanks again for getting this far, I really appreciate it and by helping, you have helped bring a book to life.

story:
About TRAFFIC News to-go

TRAFFIC was founded in 2009, against all odds, in a moment in time where many thought that print publications were no longer needed. TRAFFIC responded to the demand for a haptic product- in spite, or even because of the digital hype. It fulfills the need for a tangible product that you can hold in your hands, carry with you, place on a coffee table, or share with a colleague. 

TRAFFIC breaks the rules of the industry and challenges the norm: Selected quality journalism from well-known authors, photographers, cutting edge design and regular cooperation projects with artists make the newspaper stand out.

The Newspaper of the future!


Our goal and why we need your Support

The goal of this project is to save our company and enhance our company portfolio and streamline the business into a positive direction for both TRAFFIC analog and digital version. We are looking to bring TRAFFIC to your city and share our content in both German and English text and we  need your support to help us realize this dream and expectation to reach  a global level.   

 Once we receive the funding needed we will make the necessary fulfillment to   strengthen our team as we are in need of an: Editor, Managing Editor, Photo Editor, Advertising Sales & Marketing Director and a Financial Advisor for both the print and online edition.

TRAFFIC journalist and contributors are contributing to some of the strongest publications on the market (e.g., Süddeutsche Zeitung, FAZ, Zeit, NZZ, Stern, Spiegel, Welt, Rolling Stones, BBC, NY Times, Elle, Vogue, WWD, etc.) with influential backgrounds and intelligence to attract a discerning audience.

A Look Inside TRAFFIC


    Where to find us and the team

    TRAFFIC is one of the few free newspapers in the GAS (Germany, Austria & Switzerland) countries without direct competitors. It is both unique in its design and content and has a superior print quality. The entire content is also visible on our website consisting from 32-56 pages per issue.

    We have a network of 150 dedicated contributors from journalist, novelist, correspondents, photographers, stylist and designers and we want to create more jobs and maintain our work relationship for our team in the near future.

    We distribute TRAFFIC News to-go in the following cities: Berlin, Hamburg, Cologne, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Mannheim, Heidelberg, Stuttgart, Munich, Regensburg, Bamberg, Vienna, Zurich and Amsterdam and looking to expand globally. Find us online at www.trafficnewstogo.de


      Risks & Challenges

      Publishing houses and especially independent companies are at a major scarcity in both analog and digital media, however, we've overcome a majority of our challenges contrary to popular belief to succeed as a free and independent publication since our conception in 2009. We can agree that we have made mistakes and we learned from them, trials and tribulations that have caused collateral damages, and we managed to face them with making critical decisions to help maintain growth and to stay afloat on the market.

      When beginning this publishing house our liquidity was meager and insubstantial. One of the major challenges we've faced was to publish during a time when majority of German publications were closing, which lead us to take advantage of this void on the market and compete with our competitors.

      We've realized the conformity of the business which lead us broaden our horizon to sustain a business relationship with our contributors and media co-operation partners. 
      We continued to stay strong and sincerely value our contributors more than anything in this world as they provide us with trust and newsworthy articles.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        We ask for your support to please become a Fan to our project. We look forward for you to spread the word and take our project into consideration and please note that you are not committing yourself to supporting the project financially by becoming a Fan. We just only ask you to spread the word and help support the project in a positive manner.

        We thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

        Sincerely yours,

        Jacques Stephens and TRAFFIC News to-go Staff

story:
Our Story

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention(CDC) estimates 1.2 million people in the United States (U.S.) are living with HIV infection. One in five (20%) of those people are unaware of their infection. Despite increases in the total number of people in the U.S. living with HIV infection in recent years (due to better testing and treatment options), the annual number of new HIV infections has remained relatively stable. However, new infections continue at far too high of a level, with approximately 50,000 Americans becoming infected with HIV each year.

In 2010, an estimated 47,129 people were diagnosed with HIV infection in the 46 states with confidential name-based HIV infection reporting since at least January 2007. In that same year, an estimated 33,015 people throughout the U.S. were diagnosed with AIDS. Since the epidemic began, an estimated 1,129,127 people in the U.S. have been diagnosed with AIDS.

An estimated 17,774 people with AIDS died in 2009, and nearly 619,400 people with AIDS in the U.S. have died since the epidemic began.

African Americans face the most severe burden of HIV of all racial/ethnic groups in the United States (US). Despite representing only 14% of the US population in 2009, African Americans accounted for 44% of all new HIV infections in that year. Compared with members of other races and ethnicities, African Americans account for a higher proportion of HIV infections at all stages of disease—from new infections to deaths.

The Numbers

New HIV Infections

  • In 2009, black men accounted for 70% of the estimated new HIV infections among all blacks. The estimated rate of new HIV infection for black men was more than six and a half times as high as that of white men, and two and a half times as high as that of Latino men or black women.
  • In 2009, black men who have sex with men (MSM)1represented an estimated 73% of new infections among all black men, and 37% among all MSM. More new HIV infections occurred among young black MSM (aged 13–29) than any other age and racial group of MSM. In addition, new HIV infections among young black MSM increased by 48% from 2006–2009.
  • In 2009, black women accounted for 30% of the estimated new HIV infections among all blacks. Most (85%) black women with HIV acquired HIV through heterosexual sex. The estimated rate of new HIV infections for black women was more than 15 times as high as the rate for white women, and more than three times as high as that of Latina women.

Alafia (Peace) I am Khafre K. Abif, AIDS Activist and I have been thriving with HIV for 23 years. I have compiled an anthology of inspirational prayers, poems and affirmations to support the souls and uplift the spirits of People Living with HIV/AIDS.For the last eighteen month the submissions have touched my soul, made me cry, filled me with hope, and connected me to an international community of compassionate contributors who have shared their work to empower my world.

Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS has received submission from Africa, America, Europe, and South America. Contributors have provided their work in their indigenous language with an English translation. I want to shares this anthology with the international community who created it. As you are reading this it is quite possible that you know someone living with HIV/AIDS. If you do then they have shared their status with you. Let us consider all of those who still haven’t disclosed to their mother, father, sister/brother or even their faith community. What place to they go to as a source of support and inspiration?

Poets featured in the forthcoming anthology include: Nikki Grimes, Serena T. Wills, Reginald T. Jackson, Sharaledon D. Brave, r. witherspoon, Samiya Bashir, Storme Webber, Carl Hancock Rux, Tim’m T. West, Mose Xavier Hardin, Jr., Victor R. Pond, Catherine Zickgraf, Temujin Ekunfeo, Maria Hiv Mejia, Sandy Rodgers, W. Travis Wright, Vanessa German, and avery r. young and more. 

The Impact

The idea for the anthology grew out of my work as an HIV Test Counselor. Each time I had to share with someone that they tested positive for HIV one of the first issues for them was disclosure. I believe that there is healing in prayer. I know that word have power. I needed to provide this collection of words that will combat the words that are so often hear spoken to someone with HIV. This is my effort to help combat HIV-related stigma. AIDS-related stigma and discrimination refers to prejudice, negative attitudes, abuse and maltreatment directed at people living with HIV and AIDS. The consequences of stigma and discrimination are wide-ranging: being shunned by family, peers and the wider community, poor treatment in healthcare and education settings, an erosion of rights, psychological damage, and a negative effect on the success of HIV testing and treatment. 

What We Need & What You Get

A special thank yuou to everyone who made a contribution to the fist campaign http://www.indiegogo.com/Cornbread-Fish-and-Collard-Greens-Prayers-Poems-Affirmations?a=379896. This self publishing project was able to paid for half of the publishing package. However, we did not reach our goal. This campaign hope to secure support for delivering a High Quality Eco-Friendly Printing and Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS to be presented in the spirit in which it has been compiled into a quilt of words that heal and affirmation the soul. I want to deliver an aesthetically attractive book that is produced, designed and printed on quality paper. I also want to ensure that each contributor regarding of continent receives two copies of our work. In addition, the cover art needs to be created. I am overwhelemed by this quilt of words being wrppeb in the design of Javaka Steptoe an eclectic young artist, designer, and illustrator, building a national reputation as an outstanding contributor to the genre of children’s literature. His debut work, In Daddy’s Arms I Am Tall: African Americans Celebrating Fathers, earned him the Coretta Scott King Illustrator Award, a nomination for Outstanding Children’s Literature Work at the 1998 NAACP Image Awards, a finalist ranking for the Bluebonnet Award for Excellence in Children’s Books, and countless other honors. His books, Do You Know What I’ll Do?authored by Charlotte Zolotow and A Pocketful of Poems authored by Nikki Grimes, received starred reviews from both Publishers Weekly and the ALA Booklist. Hot Day on Abbott Avenue, written by Karen English, received the 2005 Jane Addams Children’s Book Award. Steptoe is also the author/illustrator of The Jones Family Express. His most recent illustration projects include Rain Play by Cynthia Cotten, published in 2008 and Amiri and Odette: A Love Story by multi award winning author Walter Dean Myers, forthcoming in January 2009. http://www.javaka.com/bio.html

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this project and share it with your social network on Facebook, Twitter,direct Email and you have even choose to blog about Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS. Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

story:
Love & Cooking - the erotic cookbook

Greetings! My name is Tanille Geib, and I'm a lover of humans. I write, direct, produce, teach, cook, laugh, and love in order to connect with people. I love story sharing, love making, and individual growing. This is my project that fuses all of my passions into one.

I have been writing and experiencing Love & Cooking for 5 years, and I'm so thrilled that it is in its last phase.

I have a team of editors, a crazy exciting photographer, and a talented designer to create the look, flow, and feel of the book. Now, I need your help to make this vision a reality.

RECENT UPDATES: I'm VERY excited to have confirmed sponsorship from Made In Print for this project! Plus two bookstores in Vancouver who want to carry it!

What is next?

Things are gearing up fast! Currently, I'm working on layout design, photography, artistic content, and editing. These talents cost money, but they're worth it! I'm committed to producing a professional, yet sexy book.
 
Two more photoshoots, hours of formatting, and planning a book launch! 
 
PERK AWAY:
I want to perk you up and get you contributing to my dream! So, check out all the perks on the right-hand side! Do you want to have the first book printed with a painted breast signature? Or have an inspired cooking session? You choose, I will be happy to assist your sexiness in the kitchen!

Why Self-Publishing?

One: Because I'm a provocative artist. I don't want to be censored in any way for my first book. I want to release it as authentic as possible. Also, this includes me having complete creative control. Can anyone guess what colour will be most visual in the book?! Could it be PINK?! Yes, it just might be.
 
Two: I'm an entrepreneur. I love problem solving, creating, learning, and achieving the "impossible", because I truly believe everything is possible with a hell of a lot of hard work, talent, and more hard work.
 
Three: Because the publishing world is changing, and I want to be a part of that. I want to teach others, and encourage other artists to work for themselves.

The Timeline

NOW: Design & Layout
October: Final revisions
November: Send to printer!
December: Sell books at craft fairs / book stores / online
January 2013: Official Book Launch & Plan book tour: first stop Calgary!
Rest of 2013: Start working on my next volume "Now Gluten / Penis Free"

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm so thankful for all of the encouragement and support thus far with this book. I have friends that have been hearing the chapter Yogurt Cunt for years! Thank you for always supporting me, loving me, and challenging me.

You can help me out by mentioning this on the Facebooks, the Twitters, or any other social media that you feel comfortable with! You can use the indiegogo share tools to make it happen!
 
Also, any ass smacks and love notes are acceptable as well! :)

Preview Chapter: Yogurt Cunt

This awarding winning chapter in w49 Magaizne is downloadable from my website and was also published in the last "Oral Pleasure" issue of CORSET magazine. 

Thank you!

Thank you for reading, your time, and your consideration! And for all of your support! I wouldn't be here without the wonderful humans sprinkled all over my life! Thank you!

If you have any questions about the book or campaign, please feel free to connect via email at info@tanillephamemariegeib.com

Sincerely,

Tanille Geib

*Delicious Photography by Chena San Martin

*Sexy Design & Layout by Charles Ellery
story_txt:
Love & Cooking - the erotic cookbook
Greetings! My name is Tanille Geib, and I'm a lover of humans. I write, direct, produce, teach, cook, laugh, and love in order to connect with people. I love story sharing, love making, and individual growing. This is my project that fuses all of my passions into one.
I have been writing and experiencing Love & Cooking for 5 years, and I'm so thrilled that it is in its last phase.
I have a team of editors, a crazy exciting photographer, and a talented designer to create the look, flow, and feel of the book. Now, I need your help to make this vision a reality.
RECENT UPDATES: I'm VERY excited to have confirmed sponsorship from Made In Print for this project! Plus two bookstores in Vancouver who want to carry it!

What is next?

Things are gearing up fast! Currently, I'm working on layout design, photography, artistic content, and editing. These talents cost money, but they're worth it! I'm committed to producing a professional, yet sexy book.
 
Two more photoshoots, hours of formatting, and planning a book launch! 
 
PERK AWAY:
I want to perk you up and get you contributing to my dream! So, check out all the perks on the right-hand side! Do you want to have the first book printed with a painted breast signature? Or have an inspired cooking session? You choose, I will be happy to assist your sexiness in the kitchen!

Why Self-Publishing?


One: Because I'm a provocative artist. I don't want to be censored in any way for my first book. I want to release it as authentic as possible. Also, this includes me having complete creative control. Can anyone guess what colour will be most visual in the book?! Could it be PINK?! Yes, it just might be.
 

Two: I'm an entrepreneur. I love problem solving, creating, learning, and achieving the "impossible", because I truly believe everything is possible with a hell of a lot of hard work, talent, and more hard work.
 

Three: Because the publishing world is changing, and I want to be a part of that. I want to teach others, and encourage other artists to work for themselves.

The Timeline

NOW: Design & Layout
October: Final revisions
November: Send to printer!
December: Sell books at craft fairs / book stores / online
January 2013: Official Book Launch & Plan book tour: first stop Calgary!
Rest of 2013: Start working on my next volume "Now Gluten / Penis Free"

Other Ways You Can Help
I'm so thankful for all of the encouragement and support thus far with this book. I have friends that have been hearing the chapter Yogurt Cunt for years! Thank you for always supporting me, loving me, and challenging me.


You can help me out by mentioning this on the Facebooks, the Twitters, or any other social media that you feel comfortable with! You can use the indiegogo share tools to make it happen!
 
Also, any ass smacks and love notes are acceptable as well! :)

Sincerely,
Tanille Geib

story:
What is LightShine Christmas

LightShine Christmas is about furthering the gospel and church among an unreached people group, the Tarahumara Indians:       

"Alcoholism and drug abuse are rampant among the Tarahumara.  In our experience it is rare to find a Tarahumara man who is not an alcoholic or binge drinker, and the same is true for many Tarahumara women.  The brewing of corn into 'tesguino' has been a cultural facet for many generations.  Although tesguino is still brewed at holidays, beer and hard liquor are a daily or weekly staple.  A very high percentage of the younger generation are addicted to drugs - typically inhalants such as glue and spray paint.  Abuse of various sorts and to various degrees is virtually universal.  At a minimum, many of the children are physically and emotionally neglected.  Physical and sexual abuse is very common." - Chris Nickerson, LightShine Missionary

As a church family, Rocky Mountain Calvary, approximately five years ago we sent several families down to Mexico to reach a less reached people group called the Tarahumara Indians.  They are a marginalized people with less than 1% following Jesus and no reproducing church known among them.  Through prayer and stepping out in faith, we have adopted a community (called Soledad, which means loneliness) of Tarahumara Indians in north central Mexico and over the last 3.5 years we have been teaching the children of this community about Jesus.  And more than providing the gospel, we are equipping these children to become the future leaders of their own people.  

The impact on this people group has been enormous.  70+ kids gather twice a week for up to 3 hours at the LightShine building to receive instruction in the Bible, hygiene , abuse recovery, life skills, etc.  Through these children families are being reached with the gospel.  The mothers are starting to gather weekly in the LightShine building kitchen to cook and to talk about the Bible.  The Tarahumara people are seeing Jesus and following Him!  There has never been a work like this done for these people on this scale and we are extremely thankful God would allow our Church to be a part of this amazing ministry.  

Help us to continue this ministry in excellence as we seek to fulfill the following needs

What We Need

Consider helping us to continue this ministry in excellence as we seek to fulfill the following needs:

Metal Building for Community Outreach/Church (estimated $30,000)

Currently we have 3 permanent classrooms attached to a temporary tent.  This tent is crucial to our ministry and is where the children and the rest of the community gathers for various gospel-focused events.  The temporary tent, erected on the dust/dirt of the community, is falling apart and needs to be replaced.  Our goal is to replace it with a metal structure that will become a permanent fixture in our ministry and in the community.

2 Swamp Coolers ($2,524)

Our LightShine building is unbearably hot during the summer.  So hot that when you walk outside into the 100-degree desert, you feel a significant temperature drop!  The heat makes it hard for th skids to concentrate and the teachers to teach.  Having swamp coolers will make classrooms much more comfortable and learning much more effective.

5 Curtains ($375)

The teachers in the Soledad (the Tarahumara community) are using old bed sheets and tablecloths for window coverings in the classrooms.  Having good curtains with linings will beautify and help insulate the classrooms, and more importably will reduce the chance of break-ins in the high-cirme area where we are located.

4 Bookshelves ($488)

It would be an incredible blessing for each classroom in Comunidad Soledad to have its own bookshelf!  We would use the bookshelf to place Bibles, notebooks for the children, additional reading books, etc.

4 Cabinets ($632)

The teachers in Soledad have little or no storage space in their classrooms.  They often have to bring classroom items back and forth from their homes each day.  Having storage would make it much more convenient to access supplies and store classroom materials, and allow greater flexibility during the teaching time.

4 Teacher Desks ($533)

It is hard to be an effective teacher without a desk!  Our teachers in Soledad are in need of additional storage space as well as a large desktop which they can use to set up their lessons and supplies for each class, and which they can use for classroom demonstrations.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends and family

Commit to pray for the Tarahumara Indians in 2014

Consider going on RMC's annual short-term mission trip to Mexico in 2014




Subscribe to Receive LightShine Prayer Updates

* indicates required

story:
The author you want to support THE PRO HIGH HEEL WALKER

Writer, talker, walker, joker.

I tease and please.

I test and taste (I savor too).

Direct more than they find decent.

Quick, but some things I prefer long and slow.

I'm starting to believe that there's life without Nutella (but I won’t mind them funding me for the free ad).

Got into journalism when I was 19, but I've been writing fiction before that.

About to receive PhD in Communications.

Lived in Serbia and the States, travelled 65 countries (traces of that are seen in my stories).  

I've mastered the art of traveling light (light luggage and ultra light laptop). After all, I’m a hoarder when it comes to experiences, and all zen when it comes to products.

If you can't find me, I’m somewhere chasing summer around the world (in high heels, of course). In case you don’t know this basic truth - high heels and long legs can get you far!

The book you want to support ACTION, PLEASE!

Life and art, fiction and truth, business and pleasure always overlap in my life.

You’ll find me, and you’ll find yourself in the book.

In the lines belowe you will find some story titles (bolded) and you can imagine their taste.

There are pleasures with no orgasm. You find that early in your life. Later on, you may realize that there are orgasms that bring no pleasure. There are tops that don’t seem so high once we reach them. There is climaxing that feels like anticlimax.

I don’t know about you, but for me, still, there are no pleasures like orgasmic pleasures. I even let myself fall or jump in love just so I can make love!

I don’t know if you have an Oscar but I’ll tell you about XXX Oscar. I don’t know if you had sex with you friend but I’ll tell you about an Enemy Sex. I don’t know if you’ve got close with someone after receiving The First Aid but I’ll tell you about my mouth to mouth experience.

I don’t know if you’ve met a person that seems bigger than life, the one you would dedicate all your stories to but I’ll tell you about my Majestic One. I'll tell you about the Girl of my Life, too.

I don’t know if you say love and you mean sex but I’ll tell you about saying sex and meaning love.

Do you resist Temptations? Or you are seeking them? Do you make Mistakes? Have you found out that after fucking there's no use of regretting?

Can you recall the taste of at least One One Night Stand? Is sometimes one tone all it takes to bring on (selective) memories?

I don’t know how often you lie but I’ll tell you what I say when they ask my number (and, no, not a phone number). What's your number?

The cover girl or The Girl Next Door? Does it have to be either or? Monogamy or polygamy? I don’t know what is your choice but I’ll tell you about my wanderings. I’ll tell you about my self-training.

Do you know what can happen in 9 months? And nine minutes?

Does sometimes everything flow with No Words?

Do you live in Some Other World? Is it all Just a Dream? Magic? I’ll tell you what can happen when one sobers up.

Have you spent a Night in the Desert? Have you found a Desert Rose? Is your life Crazy but True? 

I don’t know if you’ve been to Ada, Caribbean, Maldives but I’ll take you around several continents.

I don’t know if your ordinary day is filled with movie scenes, I don’t know if you believe in happyendings, and if you were missing your hometown in the middle of Hollywood but I’ll tell you about the moment when I said good bye to Hollywood (No more movies - bye bye Hollywood).

Do you feel that sometimes there are Too Many Coincidences? Have you realized that it was Meant to Be that way? Do you feel like a Winner when all is said and done? Or maybe you reached the top but there is no top of the world feeling? Like Jagger said – I can get no satisfaction…

IMPORTANT:

There is no satisfaction guaranteed but try it, and maybe you bite on. 

Action With (No) Satisfaction.

Spit or swallow. But make sure you have a bite.

***

I NEED YOU, YOU NEED ME (and we all live happily) 

You need a book like this! OK, not all of you but some of you, for sure. 

The cover page is ready (as you can see).  And stories that you will find between the covers are ready, too but in Serbian. Now I want it in English. I know that not many of you can speak any Serbian, and google translator would not be of much help. 

I can do some translation but I sure need an extensive editing. So all funding received will be used for that. 

The first publishing option is CreateSpace, and with $12 you get a copy of the book, with $25 donation you receive the signed copy by the end of the year. If you need something extra, like asking questions about book, you can do it with donating a bit more, and then the options are email communication, skype or face to face. IMPORTANT: No body to body option available (unless it is a very indecent proposal alike the one in the movie with the same title).

story:
What I Need & What You Get

All supporters will receive printed guidebooks, Kindle eBooks, iBooks, and/or guided lessons from me. One printed guidebook will contain a hand-written personal message of thanks from me.

Every dollar I raise will go directly to West Wind Litho to print these guidebooks. West Wind Litho has printed 5 different books for me in the past and done a wonderful job on every one. So I am confident that they will come through on this one too.

West Wind Litho will produce 2,000 completed books for $14,147 or 3,000 books for $16,926. So you can see how much less expensive individual books become when you print in larger quantities. (See attached quote)

If I do not reach my $15,000 goal the funds will go toward the printing of as many books as this campaign will finance. The retail price may need to be adjusted higher as a result. But what you receive will not change.

Project Summary

I printed and self-published three small guides to Little Cottonwood Canyon in 2012 and 2013. The guides were very expensive because I only printed a few hundred. Despite the high cost and retail price, I was able to sell them all and break even. I also received invaluable feedback that I used in this new edition.

This campaign is very important to me. I have put thousands of hours and over 20 years of research into this guidebook. Although I have written other guides, this one is particularly special for these reasons:

1) It is the largest guide I've ever written (Over 1,000 routes, 590 pages) 

2) It is my favorite local climbing area.

3) I'm confident I can make a profit on this at a retail price of only $25.

Your support is the only way this project can succeed. I will be indebted to you for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute any money right now, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please get the word out. Tell all your climbing buddies about this campaign and please use the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thank you for your support!

Sincerely,

Tony Calderone

story:
In Dogs We Trust

Born of one veteran's journey through trauma recovery with his service dog Gander, In Dogs We Trust is a celebration of the relationship between canines and the humans they have saved. 

This book is a collection contains some of  the best short tales written by some of America's best writers. 

The book, if funded, will be published in time for Christmas and all profits from the sale will benefit veteran, service dog, PTSD and trauma suicide prevention, war dog and rescue dog charities. 

Authors already committed to the project:

Paul Owens ( The Dog Whisperer), Patricia McConnell ( The Other End of the Leash), Mike Ritland (Trident K-9 Warriors), Ted Kerasote (Meryl’s Door), Kevin Hanrahan ( War Dog Blogger), Robert W. Hill (Poet/Professor Emeritus), Stephanie Weaver (Golden Angels), Cheryl Arnold Moseley (Eye of the World), Alan Paul (Big In China), Lynn Bukowski ( Married to the Teams) and a host of others like you!

What We Need & What You Get

All funds raised will go toward design, editing, promotion and distribution needs:

  •  You will receive "something for something" perks: gifts worth at or more than your contribution. Donations are discouraged.
  •  There are autographed books, T-shirts, pet treats, and opportunities to host and meet Gander Service Dog and Veteran Traveler
  • We will scale the campaign in accordance with funds received. To do the best job possible to meet our post-publication goals, we need to reach our target. Charities chosen so far ( does not imply endorsement):
  • LZ-Grace Veterans Retreat 
  • National Mill Dog Rescue
  • Freedom Service Dogs
  • The War Dog Foundation
  • The Warrior Dog Foundation 

The Impact

  We have a chance to make a difference in the lives of veterans and civilians 

  •  Creating a one of a kind collection of extraordinary short stories
  •  Showcase gifted authors who have donated their time and talent to create much needed sustainable income for important charities
  •  Raise public awareness about the power of dogs to positively change lives changed by trauma...
  • You help celebrate rescue dogs, household heroes, and the trained champions that protect us at home and abroad...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Spread the word. Let's make this a bestseller!
  • Use the share tools: Post on FB, Twitter and anywhere it might help us reach our goal!

And that’s all there is to it.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
As some of you may or may not have seen, IS (Islamic State) is perpetrating a genocide on the minorities that fall under their rule.  They are butchering Christians, Shias, Yazidis and all that do not fall under their very narrow interpretation of religion.  One of the more nefarious actions they have taken is to pain the Arabic letter 'N' for Nasara (Arabic word for Christians) on the houses of Christians.  Thus they are marked out and punished given the choice of conversion or death.  

Sadly there has been a deafening silence to this ongoing atrocity, thus we have decided to raise awareness by asking people to wear a button with the 'N' on, to say today we are all Christians of Iraq, today we stand with the oppressed and will not remain silent.  As the world remained silent in the 1930's once again it repeats the mistake, we must as individuals say no, we will not allow this to happen on our watch. 

This will be part of wider campaign to raise awareness, all we are asking is if you can contribute even a few dollars to help with cost of production and shipping of the buttons.  We do not want to sell or make any profit but just to be able to cover the cost so we can provide them for free to those who require them.

story:
Update Jan. 17th 2015

Everything is coming together here in the last two weeks of January and I expect to be mailing out everything by the end of the month. Periodic updates are going on by email, so please make sure you are receiving those. Also, please head to http://goo.gl/forms/Kg1DpXEbqO and fill out the form to ensure your package is sent out on time.

Thanks!


What is The Horrible Plan of Horace Pickle?

This is a superhero genre novel written by Brian Hagan in 2008 and published in 2014 by Fantastic Journys Publishing. From the back of the book:

"Horace Pickle hates mashed potatoes, but now he has a plan.

Windsmith City is home to Baron, one of the world’s greatest heroes, who has decided to take his first vacation after decades of heroic service. But while Baron is enjoying himself in sunny Argentina, a new villain has come onto the scene with plans that reach far beyond the borders of their fair city. The people will have to rely on August, Baron’s sidekick and son of the late hero Neil Munch, to save them from this new threat."

You can get the first chapter free at www.HoracePickle.com

Lend a Geek a Hand

Did you know that even after a book is published, authors still have a ton of legwork to do? Promotion, distribution, and advertising is pretty much up to the writer, especially if (like me) you're the new guy.

This is why your help is so important. Instead of hoping that the right person will stumble upon my book online, I want to get my book to people who will appreciate it. This is a superhero novel, so when you buy your copy and are wondering where you want to send the other to, think of where comic book fans in your town tend to congregate. Comic shops, game shops, hobby shops... A lot of these are small, independently owned businesses and I simply can't find them all on my own.

If you're a regular in your shop, you can ask if it's okay for me to send one. Even if they don't want to stock my book for sale, it's still a free book. What nerd in their right mind says "No" to a free book?

Whether you send one to a local store, to a friend, or even to a library as a donation, thank you. You're heroes to me. 

So Where's the Money Going?

$5000 is a serious chunk of change, so here's what we're going to do with it:

  • 60% - 1000 BOOKS!
  • 15% - Your Kickbacks! Bonus - All of these kickbacks are being printed/crafted by small, locally owned businesses. By supporting me, you're supporting them as well. How cool is that? 
  • 10% - Mail All The Things!
  • 4-9% - Indiegogo/PayPal/etc. This varies depending on whether or not we hit our goal.

What about the extra 8ish percent? It goes to cover anything else that pops up, be it a bump in shipping prices, unexpected printing errors or whatever other wrench gets thrown in our plans. It's better to plan for these kinds of things. Contingency!

If things go smoothly and our math holds true, then it'll go to promote the book even more! I can hire artists to create some amazing art, get tables at conventions, print business cards, get signage - The list goes on. If we exceed our goal, this is where it's going to go.

Even if we don't hit our goal, we're still printing 1000 books. It'll be kick in the wallet, but we're doing it.

The Impact

Not only are you helping me spread the word about my book, you're also helping me write "The Single Deed of Emeril Battles," which is the sequel. My publisher is interested in it, but only if this book does well. If my publisher gets a bunch of shops calling them up and asking for books to sell, they'll know things are going great.

On a more basic level, you're helping me put food on the table for my family. I get a little bit of money for each book sold, whether it be online through Amazon or via a wholesale order placed by a shop with my publisher. Getting my book published was literally a dream come true, but making a living as a writer would be paradise.

Psst - There's a teaser for the next book in the back of your copy.

Still Not Sure?

You can actually read the opening of the book for free if you want. Go to HoracePickle.com and enter in your email. It'll be sent to you automatically. If it sounds like fun, come back here and get a copy!

Don't Want a Book?

That's fine. Maybe you're an ebook person, or just don't have the cash. Maybe you already have one. (In which case, thank you so much!) You can still help. The easiest way, obviously, is to share this campaign far and wide. Aside from that, there are other things you can do.

  • Is there a convention in your town? Even if it's the smallest comicon on the East Coast, I want to know about it! Send me an email with the info, and who knows? Maybe you can buy a copy there in person.
  • Frequent your local nerdy shops? Let me know about them! I'm getting a lot of books printed and I want to send them places.
  • Ebook Fan? That's cool. Click here for the Kindle version and click here for Nook. You're still helping out by letting my publisher know that their gamble on the new guy was worth it.
  • If you've read it, you can write a review on Goodreads here.
  • Follow my social media on Twitter and Facebook.

Again, thank you so much for buying books, spreading the word, and helping me live my dream.

Have a Good Day.

- Brian


Thanks to John Fascetti for helping me film, and Dreux Priore for the music!

UPDATE 1
Have a look at the latest progress of the Windsmith City artwork! This is the image that will be used for the poster and some of the post cards. The artwork being done by Delofasht is amazing. Check it out!

UPDATE 2
Are you in the Pittsburgh, PA area? Don't miss the book party on Nov. 8th! I'll be at ToonSeum from 7pm to 10pm with a live music performance by Dreux Priore, free food, and lots of fun to be had. You can find out more at Meetup.com and Facebook.

Keep Checking Back, More Announcements are Coming!

story:
Hi, I'm Daniel Boughen. I've been teaching novice growers for over a decade, and talking to people who use Cannabis for many years, helping provide organic, common sense answers to growing questions put to me by my many students. I finally put it all in a book, and TrineDay Press kindly published Medical Growing: a Garden of Peace in 2012, and it sold worldwide. Folks seemed to enjoy it, so we decided to update and expand in a second edition, and introduce the stories of many of those people.

Between 2012 and today, I've continued to be deeply inspired and truly amazed by the bravery of others, who took the plunge and began using Cannabis as medicine. Although I was happy with the first edition, I felt that in the second edition these modern warriors needed to be included in the narrative, and so I asked them to contribute to a more inclusive group project to make improvements and take the second edition to the next level, where the patients speak out about their experiences.

Bringing these people together to speak to the world is what makes the second edition so special for me personally. My friend Ted Smith's years of dedication to the Cannabis Community (opening the first dispensary in Canada in Victoria in 1996, founding Hempology 101, and publisher of the Cannabis Digest Magazine and website, and his important role in the Supreme Court Of Canada: R v Owen Smith) made him a natural choice to author the new forward, Ted's kindness and compassion set a solid example for members of the Cannabis and activist communities everywhere,

I hope that the sincerity of these people's voices will help bring "Cannabis Medicine" an increased credibility as a concept for healing and wellness closer to the very forefront of our medical practice, something we are in desperate need of in the midst of national drug crises.

Your contribution can help me start the conversation with people who, until now haven't heard any of this important information. I thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity, and for helping me to help others.

All funds donated go directly to TrineDay Press for Printing. Donate for your advance copy now, or register for one of our perks! And don't forget to share this campaign to help us reach our goal, using your Facebook, Twitter, and all the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Thank you in advance for helping support this project!

Daniel Boughen

story:
About this project

PERIODS.

They help us keep in touch with our bodies, bond us with our fellow bleeders, track time and cyclical changes, and create relief, panic, surprise and frustration. They also lead to some embarrassing stories and moments of delight. And even though periods are natural and normal, they get a bad reputation for being gross, annoying and inconvenient.

Today, periods are going mainstream: NPR dubbed 2015 the year of the period and Newsweek called 2016 the year of menstrual change.

As a public health practitioner and sexual health advocate, I wanted to create the Period Coloring Book as a way to embrace, celebrate and reflect upon our shared experiences with menstruation. 

From leaks, cramps, cups and pads to period sex and free bleeding, this book aims to help start more open and positive conversations about periods. Get ready for 30+ pages of illustrations for your coloring pleasure.

Show a little period love by backing the Period Coloring Book! Shout outs on your favorite social networks are always appreciated ;)

 

 

 

Some sample images from the book:

 

Tell me more!

Who are you?

I am a public health practitioner, design strategist and bleeder who started my career as a sexual health educator in Calgary, Canada. I am passionate about promoting sexual health and preventing sexual violence through the power of knowledge, empowerment and choice. I'm based in Toronto and NYC.

How do I use this book?

Color in solitude or with others, it’s up to you. I recommend coloring in the company of your best buds so you can have some straight up period talk. Did someone say period coloring book party? ;)  

How did you come up with this idea?

This has been a personal project for me. After speaking with some friends, I realized that there wasn’t a lot of conversation out there about people’s lived experiences with periods, so I started to illustrate these moments. As I began to show illustrations to people, I found that they would spark intimate conversations about periods. I hope that the book can be a fun way to help people reflect upon and talk about their own experiences with menstruation.

What kind of topics do you cover in the book and how did you come up with them?

I came up with topics mostly by talking to people who have or have had periods, my personal experiences, and online conversations and research. Topics? Everything from cramps, bloating, PMS, period poops, menopause, pads, period underwear, tampons, period showers…to the experience of using tampons, managing periods and period leaks.

Can I expect a little nudity?

Yes! Nudity is classy and intentional.

What are the specs of the book?

I plan to create a softcover book: 6”x9” and 30+ pages of illustrations.

How will you spend the money you raise on IndieGogo?

Production: Printing and shipping the book.

What are the risks/challenges of this project?

Though many pages are done, the book is still a work in progress: I will edit it and replace/add illustrations. I welcome your ideas too: Email me at hello@andrealyip.com. Following that, I'll be working with a printer and prepping the books to ship out to you. I don't anticipate any major road blocks but will keep you informed if anything comes up.

What is your timeline?

November '16: IndieGogo Campaign!

December '16: Edit/add images

January '17: Finalize book design

February '17: Print the book and get it ready to ship

March '17: Shipments out!

Are you working with anyone on this?

I have been working closely with my partner, Wojciech, who is helping me manage the 'behind-the-scenes' logistics of this campaign. There have also been a lot of AMAZING folks who have been supportive of this project. From advice to feedback to taking photos to writing articles, thank you!

Where can I read more about this project?

We've been covered in Teen Vogue, The Huffington Post, HuffPo UK, Clue, Bustle, Thinx, MetroUK, The Independent and Hello Giggles.

Questions?

If you have any questions about the project or if you have ideas or suggestions of ways to collaborate please get in touch.  You can email Andrea at hello@andrealyip.com.
