story:
La escalada de boulder

Es un tipo de escalada que se practica sin cuerda tanto en interior como en exterior. Para asegurar al escalador en caso de caída se utilizan colchonetas cuyo espesor permite amortiguar la recepción. La escalada conjuga cuerpo y mente, trabajando  elasticidad,  fuerza y estrategia. Es un deporte que garantiza una práctica dinámica y divertida ya seas debutante o experimentado,  así tengas 5 o 99 años.

CAMPO 4

Somos cuatro socios – un Ecuatoriano y tres Franceses. Tres, fanáticos de la escalda que han recorrido los mejores spots naturales así como prestigiosas salas de boulder en Europa, y un cuarto socio que se acaba de incorporar a este fantástico mundo.

El proyecto se constituye al constatar que la ciudad de Quito, situada a 2850 metros de altura, capital de un país con una exuberante naturaleza y lugares de escalda excepcionales, requiere de una sala de boulder que satisfaga tanto las exigencias de un escalador experimentado como la diversión para toda la familia.

Campo 4 propondrá cerca de 300m2 de superficie para escalar, muros de hasta 4,3 metros de altura, diferentes tipos de vías accesibles a todos los niveles, las mismas  que se rediseñarán periódicamente para crear novedad y desafio.

Además, el espacio dispondrá de un sauna, una sala de yoga y un bar en el cual encontraras jugos naturales, todo tipo de bebidas y algo para picar.

La sala se encuentra ubicada en pleno centro-norte de Quito, entre la 10 de Agosto, la Naciones Unidas y la América, a 10 minutos a pie del centro comercial QUICENTRO,  5 min del CCI y a dos cuadras de la plaza de la Américas.

Nuestro objetivo es satisfacer tanto a los más experimentados escaladores como a aquellos que desean descubrir este deporte, y así ampliar la comunidad de escaladores de Quito, proponiendo instalaciones y servicios de calidad.

La construcción de la sala, como se puede ver en nuestra página facebook : https://www.facebook.com/campo4quito,  avanza a buen ritmo, ahora  necesitamos realizar compras indispensables, como las colchonetas y  presas (importadas de Europa).  2000 USD son el apoyo que necesitaríamos para avanzar en  nuestro proyecto y  abrir la sala lo más rápido posible.

¿Escalas? ¿No habías oído hablar de este deporte antes?  Ayúdanos y recibe entradas con ventajas especiales. ¡Ven a descubrir en nuestra sala este deporte completo y divertido!

_____________________________________________________________________________


L’escalade de bloc 

Il s’agit d’un style d’escalade qui se pratique sans cordes aussi bien en intérieur qu’en extérieur.  Des tapis assurent la réception en cas de chute. C’est un sport alliant souplesse, stratégie, force et mental, fun à pratiquer que l’on soit débutant ou grimpeur chevronné, de 5 à 99 ans !

CAMPO 4 

Nous sommes quatre associés – Un Equatorien et trois Français. Trois passionnés d’escalade ayant écumé les meilleurs sites naturels et salles de blocs d’Europe ainsi qu’un nouveau venu dans la communauté des grimpeurs. C’est suite à un constat simple que le projet voit le jour : la cité de Quito, perchée à 2850 mètres d’altitude, capitale d’un pays à la nature exubérante offrant des spots d’escalade exceptionnels, mérite une vraie salle de bloc qui satisfasse les exigences des grimpeurs aguerris et accueille les familles pour de bons moments de divertissement.

CAMPO 4 proposera près de 300 m2 de surface grimpable, des murs jusqu’à 4,3 mètres de haut, tous types de voies accessibles à tous les niveaux et régulièrement renouvelées. L’espace disposera en outre d’un sauna, d’une salle dédiée au yoga, d’un bar qui proposera des jus de fruits frais, bières et autres boissons, et de quoi grignoter en cas de petit creux.  

La salle jouit d’une situation idéale en plein centre-nord de Quito, entre la 10 de Agosto, la Naciones Unidas y la America, à 10 minutes à pieds du centre commercial QUICENTRO, 5 minutes du centre commercial IÑAQUITO…

Notre objectif est de satisfaire les plus expérimentés comme les débutants, et d’agrandir la communauté de grimpeurs de Quito et sa région, en proposant des installations et des services de qualité.

Comme vous pouvez le voir en visitant notre page Facebook la construction de la salle avance à un très bon rythme : https://www.facebook.com/campo4quito

Pour l’heure nous avons besoin de réaliser des achats indispensables, comme les tapis de chute et les prises (importées d’Europe). 2000 USD nous aideraient à réaliser notre projet et ouvrir la salle dans les meilleurs délais.

Vous êtes grimpeur ? Vous ne l’êtes pas encore ? Aidez-nous et recevez des entrées et autres avantages ; venez découvrir notre salle et un sport incroyablement fun et complet !
story_txt:
La escalada de boulderEs un tipo de escalada que se practica sin cuerda tanto en interior como en exterior. Para asegurar al escalador en caso de caída se utilizan colchonetas cuyo espesor permite amortiguar la recepción. La escalada conjuga cuerpo y mente, trabajando  elasticidad,  fuerza y estrategia. Es un deporte que garantiza una práctica dinámica y divertida ya seas debutante o experimentado,  así tengas 5 o 99 años.CAMPO 4Somos cuatro socios – un Ecuatoriano y tres Franceses. Tres, fanáticos de la escalda que han recorrido los mejores spots naturales así como prestigiosas salas de boulder en Europa, y un cuarto socio que se acaba de incorporar a este fantástico mundo. El proyecto se constituye al constatar que la ciudad de Quito, situada a 2850 metros de altura, capital de un país con una exuberante naturaleza y lugares de escalda excepcionales, requiere de una sala de boulder que satisfaga tanto las exigencias de un escalador experimentado como la diversión para toda la familia.Campo 4 propondrá cerca de 300m2 de superficie para escalar, muros de hasta 4,3 metros de altura, diferentes tipos de vías accesibles a todos los niveles, las mismas  que se rediseñarán periódicamente para crear novedad y desafio. Además, el espacio dispondrá de un sauna, una sala de yoga y un bar en el cual encontraras jugos naturales, todo tipo de bebidas y algo para picar.La sala se encuentra ubicada en pleno centro-norte de Quito, entre la 10 de Agosto, la Naciones Unidas y la América, a 10 minutos a pie del centro comercial QUICENTRO,  5 min del CCI y a dos cuadras de la plaza de la Américas.Nuestro objetivo es satisfacer tanto a los más experimentados escaladores como a aquellos que desean descubrir este deporte, y así ampliar la comunidad de escaladores de Quito, proponiendo instalaciones y servicios de calidad. La construcción de la sala, como se puede ver en nuestra página facebook : https://www.facebook.com/campo4quito,  avanza a buen ritmo, ahora  necesitamos realizar compras indispensables, como las colchonetas y  presas (importadas de Europa).  2000 USD son el apoyo que necesitaríamos para avanzar en  nuestro proyecto y  abrir la sala lo más rápido posible. ¿Escalas? ¿No habías oído hablar de este deporte antes?  Ayúdanos y recibe entradas con ventajas especiales. ¡Ven a descubrir en nuestra sala este deporte completo y divertido!_____________________________________________________________________________
L’escalade
de bloc 
Il s’agit d’un
style d’escalade qui se pratique sans cordes aussi bien en intérieur qu’en
extérieur.  Des tapis assurent la réception en cas de chute. C’est un
sport alliant souplesse, stratégie, force et mental, fun à pratiquer que l’on
soit débutant ou grimpeur chevronné, de 5 à 99 ans !
CAMPO
4  
Nous sommes quatre
associés – Un Equatorien et trois Français. Trois passionnés d’escalade ayant
écumé les meilleurs sites naturels et salles de blocs d’Europe ainsi qu’un
nouveau venu dans la communauté des grimpeurs. C’est suite à un constat simple
que le projet voit le jour : la cité de Quito, perchée à 2850 mètres
d’altitude, capitale d’un pays à la nature exubérante offrant des spots
d’escalade exceptionnels, mérite une vraie salle de bloc qui satisfasse les
exigences des grimpeurs aguerris et accueille les familles pour de bons moments
de divertissement.
CAMPO
4 proposera près de 300 m2 de surface grimpable, des
murs jusqu’à 4,3 mètres de haut, tous types de voies accessibles à tous les
niveaux et régulièrement renouvelées. L’espace disposera en outre d’un sauna,
d’une salle dédiée au yoga, d’un bar qui proposera des jus de fruits frais,
bières et autres boissons, et de quoi grignoter en cas de petit creux.
 
La salle jouit
d’une situation idéale en plein centre-nord de Quito, entre la 10 de Agosto,
la Naciones Unidas y la America, à 10 minutes à pieds du centre
commercial QUICENTRO, 5 minutes du centre commercial IÑAQUITO…
Notre objectif est
de satisfaire les plus expérimentés comme les débutants, et d’agrandir la
communauté de grimpeurs de Quito et sa région, en proposant des installations
et des services de qualité.
Comme vous pouvez
le voir en visitant notre page Facebook la construction de la salle avance
à un très bon rythme :
https://www.facebook.com/campo4quito
Pour l’heure nous
avons besoin de réaliser des achats indispensables, comme les tapis de chute et
les prises (importées d’Europe). 2000 USD nous aideraient à réaliser
notre projet et ouvrir la salle dans les meilleurs délais.
Vous êtes
grimpeur ? Vous ne l’êtes pas encore ? Aidez-nous et recevez des
entrées et autres avantages ; venez découvrir notre salle et un sport
incroyablement fun et complet !

story:
Dragi čitatelji i čitateljice, simpatizeri i simpatizerke, prijatelji i prijateljice, crowdfunding kampanja našeg portala danas je završena. U mjesec dana njezinog trajanja prikupili smo novac za rad u tekućoj godini. Točan iznos prikupljenog novca objavit ćemo nakon što podvučemo crtu pod račun protekloga mjeseca. Okvirno možemo reći da je u kampanji prikupljeno, nadamo se, blizu 40.000 dolara. Ono što želimo naglasiti jeste da su vaše donacije, riječi podrške i solidarni, drugarski angažman u našoj kampanji pretvorili borbu za opstanak u festival optimizma. Bez lažne skromnosti možemo reći: Lupiga nikad nije bila jača, naša redakcija odavno nije imala ovoliko elana i volje za rad. U kampanji nismo dobili samo novac. Dobili smo krila. 

Hvala vam za sve, ostanite s nama.  

20.01. 2018. Vaša Lupiga

________________________________________

Dragi ljudi na svim stranama svijeta, na istoku, sjeveru, zapadu i jugu. Lupiga je uspjela! 

Uspjeli smo u deset dana doći do cilja i osigurati polovicu minimalnog iznosa za osnovno funkcioniranje redakcije. Na Indiegogo platformi ostalo nam je još 21 dan kampanje. Moramo priznati, takav val solidarnosti nismo očekivali. Nismo očekivali da toliki broj ljudi i organizacija razumije kakvu potrebu društvo ima za slobodnim novinarstvom, za novinarstvom bez gazde. Nismo znali da je Lupiga u ovakvoj mjeri prepoznata kao adresa takvog novinarstva. 

Znali smo koliko smo čitani, ali nismo, međutim, znali da među našim čitateljima i čitateljicama ima toliko onih kojima je do Lupige stalo do te mjere da su iz vlastitog džepa spremni financirati naš rad. Podcijenili smo i sebe i vas. Podcijenili smo činjenicu da ima dovoljno razboritih ljudi, koji ne pristaju na pranje mozga. Priznajemo da smo iznenađeni i zatečeni. Zahvaljujući vašoj podršci, u novu godinu ulazimo mirniji i hrabriji, ali i ambiciozniji da se posvetimo novinarstvu do kojeg nam je svima stalo. 

Sada nam nije ostalo ništa drugo nego da idemo do kraja. Ono što prikupimo do 19. siječnja, do kraja kampanje, mogao bi biti jedini izvor financiranja do neodređeno udaljenog nam datuma. Stoga ćemo postaviti novi cilj, dodatnih 9.999 dolara. Uspijemo li skupiti i ovaj iznos, što bi za naše pojmove i financijske okvire u kojima se trenutno krećemo bilo ravno znanstvenoj fantastici, sav novac utrošit ćemo na angažman novih autora, koji su na našim prostorima također prepoznati kao adresa dobrog i beskompromisnog novinarstva. Imena autora i autorica koji su do sada objavljivali na Lupigi nećemo bacati pred vas kao mamac, jer svaki autor i autorica podjednako su nam važni. Baš kao i svaki čitatelj i svaka čitateljica. Možemo vam tek garantirati da ćete od ljudi koji pristanu na suradnju s Lupigom dobiti iskrene i argumentirane stavove. S nekima od njih ćete se složiti, s nekim drugima nećete, ali i u jednom i u drugom slučaju bit ćete sigurni da ste pročitali autentično mišljenje, iza kojeg ne stoje zadnje namjere kao što su reklamiranje, prikrivanje, manipuliranje i sve ono čega smo se u javnom prostoru nagledali za deset života. 

Idemo dalje s kampanjom, zato jer želimo biti snažno prisutni u javnom prostoru, zato jer želimo biti jaki, zato jer želimo stajati na položajima s kojih su gazde većine medija i njihovi politički i kontroverzni poduzetni partneri odavno naredili povlačenje. Idemo dalje zato jer vidimo da nas ima i zato jer ovu priliku ne možemo propustiti. Znamo da iduću nećemo dobiti tako skoro. Ima nas! Još uvijek nas ima dovoljno!

#ImanasJOŠ

*** Lupigi možete donirati i izravno na žiro-račun, putem opće uplatnice ili internetskog bankarstva. Podatke možete pronaći na ovom linku. Cijenimo svaku podršku.

________________________________________

 (Scroll down for the English or Deutsch version!)

"Slobodno novinarstvo može biti dobro ili loše, ali posve sigurno je da bez slobode novinarstvo ne može biti ništa drugo osim loše." Tako je govorio Albert Camus, filozof, pisac i veliki novinar. Prije 16 godina, kad smo počinjali, velike nam riječi nisu značile ništa. Činilo nam se da svijet funkcionira baš kako treba funkcionirati. U internet klubu Lupillus napravili smo portal Lupiga.Com. Tadašnji početnici iz gradskih rubrika kod nas su napisali prve kolumne i stekli prve redovne čitatelje. Tu je Edo Maajka bacao prve zagrebačke rime, Marčelo iz Beograda slao prve literarne pokušaje. Tu su na grubom brušenju bili današnji televizijski producenti i svoje talente otkrivali sadašnji audio-vizualni stručnjaci. Neki su ubrzo lansirani među zvijezde, a Lupiga je već 2004. godine dobila nagradu VIDI Top ten u kategoriji medija. 

Pred nama se otvarao jasan put ka uspjehu, možda i zaradi: pisati kratke tekstove o svemu i svačemu, s naglaskom na plitke afere i duboke dekoltee. Tako smo se mogli nadati nekoj zaradi. Ali, nismo mogli pisati kratke vijesti, naročito ne o plitkim aferama i dubokim dekolteima. Nismo tako zamišljali novinarstvo. Bila bi to uvreda svemu u što smo vjerovali: uvreda Feralu i lavovskoj novinarskoj borbi Drage Hedla, raskošnom stilu Igora Mandića, rečenici Veselka Tenžere, građanskoj hrabrosti Ankice Lepej, znatiželjnom, istraživačkom duhu Jasne Babić... 

Na "pravom" poslu radili smo udarnički, u slobodno vrijeme na Lupigi - volonterski. I tako 12 godina. Lupiga je bivala sve veća i veća. I onda dolazi ta 2013. godina kada smo dobili potporu Ministarstva kulture. Naša mala neprofitna medijska scena je jačala. Sa skromnom državnom potporom izrastao je cijeli niz medija bez lažnih vijesti i dubokih dekoltea. Zanimalo nas je istraživačko novinarstvo, mukotrpno kopanje po troškovima Katoličke crkve, skandalozne privatizacije, nestale tvrtke, Todorić u vrijeme dok je u džepu imao ministre i premijere, zapostavljena kultura i umjetnost,pregaženi u ovom sistemu, rodna, nacionalna i ekonomska ravnopravnost… Čitanost je rasla. Najbolji je to dokaz da društvo ne traži samo guzice i sise.

Kada je jedna garnitura smijenila drugu, mi smo bili prvi na dnevnom redu. Novinarstvo kakvo mi želimo njegovati nije po ukusu moćnih. Ne treba istraživati, treba zabavljati; ne treba kritizirati, treba kombinirati. Ne treba zabadati nos u tuđe poslove i propitivati kakvo smo društvo stvorili i kakvim ćemo ga ostaviti za svoju djecu. 

Nama se, ipak, čini da je novinarstvo "pisanje onoga što drugi ne žele objaviti", a da su "sve drugo tek odnosi s javnošću", kako je to rekao drugi veliki novinar, George Orwell. O da, danas vjerujemo da nam velike riječi o slobodnom novinarstvu nisu ostavljene slučajno. Ostavljene su kao upozorenje. Dobro novinarstvo jest jedan od stupova zdravog društva. Zato želimo pisati o ozbiljnim stvarima, objavljivati istraživačke serijale i prokazivati anomalije našeg društva, društva u kojem je moguće da su ratni zločinci heroji i u kojem politika i kapital nezaustavljivo nasrću na javna dobra. Samo na taj način možemo ga i znamo činiti boljim. Želimo dati prostor ljudima koji imaju što reći i pokazati. 

Tijekom godine na izmaku, Lupiga ne samo da je uspjela preživjeti, nego je bila i vrlo vidljiva u javnom prostoru, otvarala teme i davala drugačiji pogled na društvene probleme. U toj su godini dvije naše novinarke - Melisa Skender i Jasna Babić - dobile godišnje nagrade Hrvatskog novinarskog društva. 

Živjeli smo na pogon novinarske strasti i podrške prijatelja. Sad se obraćamo vama, našim čitateljima i čitateljicama, simpatizerkama i simpatizerima, svima koji vjeruju da je važno pomoći da se na životu održi jedan slobodan medij. 

Želimo vam svakog dana iduće godine predstaviti barem jednu ozbiljnu temu - ozbiljnim tekstom, fotografijom i videom, koji neće sramotiti profesiju. Po jedan dobar tekst svih 365 dana. Novac koji pokušavamo skupiti, naravno, nije dovoljan da pokrije realnu, poštenu, cijenu svih tih tekstova, stoga će Lupiga osigurati ostatak, po principu – pola mi, a pola vi.

Sav prikupljen novac namijenit ćemo isključivo našim suradnicama i suradnicima, kao naknadu za njihov rad. Cilj je da Lupiga ostane neovisna redakcija, koju nitko ne može spriječiti da govori o temama o kojima se u našem društvu izbjegava govoriti - o političkim moćnicima i ljudima koji vjeruju da novcem mogu platiti i javnu šutnju. Danas je jasno da slobodan može biti samo onaj medij čiji su jedini vlasnici njegovi čitatelji i novinari. Medij bez gazde.

Na ovom mjestu zahvaljujemo svim našim kolegama, prijateljima i simpatizerima koji su nam pomogli u pripremi ove kampanje. 

Pozivamo u pomoć sve vas koji znate da bez slobodnog novinarstva nema ni slobodnog društva. Nikada nismo jedni drugima bili potrebniji. 

Donirajte Lupigu, zajedno ćemo biti glasniji.

 

*** Lupigi možete donirati i izravno na žiro-račun, putem opće uplatnice ili internetskog bankarstva. Podatke možete pronaći na ovom linku. Cijenimo svaku podršku.

 

"A free press can, of course, be good or bad, but, most certainly without freedom, the press will never be anything but bad," said Albert Camus, a philosopher, writer and a fellow journalist.

When we started 16 years ago, big words did not mean much to us. It seemed like the world was on the right track. A group of journalists, friends and colleagues who met up regularly at Lupillus, their favorite watering hole in Zagreb, decided to put together Lupiga.com. Rookie journalists would break their first stories and run their first columns on Lupiga, and build a loyal readership.

This was where Edo Maajka, a rapper from Bosnia, put together his first Zagreb rhymes. Marčelo from Belgrade sent us his first literary attempts. This is where some of today's TV producers tested their journalistic prowess, and some audio-visual artists discovered their talents. Some of them ended up launching star-studded careers, and by 2004 Lupiga won the VIDI Top ten media award.
 
A path to success was opening for us, to big money perhaps: all we needed to do was write short stories about everything and nothing, about shallow corruptive affairs and deep cleavages. But we don't see journalism that way. It would be a disgrace to everything we believe in; an insult to Feral Tribune and the persistent fight of our colleague Drago Hedl, an affront to Igor Mandic's splendid writing style and to Veselko Tenzera's sentences, a slight to whistleblower Ankica Lepej's citizen courage, an indignity to Jasna Babić's curiosity and investigative spirit.

At our "real" jobs (read: full-time day jobs) we worked like hell – but our free time and our passion belonged to Lupiga. It continued for the next 12 years. Lupiga grew bigger and bigger. Then came the end of 2013, and for the first time Lupiga received a grant from the Ministry of Culture. Out small nonprofit community began to thrive. With just a small financial injection, we created a brand new media environment – a website that rose to prominence without fake news or „titty bait“.

We were into investigative journalism, digging through Catholic church finance, scandalous takeovers of public companies, an industry brought to its knees. We wrote about Croatian oligarchs, the neglected cultural scene, about people being run over by the system, about gender, national and economic equality – and our audience grew. And it was the obvious proof that the public isn't only interested in tits and ass.

When the political climate shifted, free media was the first to face cuts. Journalism as we see it did not satisfy the tastes of those in power. They fancy entertainment over journalism, obscure arrangements over vocal criticism. We're not supposed to stick our noses into their businesses or question what kind of society we are leaving to our children.

But for us, it seemed that journalism "is printing what someone else does not want printed“ and that „everything else is public relations”, like anoother great journalist, George Orwell, said. Today we know that those words were not left to us by chance. They were left to us as warnings. Free press is one of the supporting pillars of a healthy society – but a pillar that needs support as well. That's why we want to write about what matters, in-depth investigative stories, pointing out anomalies in society – a society that allows convicted war criminals to become heroes, while politics and big money exploit public good. 

It's the only way we can make it better. By providing space – and a platform – for people who have something to say.

In the year we leave behind, Lupiga not only managed to survive, but offered new perspectives, opening important discussions. Two of our journalists, Melisa Skender and Jasna Babić, received the annual awards of the Croatian Journalism Society.

Lupiga was driven by journalism, passion and support from friends and colleagues. Now we come to you, our readers, sympathizers, all of you who believe that keeping free media alive is important.

Lupiga wants to provide you with at least an article, a photograph or video that counts, every day, 365 times a year. The amount we are asking for will not cover a fair price for the authors, but it does cover half. It will be spent on our contributors, as a pay for their work. The goal is to keep Lupiga independent, resistant to pressure from those who think that silence can be bought. It is clear that the only free media is the one owned by its readers and journalists. A media outlet – without a big boss.

A big thank you to all of our colleagues, friends and sympathizers that helped us prepare this campaign, helping us reach out to people aware of the fact that without free press there is no free society. We need each other. 

Donate to Lupiga, so we can be louder together!

 

*** You can contribute to Lupiga by donating directly to our bank account, by payment slip or e-banking. All the details can be found on this link. We appreciate your support.

 

Kurze Version

Liebe Freunde,

die Pressefreiheit in Kroatien (EU-Mitglied seit 2013) wird auf subtile oder auch weniger subtile Art regelmäßig unterwandert. Die unabhängigen Internetportale in dem kleinen, aber leider politisch und vor allem rechtsstaatlich nicht besonders stabilen Land an der Adria kämpfen ums Überleben, etwa das Portal für kritischen Journalismus Lupiga, dessen Crowdfunding-Kampagne ich gerne unterstütze. Eine Erklärung in englischer Sprache ist im beigefügten Beitrag im zweiten Teil zu lesen.

Attraktive Preise warten auf großzügige Unterstützer, etwa Eintrittskarten für das wunderbare Filmfestival in Motovun/Istrien oder ein Glas Rotwein im Café Jazz in Frankfurt... Aber Ihr könnt Lupiga auch mit dem Teilen dieser Nachricht helfen.

*** Sie können Ihre Spende direkt auf unser Bankkonto, per Einzahlungsschein oder E-Banking einzahlen. Einzelheiten finden Sie unter diesem Link. Wir danken Ihnen für Ihre Unterstützung!

S nekima od njih ćete se složiti, s nekim drugima nećete, ali i u jednom i u drugom slučaju bit ćete sigurni da ste pročitali autentično mišljenje, iza kojeg ne stoje zadnje namjere kao što su reklamiranje, prikrivanje, manipuliranje i sve ono čega smo se u javnom prostoru nagledali za deset života. Idemo dalje s kampanjom, zato jer želimo biti snažno prisutni u javnom prostoru, zato jer želimo biti jaki, zato jer želimo stajati na položajima s kojih su gazde većine medija i njihovi politički i kontroverzni poduzetni partneri odavno naredili povlačenje. Idemo dalje zato jer vidimo da nas ima i zato jer ovu priliku ne možemo propustiti. Znamo da iduću nećemo dobiti tako skoro. Ima nas! Još uvijek nas ima dovoljno!#ImanasJOŠ*** Lupigi možete donirati i izravno na žiro-račun, putem opće uplatnice ili internetskog bankarstva. Podatke možete pronaći na ovom linku. Cijenimo svaku podršku.________________________________________ (Scroll down for the English or Deutsch version!)"Slobodno novinarstvo može biti dobro ili loše, ali posve sigurno je da bez slobode novinarstvo ne može biti ništa drugo osim loše." Tako je govorio Albert Camus, filozof, pisac i veliki novinar. Prije 16 godina, kad smo počinjali, velike nam riječi nisu značile ništa. Činilo nam se da svijet funkcionira baš kako treba funkcionirati. U internet klubu Lupillus napravili smo portal Lupiga.Com. Tadašnji početnici iz gradskih rubrika kod nas su napisali prve kolumne i stekli prve redovne čitatelje. Tu je Edo Maajka bacao prve zagrebačke rime, Marčelo iz Beograda slao prve literarne pokušaje. Tu su na grubom brušenju bili današnji televizijski producenti i svoje talente otkrivali sadašnji audio-vizualni stručnjaci. Neki su ubrzo lansirani među zvijezde, a Lupiga je već 2004. godine dobila nagradu VIDI Top ten u kategoriji medija. Pred nama se otvarao jasan put ka uspjehu, možda i zaradi: pisati kratke tekstove o svemu i svačemu, s naglaskom na plitke afere i duboke dekoltee. Tako smo se mogli nadati nekoj zaradi. Ali, nismo mogli pisati kratke vijesti, naročito ne o plitkim aferama i dubokim dekolteima. Nismo tako zamišljali novinarstvo. Bila bi to uvreda svemu u što smo vjerovali: uvreda Feralu i lavovskoj novinarskoj borbi Drage Hedla, raskošnom stilu Igora Mandića, rečenici Veselka Tenžere, građanskoj hrabrosti Ankice Lepej, znatiželjnom, istraživačkom duhu Jasne Babić... Na "pravom" poslu radili smo udarnički, u slobodno vrijeme na Lupigi - volonterski. I tako 12 godina. Lupiga je bivala sve veća i veća. I onda dolazi ta 2013. godina kada smo dobili potporu Ministarstva kulture. Naša mala neprofitna medijska scena je jačala. Sa skromnom državnom potporom izrastao je cijeli niz medija bez lažnih vijesti i dubokih dekoltea. Zanimalo nas je istraživačko novinarstvo, mukotrpno kopanje po troškovima Katoličke crkve, skandalozne privatizacije, nestale tvrtke, Todorić u vrijeme dok je u džepu imao ministre i premijere, zapostavljena kultura i umjetnost,pregaženi u ovom sistemu, rodna, nacionalna i ekonomska ravnopravnost… Čitanost je rasla. Najbolji je to dokaz da društvo ne traži samo guzice i sise.Kada je jedna garnitura smijenila drugu, mi smo bili prvi na dnevnom redu. Novinarstvo kakvo mi želimo njegovati nije po ukusu moćnih. Ne treba istraživati, treba zabavljati; ne treba kritizirati, treba kombinirati. Ne treba zabadati nos u tuđe poslove i propitivati kakvo smo društvo stvorili i kakvim ćemo ga ostaviti za svoju djecu. Nama se, ipak, čini da je novinarstvo "pisanje onoga što drugi ne žele objaviti", a da su "sve drugo tek odnosi s javnošću", kako je to rekao drugi veliki novinar, George Orwell. O da, danas vjerujemo da nam velike riječi o slobodnom novinarstvu nisu ostavljene slučajno. Ostavljene su kao upozorenje. Dobro novinarstvo jest jedan od stupova zdravog društva. Zato želimo pisati o ozbiljnim stvarima, objavljivati istraživačke serijale i prokazivati anomalije našeg društva, društva u kojem je moguće da su ratni zločinci heroji i u kojem politika i kapital nezaustavljivo nasrću na javna dobra. Samo na taj način možemo ga i znamo činiti boljim. Želimo dati prostor ljudima koji imaju što reći i pokazati. Tijekom godine na izmaku, Lupiga ne samo da je uspjela preživjeti, nego je bila i vrlo vidljiva u javnom prostoru, otvarala teme i davala drugačiji pogled na društvene probleme. U toj su godini dvije naše novinarke - Melisa Skender i Jasna Babić - dobile godišnje nagrade Hrvatskog novinarskog društva. Živjeli smo na pogon novinarske strasti i podrške prijatelja. Sad se obraćamo vama, našim čitateljima i čitateljicama, simpatizerkama i simpatizerima, svima koji vjeruju da je važno pomoći da se na životu održi jedan slobodan medij. Želimo vam svakog dana iduće godine predstaviti barem jednu ozbiljnu temu - ozbiljnim tekstom, fotografijom i videom, koji neće sramotiti profesiju. Po jedan dobar tekst svih 365 dana. Novac koji pokušavamo skupiti, naravno, nije dovoljan da pokrije realnu, poštenu, cijenu svih tih tekstova, stoga će Lupiga osigurati ostatak, po principu – pola mi, a pola vi.Sav prikupljen novac namijenit ćemo isključivo našim suradnicama i suradnicima, kao naknadu za njihov rad. Cilj je da Lupiga ostane neovisna redakcija, koju nitko ne može spriječiti da govori o temama o kojima se u našem društvu izbjegava govoriti - o političkim moćnicima i ljudima koji vjeruju da novcem mogu platiti i javnu šutnju. Danas je jasno da slobodan može biti samo onaj medij čiji su jedini vlasnici njegovi čitatelji i novinari. Medij bez gazde.Na ovom mjestu zahvaljujemo svim našim kolegama, prijateljima i simpatizerima koji su nam pomogli u pripremi ove kampanje. Pozivamo u pomoć sve vas koji znate da bez slobodnog novinarstva nema ni slobodnog društva. Nikada nismo jedni drugima bili potrebniji. Donirajte Lupigu, zajedno ćemo biti glasniji. *** Lupigi možete donirati i izravno na žiro-račun, putem opće uplatnice ili internetskog bankarstva. Podatke možete pronaći na ovom linku. Cijenimo svaku podršku. "A free press can, of course, be good or bad, but, most certainly without freedom, the press will never be anything but bad," said Albert Camus, a philosopher, writer and a fellow journalist.When we started 16 years ago, big words did not mean much to us. It seemed like the world was on the right track. A group of journalists, friends and colleagues who met up regularly at Lupillus, their favorite watering hole in Zagreb, decided to put together Lupiga.com. Rookie journalists would break their first stories and run their first columns on Lupiga, and build a loyal readership.This was where Edo Maajka, a rapper from Bosnia, put together his first Zagreb rhymes. Marčelo from Belgrade sent us his first literary attempts. This is where some of today's TV producers tested their journalistic prowess, and some audio-visual artists discovered their talents. Some of them ended up launching star-studded careers, and by 2004 Lupiga won the VIDI Top ten media award. A path to success was opening for us, to big money perhaps: all we needed to do was write short stories about everything and nothing, about shallow corruptive affairs and deep cleavages. But we don't see journalism that way. It would be a disgrace to everything we believe in; an insult to Feral Tribune and the persistent fight of our colleague Drago Hedl, an affront to Igor Mandic's splendid writing style and to Veselko Tenzera's sentences, a slight to whistleblower Ankica Lepej's citizen courage, an indignity to Jasna Babić's curiosity and investigative spirit.At our "real" jobs (read: full-time day jobs) we worked like hell – but our free time and our passion belonged to Lupiga. It continued for the next 12 years. Lupiga grew bigger and bigger. Then came the end of 2013, and for the first time Lupiga received a grant from the Ministry of Culture. Out small nonprofit community began to thrive. With just a small financial injection, we created a brand new media environment – a website that rose to prominence without fake news or „titty bait“.We were into investigative journalism, digging through Catholic church finance, scandalous takeovers of public companies, an industry brought to its knees. We wrote about Croatian oligarchs, the neglected cultural scene, about people being run over by the system, about gender, national and economic equality – and our audience grew. And it was the obvious proof that the public isn't only interested in tits and ass.When the political climate shifted, free media was the first to face cuts. Journalism as we see it did not satisfy the tastes of those in power. They fancy entertainment over journalism, obscure arrangements over vocal criticism. We're not supposed to stick our noses into their businesses or question what kind of society we are leaving to our children.But for us, it seemed that journalism "is printing what someone else does not want printed“ and that „everything else is public relations”, like anoother great journalist, George Orwell, said. Today we know that those words were not left to us by chance. They were left to us as warnings. Free press is one of the supporting pillars of a healthy society – but a pillar that needs support as well. That's why we want to write about what matters, in-depth investigative stories, pointing out anomalies in society – a society that allows convicted war criminals to become heroes, while politics and big money exploit public good. It's the only way we can make it better. By providing space – and a platform – for people who have something to say.In the year we leave behind, Lupiga not only managed to survive, but offered new perspectives, opening important discussions. Two of our journalists, Melisa Skender and Jasna Babić, received the annual awards of the Croatian Journalism Society.Lupiga was driven by journalism, passion and support from friends and colleagues. Now we come to you, our readers, sympathizers, all of you who believe that keeping free media alive is important.Lupiga wants to provide you with at least an article, a photograph or video that counts, every day, 365 times a year. The amount we are asking for will not cover a fair price for the authors, but it does cover half. It will be spent on our contributors, as a pay for their work. The goal is to keep Lupiga independent, resistant to pressure from those who think that silence can be bought. It is clear that the only free media is the one owned by its readers and journalists. A media outlet – without a big boss.A big thank you to all of our colleagues, friends and sympathizers that helped us prepare this campaign, helping us reach out to people aware of the fact that without free press there is no free society. We need each other. Donate to Lupiga, so we can be louder together! *** You can contribute to Lupiga by donating directly to our bank account, by payment slip or e-banking. All the details can be found on this link. We appreciate your support. Kurze VersionLiebe Freunde,die Pressefreiheit in Kroatien (EU-Mitglied seit 2013) wird auf subtile oder auch weniger subtile Art regelmäßig unterwandert. Die unabhängigen Internetportale in dem kleinen, aber leider politisch und vor allem rechtsstaatlich nicht besonders stabilen Land an der Adria kämpfen ums Überleben, etwa das Portal für kritischen Journalismus Lupiga, dessen Crowdfunding-Kampagne ich gerne unterstütze. Eine Erklärung in englischer Sprache ist im beigefügten Beitrag im zweiten Teil zu lesen.Attraktive Preise warten auf großzügige Unterstützer, etwa Eintrittskarten für das wunderbare Filmfestival in Motovun/Istrien oder ein Glas Rotwein im Café Jazz in Frankfurt... Aber Ihr könnt Lupiga auch mit dem Teilen dieser Nachricht helfen.*** Sie können Ihre Spende direkt auf unser Bankkonto, per Einzahlungsschein oder E-Banking einzahlen. Einzelheiten finden Sie unter diesem Link. Wir danken Ihnen für Ihre Unterstützung!

story:
[The video is in 3 parts. See Parts 2 & 3 by clicking on the "gallery" tab above video to the right]

Hello, my name is Dorlan Francis. I am a Personal Financial Advisor. I am the holder of the Chartered Life Underwriter (CLU) and the Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designations. I also hold the Canadian Securities Course Certificate (CSc.) I have been in the Personal Financial Advising business since 1981.

I am the author of a previous book, LIFE INSURANCE: The Cause of Economic Prosperity. This was self-publish through Xlibris.com. It contained compelling financial and economic information. And it brought to light discoveries that where heretofore undetected. As Randal Whittle said, when he commented about the book on Amazon.com, "5 out of 5 stars. Fascinating and Enlightening—more people should understand what it contains. ..." It is a book with excellent ideas but it is not reaching the people who should have it because of marketing challenges due to funding constraints.

I have since written another book: The Economic and Financial Crisis (2007 - Present) How We Got In: How We Get Out. This book is more mind boggling. It contains earth shattering information. It shows how cunning men who past themselves off as wise, are pretending to give people what they want as they exploit people for their own benefit and in the process is causing global financial mayhem. This is causing the average individual to become poorer as a handful of people amass wealth out of all proportions to the effort they contribute to society.

This book is hard hitting. It name names. It shows up people who think their ideas are brilliant but are instead sowing destruction around the globe. No established publisher is going to touch it. Apart from the fact that I call names and will insist that names be called, most of the publishing houses are run by the same clique of people who are plundering and pillaging from the many for the benefit of a few. They are not likely to support a book that will rock the boat. In any event they are only interested in publishing people with name recognition. Even though often times what these recognised individuals say is harmful. They are more interested in making profits than to educate and inform; and in bringing new thinking to light. I am not encouraged by self-publishing as currently practised. I am not pleased with the outcome of my first work. If I have to pay for all marketing and promotion then I might as well maintain total control over production and distribution. This is what I intend to do but I need your help.

Your valuable contributions will be used to do the following:

Editing  ......................................... $2,500.00 - $3,000.00

Typesetting & Graphic Design .......... $2,500.00 - $3,000.00

Book Printing & Distribution ….........… $15,000.00 - $20,000

(the quantity of books print at a time will vary depending on the availability of funds. The greater the quantity the lower the unit cost per book)

Marketing and Promotion .......................... $5,000.00

The $30,000 target is to do 5,000 Hardcover Copies of the book in the first run. If there is a short fall in funding then I will do a lesser amount of copies (minimum 1000). If the goal is exceeded then I will do more copies of the book and embark on a more aggressive marketing campaign.

 Your contributions will help to change the world. You will be among the first to know about ideas that the rest of the world will sooner or later accept as orthodox truths. You will know why life has gotten so hard; why the income of the average individual keeps falling while the income of a few keeps rising. You will find out for the first time at last what caused the great depression and how the very same ideas caused a repeat in 2007. You will know why youngsters leaving universities with their first and second degrees have to be doing menial jobs to survive. You will be armed with the knowledge with which to lobby your political representatives to get them to effect change so that the future for your children and children's children will indeed be better than the past.

       You might be asking yourself: What can a personal financial advisor know about economics? And I would hasten to ask: What do economists know about economics? Studies have shown that economists are unable to predict economic out comes 99% of the times. John Mauldin wrote an article in the Newsletter: Thoughts From The Frontline with the caption: Economists Are (Still) Clueless. In that article he stated the following:

        "In November of 2008, as stock markets crashed around the world, the Queen of England visited the London School of Economics to open the New Academic Building. While she was there, she listened in on academic lectures. The Queen, who studiously avoids controversy and almost never lets people know what she's actually thinking, finally asked a simple question about the financial crisis: "How come nobody could foresee it?" No one could answer her."

Mauldin went on … "In plain English, economists don't have a clue about the future."

The real danger is that it was the ideas of some of those clueless economists that caused the financial crash and which is retarding the prosperity of the world. And they believe that the solution to the current problem is to do more of what was done to cause the problem in the first place. Politicians have economic advisors; they do not pluck economic ideas from thin air. It was the bad advice from economists that has brought us to where we are today.

       I humbly submit that you will stand a better chance with a Personal Financial Advisor who because of his God given insight and analytic abilities was able to determine that cash value life insurance was responsible for about 40% of the added prosperity in the world. (Economists are yet to realize this). And that was the reason Judeo-Christian counties tend to be more prosperous than non-oil producing Muslim countries.

       The solution to the economic crisis facing the world will not likely come from within the economic box. It is time to look outside the box. You can start with my ideas. Your valuable contributions will bring these ideas to light. With your help, I intend to take my message to the four corners of the earth and when the ideas contained in my book start transforming lives you will be pleased and proud that you helped to make it happen.

 

 

 

 

The Economic & Financial Crisis

(2007 - Present)

How We Got In

How We Get Out

 

 

By:

 

 

Dorlan H. Francis CLU, CFP, CSc.

 

 

 

 

CONTENTS

  1. DEDICATION

  2. FOREWORD

  3. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS

  4. PREFACE

  5. INTRODUCTION

  6. THE MOBILIZATION AND USE OF MONEY

  7. THE PSYCHOLOGY OF MONEY

  8. MONEY AND THE ECONOMY

  9. JAMAICA – A CASE STUDY IN THE FOLLY OFTHE PURSUIT OF HIGH YIELDS

  10. THE ROARING TWENTIES

  11. THE POLITICAL CRONOLOGY OF THE CRISIS

  12. THE UNFOLDING OF THE FINANCIAL CRISIS

  13.  THE EURO ZONE CRISIS

  14.  FIXING THE PROBLEM

    15.  THE WAY FORWARD

    16.  CONCLUSION

 

 

PREFACE

The financial crisis which descended on the world in August 2007 and which is continuing as we enter 2013 is the final manifestation of how inefficiently we are using money. Base on pure economic fundamentals there is absolutely no reason why the world should be enduring this agony. We have an economy because people live and they need things to sustain their lives. If the world was suffering from the Japanese phenomenon of a declining population – which leads to economic contraction, we could understand that, but the world welcomed its 7th billion soul in October 2011. This means more demand for the goods and services the world produces.

If the world had genuinely ran out of some of the essential commodities needed for economic activities then one could understand the ensuing contraction. If climate changes had caused severe drought resulting in a depletion of water resources this could have caused water dependent industries to cut back. The juice and beverage industry would have had to cut back. And a number of other industries that rely on water (and which one does not) would have been severely impacted. This would have caused layoffs and a decline in income which could have resulted in economic contraction. If climate changes had caused prolonged drought leading to crop failure, famine and food rationing, then one could understand the dislocation that that would have caused.

If any other high used commodity such as steel, aluminium, copper or lumber was in short supply forcing the economy to slow to the pace of the available supply of that commodity then we could understand the crushing compression of the economies around the world. And if the oil and gas wells had run dry and alternative sources of energy was lagging in filling the void then we could all understand the dislocation that would have occurred. But this is not the case - even when we factor in the contrived shortage of oil. It was argued that a contributing factor to the stagflation years which started in 1972 was the poor harvest of Peruvian Anchovies in that year followed by an even poorer one in 1973. Anchovies are processed into oil which is used as an additive in animal feed. The commodities essential to the smooth functioning of the global economy, while they may have supply fluctuation is nowhere near short enough to cause the severe and persistent disruption that has occurred in the economy since 2007.

The world has been plunged into a financial and economic crisis because of the quixotic misuse of money. And the blame must be squarely laid at the feet of the financial institutions of the world, and the misguided individuals who believe that the making of money is the ultimate goal of life. And at the feet of politicians who out of ignorance or duplicity allows the idiotic practice to thrive and prosper. The ultimate goal of life is to live! People organize themselves to find ways to sustain their lives. This is why we have an economy. If when we were born we were given a jab on our butts that would cause us not to want water, food, shelter, clothing, medicine and entertainment there would not have been an economy.  Contrary to popular belief the economy does not exist so that people make money. The economy exists because people need to live!

I have decided to write this book because I am not comforted by the response from economists or the financial analysts of the world to the greatest financial crisis since the great depression. And had it not been for the application of lessons learnt from the prior great depression this could easily have been the greatest depression the world has known. The greatest financial crisis since the great depression did not occur because of irrational exuberance or a financial market correction. The global crisis occurred because of deep seated structural and systemic flaws in our economic and financial thinking.  If a proper diagnosis is not done and fundamental changes made, then we can all brace for periodic financial shocks as we transform from a state of prosperity to a more perilous state. Since the men and women who are trained in the field of economics have by and large resile from addressing the problem and proffering solutions I have decided to step to the plate. ...

How We Get Out
 
 
By:
 
 
Dorlan H. Francis CLU, CFP, CSc.
 
 
 
 
CONTENTS


DEDICATION


FOREWORD


ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS


PREFACE


INTRODUCTION


THE MOBILIZATION AND USE OF MONEY


THE PSYCHOLOGY OF MONEY


MONEY AND THE ECONOMY


JAMAICA – A CASE STUDY IN THE FOLLY OFTHE PURSUIT OF HIGH YIELDS


THE ROARING TWENTIES


THE POLITICAL CRONOLOGY OF THE CRISIS


THE UNFOLDING OF THE FINANCIAL CRISIS


 THE EURO ZONE CRISIS


 FIXING THE PROBLEM


    15.  THE WAY FORWARD
    16.  CONCLUSION
 
 
PREFACE
The financial crisis which descended on the world in August 2007 and which is continuing as we enter 2013 is the final manifestation of how inefficiently we are using money. Base on pure economic fundamentals there is absolutely no reason why the world should be enduring this agony. We have an economy because people live and they need things to sustain their lives. If the world was suffering from the Japanese phenomenon of a declining population – which leads to economic contraction, we could understand that, but the world welcomed its 7th billion soul in October 2011. This means more demand for the goods and services the world produces.
If the world had genuinely ran out of some of the essential commodities needed for economic activities then one could understand the ensuing contraction. If climate changes had caused severe drought resulting in a depletion of water resources this could have caused water dependent industries to cut back. The juice and beverage industry would have had to cut back. And a number of other industries that rely on water (and which one does not) would have been severely impacted. This would have caused layoffs and a decline in income which could have resulted in economic contraction. If climate changes had caused prolonged drought leading to crop failure, famine and food rationing, then one could understand the dislocation that that would have caused.
If any other high used commodity such as steel, aluminium, copper or lumber was in short supply forcing the economy to slow to the pace of the available supply of that commodity then we could understand the crushing compression of the economies around the world. And if the oil and gas wells had run dry and alternative sources of energy was lagging in filling the void then we could all understand the dislocation that would have occurred. But this is not the case - even when we factor in the contrived shortage of oil. It was argued that a contributing factor to the stagflation years which started in 1972 was the poor harvest of Peruvian Anchovies in that year followed by an even poorer one in 1973. Anchovies are processed into oil which is used as an additive in animal feed. The commodities essential to the smooth functioning of the global economy, while they may have supply fluctuation is nowhere near short enough to cause the severe and persistent disruption that has occurred in the economy since 2007.
The world has been plunged into a financial and economic crisis because of the quixotic misuse of money. And the blame must be squarely laid at the feet of the financial institutions of the world, and the misguided individuals who believe that the making of money is the ultimate goal of life. And at the feet of politicians who out of ignorance or duplicity allows the idiotic practice to thrive and prosper. The ultimate goal of life is to live! People organize themselves to find ways to sustain their lives. This is why we have an economy. If when we were born we were given a jab on our butts that would cause us not to want water, food, shelter, clothing, medicine and entertainment there would not have been an economy.  Contrary to popular belief the economy does not exist so that people make money. The economy exists because people need to live!
I have decided to write this book because I am not comforted by the response from economists or the financial analysts of the world to the greatest financial crisis since the great depression. And had it not been for the application of lessons learnt from the prior great depression this could easily have been the greatest depression the world has known. The greatest financial crisis since the great depression did not occur because of irrational exuberance or a financial market correction. The global crisis occurred because of deep seated structural and systemic flaws in our economic and financial thinking.  If a proper diagnosis is not done and fundamental changes made, then we can all brace for periodic financial shocks as we transform from a state of prosperity to a more perilous state. Since the men and women who are trained in the field of economics have by and large resile from addressing the problem and proffering solutions I have decided to step to the plate. ...

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Teresa Carey. I am an artist and writer with a background in journalism who has made the bold move of starting her own magazine.

A lot of people like it. It has even been nominated for "Best New Magazine" in the 31st annual Western Magazine Awards. 

With changes the newspaper industry has seen in recent years, I decided I wanted to pursue a different path, hence the magazine. In my work as a journalist, I came to know of so many interesting stories that "just needed to be told". I wanted to tell these stories as well as promote a positive, life-affirming vision of Manitoba's Interlake region that would include all of its peoples.

Interlake Arts, Life & Leisure Magazine was launched in May, 2012. It is now entering its second year of publication. It is part arts and culture, part history, and part tourism magazine, written with a general audience in mind.

Its purpose is to tell rich in human interest stories about Manitoba's Interlake people and places--to tell them in a way that everyday people can relate to, as well as to inspire tourists and locals alike to explore the vast and varied Interlake region.

One of the main mandates of this magazine is to foster an appreciation of culture and arts, and shine a light on the many talented people in the region. Therefore, each issue contains at least one artist profile (often more), as well as selections of poetry and prose by a number of exceptional Interlake writers.

I feel it is important to weave the arts into a larger format because, the reality is, the average person does not self-identify as being  "artsy". Some will even put up blinders to the whole arts scene unless the stories can be told in such a way as to invite them in.

My background as, both, an artist and a reporter "on the street" has given me an interesting set of tools to pursue this vision.

What I Need & What You Will Get

It is really challenging to start up a magazine. What I need most of all at this point is to build my subscribers base significantly. This will ensure that advertisers place ads, the revenue of which covers printing and distribution costs.

What you will receive are 3 hard copies per year of Interlake Arts, Life & Leisure Magazine.

Your first subscription will be at the regular price. ($21.15 per year) Your renewals will be at 25% off for as long as you wish to continue receiving the magazine. (I will be setting up a special coupon code specifically for anyone helping me with this project).

The Impact

If I am able to prove that I have sold (not just gave away) a minumum of 5,000 magazines in a year I will meet the threshold needed for me to apply for government grants. The grants are badly needed so that I may grow this magazine. I need to hire people to sell subscriptions and advertising. With this grant money, I will be able to do more advertising, plus I will be able to take more training to improve my design skills.

Without this grant money, I will hobble along. Maybe people will subscribe, but maybe not. Most of the people (95%) who have subscribed in year one did renew, so that is very hopeful. But at the current rate I am going on my own, I will not be able to meet my target.

If I cannot get my numbers up the advertisers who have put their trust in me based on my reputation as a journalist, may very well spend their advertising dollars elsewhere. It is a bit of a Catch 22. Besides, I have worked long hours on this with minimal pay.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Your help in spreading the word is also very much appreciated. While this magazine focusses on the Interlake region of Manitoba, the stories themselves are universal. Maybe you have a friend or loved one who would enjoy this magazine.

If you would like to contribute to this campaign, please enter a minumum of $21.15 CAD. You can also contribute $36.00 for a 2 year subscription or $47.65 for a 3 year subscription. 

Thank you for your generous support!!!

story:
Over one million Americans a year attempt suicide; 38,000 succeed. I never imagined I would be among those who contemplated the idea. 

Suicide - A topic most people would rather not talk about. However, the fact is 90% of all Americans have thought about it at one point in their life. With today's hectic world, i.e. bombings, shootings, the financial crisis, the divorce rate, and the ever increasing need for society as a whole to try and "out do" each other, suicide is on the rise; particularly among children and the men and women in the armed forces. These are very disturbing statistics.

This is a personal look at my attempt at suicide, and what brought me to that point. I explain how I hide behind my life as a comedian to mask the demons in my head that lead me to the brink of suicide. But more importantly, this book is an observation of what I could have done differently to have never considered the thought in the first place. In this book I explore what triggers the notion of suicide and what you can do to make it subside. I will examine how someone who appears to have it all can place them self in a situation that they think is impossible to get out of. When the Humor is Gone offers my opinion on the topic and shares what leading psychologist have to say about the subject. I am very candid about my past, my personal thoughts, about life and my strong belief that there is always something worth living for.

As a self evaluation of my life, this book was not easy for me to write. However, I feel what I have written needed to be said. I offer an honest look at what brings us to the breaking point, and then how we can overcome any situation.

When the Humor is Gone is a sincere attempt at helping others understand and gain control over their downward spiral by examining what put me there and how I overcame it. I share other peoples idea and notions about the subject, and how it is important to recognize the signs of depression before one reaches the thought of suicide.

Society needs to stop ignoring their fellow man; to stop being selfish and realize every being on this planet has worth. We need to show more concern for each other and value the reason we are here. We need to encourage all we meet in our lives to reach their full potential, regardless of their social - economical background. Together, we need to eliminate suicide as an alternative to life. This is what When the Humor is Gone is all about.   

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

 

As a comedian in a show on the Las Vegas Strip, I realize potential guest of the show may view me in a different light once they read my book; but I am prepared to face that challenge. I am fortunate to have other income should there be a negative impact on my career as a comedian. However, I am confident enough to believe that won't happen. Whatever the outcome, helping just one person change their mind about committing suicide will make it all worthwhile.

The funding of this project will help publish and promote this work. I already have requests on my social media websites for this book once it is published.

story:
Book Purchase to help in publishing my next Creative non-fiction book.

Purchase ‘Culturally Submerged '~ Journey of a White Rez Teacher’ and you will receive a free artwork inspired from perceptions in many First Nation Native Communities [shown].  *HAVE A LOOK at the [INCENTIVES] PERKS down below! 

2nd edition of self-published non-fiction by author/artist, Vesa Peltonen'

NOTE: Read an excerpt from book: http://artistprints.ca/pages/my-book-release

The books topic is about Peltonen's many experiences as an Instructor in N.W. Ontario, Canada immersed in teaching Aboriginal Students. They are experiences from the good, not so good, shocking to whimsical and funny, unexpected situations.

Funding; ~35 days to help publish book ‘Mind Control & Other Weird Stories’

Note: This Book is the only book on the TOPIC about my perceptions of teaching in the Aboriginal Culture in Northwestern Ontario, being immersed in it, adapting to their ways. The funding is to help the publishing of my next book & thus do a book tour for both once the other is complete. [see below]

I hope this book, 'Culturally Submerged~ Journey of a White Rez Teacher' will get rid of some assumptions about our native people and their community lifestyle.

Buy the book @ $25. or Contribute whatever amount, even $1.00: 

>>>See Incentives.

See >'GALLERY' for images also on 'topics' navigator above.

Summer Beaver First Nation


Kasabonika Lake First Nation


Kasabonika Art Project -'Loon Spirit' ~Art Therapy group project.

I, Vesa Peltonen am an Artist/ Educator/ Art Director/Writer,  living in Thunder Bay, Ontario Canada. For over 30 years I have had a rewarding career in the arts and teaching. I have served as an advisor for the Ontario Arts Council. I have taught in all Educational Levels incl. University.

~Book Description:164 pg., Soft cover book - 6"w.x 9"h. Available as an e-book (see at publisher- Xlibris.com or Amazon e-books also)

~Summary: 'Culturally Submerged is about the many aspects of native life I was involved in. The stories told do have both a linear and lateral style of writing. I write about various topics/stories that happen in a First Nations' community, and then as if going through a door into a new place, the reader is into another similar situation, but different realm without much detail of where it is; only the continuation of similar occurrences. The events are from whimsical, funny, good to not so good and some shocking occurrences.

The Artwork: The photo/art above are not included in the book. These examples are taken from various Native Communities I had worked or visited throughout 12 years off & on since 1998.

The Impact:

TO CREATE MORE AWARENESS of the lives of native people,  from my perceptions as a qualified instructor over 12 yrs. off & on being in many N.W.Ontario First Nation Native Communities. To make sure people understand the aboriginal people better through my perceptions of many different experiences. 15% of funds will go to send proper art supplies to a 'Pikangikum Native Community'/ Elementary Division.

Here is the cover for the my next book, almost complete. ‘Mind Control & Other Weird Stories’.

Cover: 'Mind Control & Other Weird Stories' [next book ready to be published]

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

~ Pass on the link, a comment about this campaign

~  Use the Indiegogo share tools, or applications on other sites as Facebook to spread the word. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Use Any Credit card type, Paypal, Cheque [see payment types]. 

- Che-Miiqueech ~ Vesa Peltonen

Contact: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com

story:
Creation & Redemption

Hey all - Jared Stump here. I'm a 21-year-old from North Texas, and I'm the author of Creation & Redemption: Finding Your Place in a Fallen World. I wrote this book a few years ago, right after I graduated from high school.
Part memoir, part theology, this book is a raw and honest look at that phase of life that all of us go through—the transition into adulthood. This backdrop will hit home with readers of all ages, drawing them into a more intimate relationship with Jesus as they journey with me through the story.

To be honest, the book is still a bit hard for me to describe in a short piece of text (even though I wrote it), so watch the video to learn more. :)

Creation & Redemption is set for a September 2014 release.

A little more about me: I own Battle Ground Creative, a freelance writing firm that I launched in the past year. I'm a member of Catch the Fire DFW in Hurst, TX and I've worked with a school outreach ministry called Youth Alive North Texas for 4 years. Last year, I helped Youth Alive write a book detailing their ministry philosophy and history, Hidden in Plain Sight: America's Unreached Mission Field. This book was self-published and has sold more than 1,500 copies, which was more than initially expected. Youth groups have used it as a sermon series foundation and a local Bible college has made it required reading for a youth ministries class. (More info at www.youthalivetx.com/book)

The Need

I'll be doing all of the general editing and interior layout for the book, but I will need to hire a secondary editor and graphic designer for the cover. This will cost approximately $2,000, but I'm only looking to raise $1,500, as I will be putting in the rest of the money myself.

The Impact

This book has the potential to make a huge impact within the Christian genre. So many Christian books focus solely on theology, without telling personal stories. I have found that a single raw, honest story can have just as much impact as dozens of books on theology, so I've tried to focus more on that in this book. While there is theology mixed in, Creation & Redemption is primarily a series of short stories that come together to form a larger story.

Perks

One of the things I'm most excited about is being able to give back to everyone who contributes to this project. See below for a full list of perks.

Questions?

If you have any questions, feel free to email me using the contact form on my website: www.jaredstump.com/contact

story:
This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Hand In Hand Foundation, a verified nonprofit. The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.

Short Summary

  • Seven days
  • Two friends
  • One four-hour flight
  • One inner-city church with 20 years of work ministering to the poor and broken of the Honduran capital
  • One orphanage that cares for more than 600 kids who are victims of sex trafficking, drug violence and other severe crimes
  • Four weeks to get ready
  • And you!

This is a mission trip support campaign.

This page is dedicated to help Nan Palmero and Joshua Salmons raise the $3,000 dollars they will need to join their friend Mike Sharrow and the Hand In Hand Foundation to reach Honduras’ capital, Tegucigalpa and minister to the Iglesia Misionera de Cristo (IMC) church. Once there, Josh, Nan and Mike will train church staff and new leaders in areas identified by their IMC church contacts. The three of them will also preach, hold various other coaching/training sessions and dedicate time to encourage their Honduran brothers and sisters who serve in ministries of the IMC.

What We Need

The cost of the trip will be just under $1,500/person. On the trip the team will be living as simply as possible with the goal that whatever funds are not used towards necessary expenses (airfare, transportation, food) will then be given to the ministries there. Any amount helps! Please consider donating.

The Impact

Honduras is a country rife with gangs, cartels political coups and incredible violence. Church leaders there are on the front lines, trying to keep their friends and family from succumbing to the tempting paths of crime and drugs.

Once in the capital, Nan, Josh and Mike will contribute to the active church planting work that has already produced a dozen churches around the region, a Compassion International Project to rescue hundreds of malnourished kids, medical and dental clinics in the heart of the city and a pastor training program. In addition, the team will visit Orphanage Emmanuel out in Guaimaca, which cares for more than 600 kids who are victims of drug and human trafficking and other crimes.

The team’s prayer is not for safe or easy work – but the opportunity to truly make an eternal impact, the willingness to be used by God beyond their own strength/comfort, and to represent Christ’s love. Nan, Josh and Mike all possess various business, creative and pastoral backgrounds. In planning ahead with their friends already there, the team hopes to deliver God-given insight and encouragement to the brothers and sisters making a difference for the Kingdom there.

Part of this trip is for you as well. You get the chance to rally around the team in prayer, in support, in encouragement and in awareness. In that respect, you and the team will be on this trip together!

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether or not you can give, please consider:

  • Sharing this through Facebook, Twitter, or good ol’ fashioned email.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out about this trip.


Thank you for your time!

-- Nan and Josh
story_txt:
This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Hand In Hand Foundation, a verified nonprofit. The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.Short Summary


Seven days


Two friends


One four-hour flight


One inner-city church with 20 years of work ministering to the poor and broken of the Honduran capital


One orphanage that cares for more than 600 kids who are victims of sex trafficking, drug violence and other severe crimes


Four weeks to get ready


And you!

This is a mission trip support campaign.This page is dedicated to help Nan Palmero and Joshua Salmons raise the $3,000 dollars they will need to join their friend Mike Sharrow and the Hand In Hand Foundation to reach Honduras’ capital, Tegucigalpa and minister to the Iglesia Misionera de Cristo (IMC) church. Once there, Josh, Nan and Mike will train church staff and new leaders in areas identified by their IMC church contacts. The three of them will also preach, hold various other coaching/training sessions and dedicate time to encourage their Honduran brothers and sisters who serve in ministries of the IMC.What We Need
The cost of the trip will be just under $1,500/person. On the trip the team will be living as simply as possible with the goal that whatever funds are not used towards necessary expenses (airfare, transportation, food) will then be given to the ministries there. Any amount helps! Please consider donating.



The Impact


Honduras is a country rife with gangs, cartels political coups and incredible violence. Church leaders there are on the front lines, trying to keep their friends and family from succumbing to the tempting paths of crime and drugs.
Once in the capital, Nan, Josh and Mike will contribute to the active church planting work that has already produced a dozen churches around the region, a Compassion International Project to rescue hundreds of malnourished kids, medical and dental clinics in the heart of the city and a pastor training program. In addition, the team will visit Orphanage Emmanuel out in Guaimaca, which cares for more than 600 kids who are victims of drug and human trafficking and other crimes.
The team’s prayer is not for safe or easy work – but the opportunity to truly make an eternal impact, the willingness to be used by God beyond their own strength/comfort, and to represent Christ’s love. Nan, Josh and Mike all possess various business, creative and pastoral backgrounds. In planning ahead with their friends already there, the team hopes to deliver God-given insight and encouragement to the brothers and sisters making a difference for the Kingdom there.
Part of this trip is for you as well. You get the chance to rally around the team in prayer, in support, in encouragement and in awareness. In that respect, you and the team will be on this trip together!



Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether or not you can give, please consider:



Sharing this through Facebook, Twitter, or good ol’ fashioned email.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out about this trip.


Thank you for your time!
-- Nan and Josh

story:
Sex trafficking. The horrible fact is; men, women, boys and girls are being sexually exploited, right now, in your city. 

It is difficult to know how to help. Where do you fit in the solution? Can you rescue these people? How can they heal? What can we DO?  

It is easy to find information about domestic sex trafficking these days, but it continues to be difficult to find a conversation that results in answers to these questions and long term solutions to the problem.  

At Freedom’s Breath, we believe that this crucial conversation must center around survivors, people who have lived the horrors of exploitation and have a heart for reaching back and helping others find safety and healing. We seek to honor and support survivor healing through the telling of their stories and developing positive, long term relationships. We value their extensive life education and commit to help find solutions to this horrific cultural problem by listening to their voices without re-traumatizing or exploiting them in other, unintentional ways.      

What is Freedom's Breath?

Freedom’s Breath has adopted a mission to create a survivor informed movement which promotes cultural change regarding domestic commercial sexual exploitation. We will do this by promoting awareness and training as well as promoting the establishment of an effective network of resources for survivor advocacy.

Who is Jes Richardson?

Jes Richardson is a devoted wife, mother of five beautiful children, business owner, artist and survivor of domestic sex trafficking. As the President and Co-Founder of Freedom’s Breath, Jes has devoted her life to empowering survivors, breaking the cycles of abuse and creating a survivor informed movement that stops trafficking. Her vibrant personality and authentic approach, inspire others to live beyond their fears and circumstances, embracing the joy of life.

Jes is a highly sought after speaker at universities, churches and events across the country. As a dynamic keynote and trainer, her insight and experience transform the hearts of her audience, creating an unforgettable occasion. Equipping the community, to create meaningful relationships that transform lives and families.

We need you to stand with us as we develop the tools and training that will help break cycles of abuse and contribute to a long term solution.

Our goals by the end of 2013:

1) The completion and publication of a book, authored by Jes Richardson, which breaks down the anti-trafficking movement and assists you in finding your role in stopping slavery in your city. It defines the key players within trafficking, peeling back the sheets, exposing the sex industry. Giving you an in depth look at slavery in the US and the abolitionist movement from a survivor’s perspective.  

2) We are developing a training curriculum to equip individuals and organizations that provides a “Survivor Support Community” which will help create a network of integrated resources, specifically designed for those working in direct services with trafficking survivors. 

The philosophies of Freedom’s Breath feed the core needs of survivors and give them the tools to be empowered and restored. The continued research and development for the creation of of these critical training and culture shifting resources will assist us in further equipping a safe community of survivor informed abolitionists as well as furthering our ability to promote healing in additional survivors.

To make this happen, Freedom’s Breath needs your help! Please consider making a generous contribution to the creation of these resources which will directly impact those, within your community, who have been commercially sexually exploited. Our goal during this campaign is to raise $20,000 by January 31st.

story:
In recognition of the legacy of Shirley Jackson’s writing, and with permission of the author’s estate, the Shirley Jackson Awards were established in 2008 for outstanding achievement in the literature of psychological suspense, horror, and the dark fantastic. 

Shirley Jackson (1916-1965) wrote such classic novels as The Haunting of Hill House and We Have Always Lived in the Castle, as well as one of the most famous short stories in the English language, "The Lottery." Her work continues to be a major influence on writers of every kind of fiction, from the most traditional genre offerings to the most innovative literary work. National Book Critics Circle Award-winning novelist Jonathan Lethem has called Jackson “one of this century’s most luminous and strange American writers,” and multiple generations of authors would agree.

The Shirley Jackson Awards were founded by a group of writers who felt that the time was right for a peer-juried award that wold recognize the variety and vitality of contemporary psychological suspense, horror, and dark fantasy fiction.

For this fundraising effort, our goal is $800. Six hundred of that will go toward funding the award itself for the next year, and the remaining two hundred will go towards the cost of our incorporation. Of course we would be more than happy to exceed our fundraising goal, and take another step towards insuring the award's future.


Please consider donating and helping to spread the word! www.shirleyjacksonawards.org

story:
Artistic Suicide


    From the time I began to write "Follies of God" (Knopf, 2014), a book about Tennessee Williams and his special relationships with a remarkable group of women, I also spoke to others in theatre and film and dance who had loved and worked with the playwright. Almost all of them were fascinated by a topic that obsessed Tennessee: Artistic suicide. Was it possible that artists and the forum in which they worked were sabotaging themselves? How could we change or alter the path of destruction on which the arts seemed to be stuck? 
 

     Tennessee was the first to ask the question, and I took it a group of artists who were happy to answer it. Among those interviewed were:

  • Eva Le Gallienne
  • Bette Davis
  • Elia Kazan
  • Alec Guinness
  • John Gielgud
  • Katharine Hepburn
  • Agnes de Mille
  • Martha Graham
  • Anna Sokolow
  • Arthur Miller
  • Arthur Penn
  • Sidney Lumet
  • Irene Worth
  • Maureen Stapleton
  • Marian Seldes
  • Lee Grant
  • Marlon Brando
  • Jessica Tandy

     Both my publisher and a producer interested in developing this book into a one-hour documentary have requested additional interviews and a search for archival materials. I expect this additional work  to take four to six weeks. I have received a grant toward this work, but require an additional $2500 to complete this work by mid-July.

    Everyone contributing to the development of "Artistic Suicide" will be credited in both the published book and the documentary.

     In addition, anyone contributing to the book/film, who also works in the arts, will be asked to contribute their own ideas as to how the arts have suffered and how they can be saved. 

  • Please tell as many people as you can about this project.
  • If you would like to be interviewed for this project, please let me know.

Material that will be included in "Artistic Suicide" can be found at jamesgrissom.blogspot.com (a blog created for "Follies of God") and at the "Follies of God" Facebook page. There have been requests for a separate "Artistic Suicide" Facebook page, but that will probably go up as we approach production/publication time.
