story:
Short Summary

G.K. Chesterton humorously noted that "poets have been strangely silent on the subject of cheese," and he was absolutely right. So I decided to end that travesty once and for all. 

Having published six whimsical children's books over the last three years, and having worked with fantastic artists throughout the process, Chesterton's tongue-in-cheek remark inspired me to finally pick up a pencil and illustrate my own book. 

I didn't do it all myself, however. Apart from being the cheesiest book ever written, A Cheesy Book is also an artistic experiment and part of a brand new "Color CoLab" project I'm excited to begin! In this project, I team up with painters who take my pen and pencil sketches, bring them onto a canvas, and interpret them through beautiful colors and painted textures! I have had the privilege of teaming up with a fantastic Egyptian artist named Bassel Elkadi, who has astonished me with his skill, style, and enthusiasm. There is an energy in our work that is exciting and causes us both to look forward to future projects together. Through this artistic collaboration, I hope to encourage more kids and adults to draw and paint with others. We all have varying strengths and weaknesses. We all see the world through different lenses. And that's part of the beauty of artistic collaborations: they allow us to see the world through a broader lens than our own.

story:
Second Update

Volumes have been so good that I'm having to move to a more automated way to sell the book - I can't keep up with the email flow! 

The updated 2017 edition of Rich by Retirement is now available on Gumroad in a PDF/ePub version, and on the Amazon Kindle Store. 

 

Update

The book has been released! I send out Indiegogo purchases at least twice a week, usually Sundays and Wednesdays, and more often when that's possible

You can buy it right here if you'd like a Kindle version.

Smart Investing for Singapore: The Book

If you're in Singapore, you're living in an investor's paradise. No capital gains tax; no dividend tax; mandatory retirement savings in your CPF account. But how do you invest smartly when there's so many dodgy investments around? Everyone's heard a horror story about a dud insurance policy that did nothing for twenty years, or a penny-stock punt gone wrong, or a ponzi scheme that ate their hard-earned cash.

There has to be a better way - and there is.

My name's Josh Giersch. For the last five years, I've been the voice of financial reason in the Money Mind forums at HardwareZone.com.sg, keeping people on the right track with their finances, calling out shonky salesmen, and steering investors away from financial death-traps. 

I've been asked to turn my knowledge into a book, and that's what this is: an easy guide for the average Singaporean who wants to avoid the traps, dodge the salesmen, and set themselves on the right financial track for a healthy retirement.

 

The Campaign

I'm raising money for a couple of reasons:

1) To gauge interest in the book! The more responses, the quicker I'll work and the sooner it'll be out there (and the higher the chance of a second edition).

2) To fund some extra work on the book. If I get plenty of responses I'll be able to hire an editor (goodbye awkward spelling mistakes!) and maybe put a nice hardcover edition in the works.

 

Risks & Challenges

Writing the book will take some time - books always do - and there's a risk that it may take longer to complete than I anticipated (6-9 months for the full publishing cycle, from the first draft to final versions being delivered). 

There's also a risk that I may need to pull the book for legal reasons. Financial advice is a legally tetchy field, and Singaporean legal restrictions may mean I need to rewrite the book to change details, or pull it altogether. If the book is pulled, I'll do my best to refund all my backers.

 

Let's do this!

 

If you're interested, come and fund me - let's build your retirement together!

story:
“Poetry is transcendent. We carry it in our hearts and find it there when we have forgotten everything else.” —Red Pine, Finding Them Gone


Join Red Pine and Copper Canyon Press in publishing Finding Them Gone.

This ambitious book chronicles a 30-day journey throughout China to discover traces of the ancient poetic masters.  Bill Porter—the internationally bestselling author, Guggenheim fellow, and PEN Translation Prize winner who translates under the name Red Pine—shares his story of an unforgettable spiritual and literary pilgrimage.

RED PINE: AUTHOR, POET, TRANSLATOR

Bill Porter’s life as a translator began in a Buddhist monastery in Taiwan in the 1970’s, when a monk handed him a book of poetry by Han-Shan (Cold Mountain). Discovering there a profound “world that has no words,” Porter went on to become a revered translator of dozens of important texts including Lao-Tzu’s Taoteching, The Collected Songs of Cold Mountain, and The Mountain Poems of Stonehouse. 

This extraordinary new book, Finding Them Gone, is the culmination of Porter’s incredible career and many decades of travel in China, where he became known as Red Pine. As a reader, you’ll travel alongside Red Pine to visit the homes and gravesites of ancient Chinese poets and pay homage to the enduring power of poetry.

Your literary pilgrimage with Red Pine begins with your donation. Give now to receive:  

  • Finding Them Gone delivered to you upon publication

  • A signed, limited edition, letterpress broadside of a Han-Shan poem

  • The opportunity to meet with Red Pine

  • An offering cup for libations on the literary journey

THE PATH TO PUBLICATION

Finding Them Gone is a significant undertaking for a nonprofit publisher of poetry: including over 200 poem translations typeset in the original Chinese, and illustrated with Red Pine's own photographs, the book requires great care along the path to publication. Generous donors have already stepped forward to contribute funds towards the design, editing, and proofreading. Now we need your help to cover the final essential costs, including printing, binding, and distribution.

Help us raise the remaining $20,000 to fund the book’s final production costs.

FINDING THEM GONE: YOUR MAP AND GUIDE

With Finding Them Gone as your map, you will encounter rural and industrial China’s shifting cultural landscape without ever leaving the page. On your journey, you’ll set off by train in Beijing and arrive in the cave where Cold Mountain, a master of Hermetic poetry and Zen practice, once sang his verses—“with nothing to do I write poems on rock walls/trusting the current like an unmoored boat.” 

Each step of the pilgrimage is marked with poetry from Chinese masters—among them Stonehouse, Cold Mountain, and Li Po—including poems never before translated into English.

Your journey begins now. Make your gift today to enable the publication of Red Pine’s Finding Them Gone and support Copper Canyon Press, a nonprofit publisher of poetry.


"In the travel writing that has made him so popular in China, Porter's tone is not reverential but explanatory, and filled with luminous asides... His goal is to tell interested foreigners about revealing byways of Chinese culture."—New York Review of Books

"Bill Porter has been one of the most prolific translators of Chinese texts, while also developing into a travel writer with a cult following."—The New York Times

"Red Pine's succinct and informative notes for each poem are core samples of the cultural, political, and literary history of China." —Asian Reporter

"What a wondrous publication!—so great to have found this nourishing fountain of insight. I will slake my thirst and share cups of its wisdom with others." —Michael West, reader of Red Pine's translations
_____________________________________________________________________________

Copper Canyon Press is a 501(c)3 nonprofit independent poetry publisher. For over 40 years we have been committed to publishing extraordinary poetry in translation. Our list includes works from and in 20+ languages, offering readers access to some of the world's most important and innovative poetic voices. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR GIFT!

story:
Support Armenian Writers 

Writers in Armenian language, especially in Diaspora need your support.

This campaign is aimed at supporting writers in troubled locations, where many are deprived of their regular income sources. Nevertheless, they do not stop from writing and enlightening us. They have very high understanding of their mission. Their contribution could be sometimes seen as the only logical and hopeful thing happening in an otherwise war ridden reality. 

Let us support them financially. Through their writings we would be able to know more about what is happening, we will feel more engaged with the people and locations they describe, and, most of all, we will contribute in opening a window of hope for the writers and readers alike. 

Imagine how good it would be if we raise just 500 dollars and send it to 2-3 of such writers. This is a better way of acknowledging their contribution than just clicking "Like" on their postings. It will encourage them to be more dedicated and inquisitive in their noble work.

If you are not able to financially contribute, you will certainly be able to share this campaign with others who currently have the means to support.

This is the first time a crowdsourcing support campaign is being organized for Armenian writers. So please show support and let us start a whole new chain reaction for acknowledging the value of Diaspora writers in endangered locations.
story_txt:
Support Armenian Writers 

Writers in Armenian language, especially in Diaspora need your support.

This campaign is aimed at supporting writers in troubled locations, where many are deprived of their regular income sources. Nevertheless, they do not stop from writing and enlightening us. They have very high understanding of their mission. Their contribution could be sometimes seen as the only logical and hopeful thing happening in an otherwise war ridden reality. 
Let us support them financially. Through their writings we would be able to know more about what is happening, we will feel more engaged with the people and locations they describe, and, most of all, we will contribute in opening a window of hope for the writers and readers alike. 
Imagine how good it would be if we raise just 500 dollars and send it to 2-3 of such writers. This is a better way of acknowledging their contribution than just clicking "Like" on their postings. It will encourage them to be more dedicated and inquisitive in their noble work.
If you are not able to financially contribute, you will certainly be able to share this campaign with others who currently have the means to support.
This is the first time a crowdsourcing support campaign is being organized for Armenian writers. So please show support and let us start a whole new chain reaction for acknowledging the value of Diaspora writers in endangered locations.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brittany and I am a Political Science student in Thailand. During my studies, I have learned just how unbalanced society is between men and women. It is only through passionate ideas that the world can change for the better, but some important sectors that lead world change still stifles the voices of women.

I believe the ties between peace and religion is what will encourage society to generate more compassion and kindness towards one another. This is why I have decided to enter into a Buddhist monastic life. By helping to preserve Buddhist teachings that all beings are equal, I hope to one day encourage other women, regardless their spiritual beliefs, that a life of peace and enlightenment is not just reserved for men.

What I Need:

  • The monastery that I will be going to is located in Bundanoon, Australia. While the monastery will be free for me to stay and study, the cost of the flight from Thailand to Australia will not be free. That is where you will come in...
  • I scanned down the cheapest flight from Thailand to Australia, departing the 9th of January from AirAsia for roughly $400. I set my goal to the minimum of $500, so hopefully the ticket price will not rise so that any money left over will go directly to the monastery.

The Impact

  • To empower more women to play more important roles in religion and peace 
  • Left over contribution will directly fund the Santi Forest Monastery, responsible for making the Buddhas teachings available for women to study  
  • By funding me, you are funding a future leader who will voice the importance of equality.           
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Share this with fellow advocates of gender equality!
  • Share this with friends who understand following your spiritual path
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Link to the Monastery: http://santifm.org/

and to their facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SantiForestMonastery

story:
A Year of Books...

Last year, I came to indiegogo in hopes of publishing my first novel, The Eye of God. With your help, the book was a success. I learned a lot on the way, and once again, with the help of the indiegogo community, I was able to release my second book, Storm Without End.

Storm Without End went on to become a Amazon top 20 bestseller in both Dark Fantasy categories for a week in December 2013, with a several-day showing in the top 100 for both Sword & Sorcery and Epic Fantasy. At its peak, Storm Without End ranked at #10!

This couldn't have happened without you.

My name is RJ Blain, and in 2014, I'm going to make my novel writing career a reality. With your help, I'm going to publish four novels I have in the works. Royal Slaves, the second book of The Fall of Erelith, will release in June of 2014. Storm Surge, the second book of Requiem for the Rift King, will release in December of 2014. The other two novels are standalones.

My cover artist has been hired for all of my projects, as have my editors. I have been planning on paying them through my developmental editing work. I can already hear the question. Why am I here, if I do have a way of paying for all of these services? 

In short, I was asked to by my fans. I work with Amazon's KDP Select system. It has treated me much better than Smashwords and other venues. I do not like branding my books with a distributor's name on my front pages, like Smashwords requires. They use an automated system to distribute the books. I've had nothing but complaints from most people who have tried to get the e-pubs from them. Their system is a nightmare to use, as a reader, and as a writer.

But, that leaves those who enjoy e-pub books high and dry. I don't like that. They want a way to get my books without having to go through amazon's system.

The only way I can do this and still use Amazon's KDP Select system is to do a pre-order system (or crowdsourcing campaign). So, here I am, using this as a way to help pay for my expenses, but to also give my fans a chance to get all of the formats of my e-book at a reduced price.

That's right, all of my basic e-book perks will be at a slightly reduced cost if you preorder it. (This is versus the release price, not any promotional prices I may do via the KDP Select system.)

Advance Copies

I don't feel preordering is enough. Contributors of this campaign will enjoy advance copies of the novels in their e-mail, at least several days prior to the official release.

The Second Factor: My editorial work isn't going to bring in much more than my basic expenses to release four books. It's going to leave me in a very, very tight place financially. By taking preorders, I can invest the money my novels deserve without bankrupting my household.

Hand-drawn Maps

One of the things I loved about doing indiegogo campaigns initially was being able to offer interesting perks to fans. After much thought, I am making a limited number of hand-drawn pencil sketch maps available. Each map is drawing using a light box to approximate the lines of the kingdom regions and landmasses, with embellishments added. All maps will have a unique compass rose, sea monsters, and flourishes, as well as signature and numbering.

Perk cost includes shipping fee to US / CA. If you live outside of the US / CA and desire a map, contact me for the cost for shipping.


Color Map

This is a one-of-a kind map. In 8.5x11 on psudo parchment paper, using calligraphy ink and watercolor. It took me 15-20 hours to complete over the course of several months, and was created to practice inking techniques for future maps. It will be numbered 1/1 and signed. A compass rose and sea monsters and various embellishments will be added prior to shipping.

My Expenses

While I am prepared to pay for everything out of my own pocket, here are my basic expenses for producing four novels for the year:

Cover Art: $2,000 ($500 per cover.)

Someone Asked: Isn't $500 really expensive for a cover? No, it's not. I write traditional, epic, and urban fantasy. These genres have always used paintings versus photo-manipulations as a general rule. Paintings (digital or traditional mediums) are usually more expensive than manipulations. I am not out to screw over a hardworking artist. I want to pay a fair amount for the number of hours Chris Howard invests in my cover art.

I also get the necessary rights to create promotional materials, use the images on my website, and licensing to use the image outside of the cover art. You can't get these rights for $50 from a hack chop shop for covers.

Editorial: $2,400. My base editorial fee is, on average, $200 per editor per book. I am looking at hiring three proofing editors per book next year. It'll actually be a bit more, likely, but those are expenses I will cover on my own.

Copyright Expenses: $240. $60 per copyright.

Grand Total: $4,640

About the Books

 Royal Slaves, Book 2 of the Fall of Erelith (June 2014). Terin and Blaise are back, and their problems are only getting worse. Adapting to life as a noble is wearing young Terin down, who has to break all of his habits as a slave -- and fast. When Aurora and Aria are taken into the city beneath the streets of Upper Erelith, they'll find out that the Hand and the Eye of God are the least of their concerns. Blaise has another problem, and one that could easily spell the end of the immortality he has enjoyed for so very long... 

 Storm Surge, Book 2 of Requiem for the Rift King (December 2014). Kalen has survived the incident at Morinvale, but at a heavy price. Just as he starts to think things are looking up, the illusion of security shatters. Discord is brewing between the kingdoms, setting a course for war on a tide that can't be stopped. Worse yet, the skreed aren't just growing stronger.

They're breeding.

Inquisitor, An Urban Fantasy (A Standalone Novel)(November 2014): When Allison is accused of a string of murders on the East Coast, she has to find the killer and quick, or she'll be put to death for the crimes she didn't commit. The only problem? The victims are all werewolves.

On the short list of potential victims, Allison has to act fast, or the killer will have one more body to add to his little black book of corpses…

The City of Clocks (A Standalone Novel) (October 2014) :  When the Great Clock doesn't ring in the new year, Aerrik's life is turned upside down. He's separated from Mya, a fellow escapee from the Duke's usurpation of the Arasoran throne. His clock is broken, and without it, he faces the purge. Someone wants him dead or alive.

Worse still, his past comes back to haunt him.

Without Aerrik, however, Arasanor is doomed to fall. However, with the very land itself turning on the struggling island, saving them from the Duke's reign may become the least of his troubles...

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only way you can help. Do you already have my books? Do you plan on investing in them when they release on amazon? If so, consider sharing this campaign on your blog, to your friends on facebook, or send a short tweet letting people know this exists.

Consider gifting one of my other books to someone. All of my royalties, at this point, are being invested in my novel. Like the perks enough you want to give it as a gift to someone else? You can do that too. All I need is the receiver's e-mail address.

Have you read one of my books and liked it? Leave a short review on amazon.com or at goodreads. It only needs to be a couple of sentences telling other readers why you liked the book.

Thank you so much for your support!

Notes about Amazon Gifting: You may have noticed that the cost of the perks for amazon gifting is $1 higher than the normal release price. This accounts for having to pay for each book at full price to gift them to you. Amazon does not currently give authors the ability to give coupons or promotional codes for copies of the book.

story:
Short Summary

Royal Holloway Feminism Society has been running since March 2011 and we kicked our  blog into gear about 6 months ago and it now has over 12000 hits. Now we want to go into the feminist world of zines and want The Wilding to help spread the word of feminism on campus and beyond.

What We Need 

We want to have at least 100 free zines available by the beginning of the new academic year. We also want to get further advertising material. If we have some money left over we'd love to have a launch night too :) This is all to make the launch and the first edition is the best it can be so people will invest in the zine in the future. 

The Impact

In our archive at our university there are many zines from women's suffrage societies that existed at Royal Holloway and Bedford College and we want to revive that line of feminist history. We want to engage existing and potential feminist activists, on and off campus.

Other Ways You Can Help

Link this to as many friends as you can!

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Aditya D. Goyal, and I'm the author of "The Sun Will Rise Tomorrow". This book is a collection of 3 fictional stories about people with life-threatening diseases who are fighting to live another day.

I wrote this book because I wanted to raise support for different diseases and their potential solutions.

However, I didn’t just want to write a depressing educational sermon. I wanted something riveting and memorable!

I knew that lots of people love reading stories. A great story can keep people talking for years. And I’d always been passionate about storytelling — I’ve been writing since I was in middle school.

Realizing I could maybe use my writing to do some good and make a positive impact, I explored this idea further.

I interviewed around ten medical scientists and 15 people with cancer, sickle cell, and heart disease. I also researched over 40 articles and journals online around the diseases I'm covering to make sure I had the right facts.

From there came the fun part: writing the stories! The result is what you see here today.

The coolest thing about reading a story is that it whisks you away into someone else’s world. That’s why it’s so easy to get caught up in a story about a brave knight from a far-away land. Stories are a great way to see what life is like for someone who’s different from you.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be immersed in three compelling and uplifting stories — while also discovering what it’s like to be someone with cancer, sickle cell anemia, or heart disease.

I also hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for finding different solutions that may have a great impact on these people.

You will love this book if you:
  • Enjoy reading uplifting, high-stakes stories
  • Are looking for something fresh, new, and unexpected
  • Like learning about cool science and technology that’s relevant to real life
I’m super-glad I got to write this book, and hope it turns out to be an entertaining AND transformational experience once you read it!

 

The Book - “The Sun Will Rise Tomorrow"

3 stories. 3 diseases. 3 lives...that are about to end.

The book has 3 stories:

STORY 1 is about Julian Hunt.

Julian is scientist whose 11-year old daughter has recently been diagnosed with cancer. He wants his daughter to stay alive, but his past experience with treatments like chemotherapy drives him to look for something better. Something that’s safer and more reliable.

As Julian races against the clock to figure out how else to help his daughter, he learns about a technology that might be just what he’s looking for. But whether it’ll work or not is a different story.

STORY 2 is about Dwayne Freeman.

He's in his mid-20's, earns a stable income — and has sickle cell, a disease that overwhelms him in regular pain and the fear of an early death. Rather than fight his enemy head-on, he coaxes himself to deal with the blows.

When he makes a new friend who turns his life around, he struggles as he learns to go past his personal fears around the treatments and embrace that which can secure his future — before it’s taken away.

STORY 3 is about Alan Sapolsky.

Al is a white-collar worker who spends a good portion of his day working at the office or catching up on the newest Netflix show. After his favorite manager survives a heart attack, he tries to get him to make lasting lifestyle changes — before something worse happens.

But changing habits that’ve been around since childhood won’t be easy. Al knows this pretty well — he can’t get himself to change his OWN unhealthy lifestyle.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition!

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook!

 

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will specially appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will get to be a part of the insider community and will get to learn about behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Aditya D. Goyal is a full-time psychology and computer science student at Florida Atlantic University.

He’s the founder of the Association of STEM Entrepreneurs, a club that helps students build their leadership and entrepreneurship skills. He’s also the current CEO and founder of Polka Box, an EdTech company that builds video games and other products to help kids master math and science. He’s a current member of Toastmasters International, where he was fortunate enough to build his public speaking and leadership skills with the help of its talented members.

He wrote “The Sun Will Rise Tomorrow” to combine his passion for science and storytelling while making a positive impact.

He loves being at the intersection of psychology, technology, and business. He’s always been curious about understanding what makes people want to learn and do something.

In his spare time, he enjoys cooking dal (an Indian dish made of yellow lentils), traveling, and sipping coffee while reading a book at Barnes & Noble.

For more information, you can email Adi at adevendra2013@fau.edu and connect with him at his LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Best,
Adi

 

NOTE: 

  • The names, stories and settings are subject to change before my projected publication date.
  • All orders outside the United States will have a $25 fee for shipping and handling. Shipping costs will be covered for all orders in the United States.
  • This book is not prescribing solutions or treatments, but rather aims to show potential areas that are being explored to treat the diseases

Rather than fight his enemy head-on, he coaxes himself to deal with the blows.When he makes a new friend who turns his life around, he struggles as he learns to go past his personal fears around the treatments and embrace that which can secure his future — before it’s taken away.STORY 3 is about Alan Sapolsky.Al is a white-collar worker who spends a good portion of his day working at the office or catching up on the newest Netflix show. After his favorite manager survives a heart attack, he tries to get him to make lasting lifestyle changes — before something worse happens.But changing habits that’ve been around since childhood won’t be easy. Al knows this pretty well — he can’t get himself to change his OWN unhealthy lifestyle.

 
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring


 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition!When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook!
 


 
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will specially appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will get to be a part of the insider community and will get to learn about behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!


 
About the Author
Aditya D. Goyal is a full-time psychology and computer science student at Florida Atlantic University.He’s the founder of the Association of STEM Entrepreneurs, a club that helps students build their leadership and entrepreneurship skills. He’s also the current CEO and founder of Polka Box, an EdTech company that builds video games and other products to help kids master math and science. He’s a current member of Toastmasters International, where he was fortunate enough to build his public speaking and leadership skills with the help of its talented members.He wrote “The Sun Will Rise Tomorrow” to combine his passion for science and storytelling while making a positive impact.He loves being at the intersection of psychology, technology, and business. He’s always been curious about understanding what makes people want to learn and do something.In his spare time, he enjoys cooking dal (an Indian dish made of yellow lentils), traveling, and sipping coffee while reading a book at Barnes & Noble.For more information, you can email Adi at adevendra2013@fau.edu and connect with him at his LinkedIn.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
  Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Best,Adi NOTE: 
The names, stories and settings are subject to change before my projected publication date.
All orders outside the United States will have a $25 fee for shipping and handling. Shipping costs will be covered for all orders in the United States.
This book is not prescribing solutions or treatments, but rather aims to show potential areas that are being explored to treat the diseases

story:
Who We Are

We are a collective of eight students in Humber College's Arts Administration and Cultural Management graduate certificate program in Toronto, Ontario. 

  • Rachel Martine, Project Manager
  • Eileen Firth, Project Coordinator
  • Meghan McCracken, Development Coordinator
  • Hayley Reeve, Event Coordinator 
  • Rita Kim, Web Editor
  • Tija Freimuta, Print Editor
  • Emma Pagacz, Communications Coordinator
  • Anna Maksyutynska, Communications Coordinator

Project Summary

Our publication will come together through a series of approximately 30 interviews with arts managers working in Toronto. A photographer will capture accompanying images of the interviewees in their natural, creative workspaces. Once we've conducted the interviews, a title for the publication will be selected based on key themes or phrases that emerge. 

The publication will be distributed primarily online with physical copies also available. This publication, as the title of the project suggests, is to arts managers. We hope to paint a picture of Toronto's arts community and provide a platform for culture workers to share their stories with one another. We also plan to distribute the publication to educational institutions for students interested in pursuing a career in the arts.

Mission

By publishing profiles of arts managers working in Toronto, we hope to showcase and celebrate their stories, compile advice and inspiration for other culture workers, and provide insight into career opportunities in the arts. 

What We Need & What You Get

All funds raised through this campaign will be used to cover the costs of printing physical copies of our publication, providing an honorarium for our photographer, and hosting a small reception/networking event to thank our partners and interviewees. Our collective is working on the project in a volunteer capacity in fulfillment of our "capstone" course in arts management.

If you don't have the capacity to donate to our project, we could still use your help. You can contribute to the TO Arts Managers project right away by sharing our campaign on social media and again in April, by sharing our online publication.

story:
I've often had the thought that no one would ever love me. Have you? With this devotional, I want to break the chains that hold our hearts captive. With each word and each paragraph, I want every heart to understand the true meaning of love and who really adores them.

The truth is, no one will ever love you...the way Jesus does!

Using real life stories and experiences from fellow believers, this devotional is meant to bring glory to God and showcase what REAL love is: His love. There will be stories of tragedy, heartbreak, depression and life altering events...but all end with God's miraculous love covering those who have been changed forever.

This devotional isn't formatted as a timeframe-type book, like "30 day challenge" or "21 days of love". It is divided into sections and mini-sections to help the mind and heart focus more on the content.

 

Your funding will help self-publish this devotional through Morris Publishing. This company is amazing and helped incredibly when I published my first book, The Palace Keepers, which was majorly successful and has sold over 110 copies since it's launch in April of last year. For this campaign, the money contributed will go towards an ISBN number, book editing, full color cover and the first book order.

This devotional is so important in a society that paints an untrue picture of what love is. People struggle every day as they fall into the lies of the enemy. Hope is fading fast and souls need this devotional to inspire them, uplift them, show them who The Lord Jesus Christ really is and what He thinks of them.

Help me by spreading the word about this project. Use the share tools attached to this campaign and join me as bonds are broken, hearts are set free and love (real Godly love) is sent into all the world.

story:
Junkyard at No Town

I'm a Vermonter who grew up in rural poverty - my parents divorced, my mom raised four of us on a meager sixties and seventies school teacher's salary. We lived among long-time Vermont, working class families, but both my parents came from educated, middle-class backgrounds. I was different and survived bullying by observing and adapting.

Though I'm an English major, I have learned to speak perfect Vermont. Now I've written a novel inhabited by amusing and amazing characters, inspired by Woodchucks (native Vermonters) I have met. I also used my musings on old property lines, abandoned homesteads in the woods, places where people used to live, to infuse an element of transcendence and extra-normal mystery into the story. 

I'm asking you to help me find readers the best way I can think of: publish the book. 

Why do I need $6500 for an Independent Publisher?

  • A partner on the book, copy editing,  professional, high-quality book design
  • Distribution networks to get the book in bookstores
  • Help with publicity, book readings and signings, reviews, submission for awards.

Your donation will make this possible

I'm not doing this to tell my friends I published a book. I think this book could find its way into the canon of good Vermont and regional fiction. I don't expect to get rich or party with J.K. Rowling, but I think readers will like the book and it has a chance to succeed if you will help me launch it. 

Your donation gets the manuscript turned into a beautiful book

You get an advance copy. 

Actually printing the book will be my cost. Maybe I won't even break even... But  my dream is that the book be read and that the experience encourages me to write on. I think a lot of people will really like Junkyard at No Town. I'm asking for your help because I simply don't have the resources to make this life-long ambition come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support can come on other forms

  • Pass on this request to our friends who might want to support this publication.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

Thank you so much for your donation.

story: On November 22nd my family will be traveling to Los Planes De Renderos El Salvador, a small community about 15 minutes from San Salvador. While there we will be feeding the children (families also welcome) dinners. Depending on how much money we can raise we would also like to take the kids on a day trip, we are open to ideas still because we would love to hear from the kids themselves somewhere they'd like to go. It could be something as simple as going to a hamburger restaurant because most of these kids have never tried a burger in their life or maybe a trip to the zoo. We would also love to get them gifts, focusing on toys. The picture posted was of a previous donation, we can't wait to see it in person, much love The Avery and Kurth Family.

story:
Update: Looks can be deceiving.  

We have raised $9,152.  We have raised $520 on the Indiegogo Campaign and $8,632 from direct contributions. 

Thank you for believing in Earth: Battlefield of Two Worlds.  I am blown away by your gracious support.  This book will be a reality and it is all because of your financial support!

About Me

My name is E'yen A. Gardner I have been a full-time writer for over 10 years.  I have written over 16 non-fiction books but Earth is my first novel.  I am a storyteller at heart and Earth is my baby.  The main characters in Earth are each on their own journey as some battle for power while others deal with how to embrace the power they possess.  This wonderful story has lived inside my heart for several years.  I have written the initial draft but now is the time to finish Earth and share this powerful story with the world.  

The money raised will cover the cost of the production and distribution of Earth.  Some of the expenses included are the first print run, editing, book formatting, copyrighting, marketing, graphic design. 

For your financial contribution, you will receive a copy of the book and a special acknowledgment in the book as well as other perks depending on the reward tier you choose.  Thank you in advance for your gracious support.  

The Impact

I am the father of six children and they are my biggest inspiration for writing Earth.  It is a story that shares the message that your life matters regardless of what the world has labeled you.  Your life has the power to change the world for someone else by you just being yourself.  When you feel shackled by your circumstances you carry the power to change them.  

 

"The fate of Earth is in the hands of One."

You are the One.

You have the power to bring Earth to life. 

 

"Dream Big. Live Bigger" - E'yen A. Gardner

story:
Winter Tangerine Review Needs You!

My name is Yasmin Belkhyr. I'm a writer in NYC and the Founder and Editor-in-Chief of Winter Tangerine Review, a literary journal dedicated to electric poetry, prose, drama, visual art and short films. Winter Tangerine Review was born in March of 2013, after I realized that what was missing from the literary world was a journal dedicated to publishing established writers/artists alongside young college aged writers/artists. 

I wanted to create something that would push talented, young writers and artists into the rocky world of publishing, something that would find new voices with stories to tell. My staff and I try to make Winter Tangerine more than just something that publishes art, but a piece of art itself.

In our first three reading periods, we received well over four thousand submissions, from teenagers with little experience out of English class to career writers with publications in the Kenyon Review, Paris Review and the New Yorker. All of the pieces were read blindly by WTR staff so that a MFA candidate would have as good a chance of being accepted as an 11th grader. Our acceptance rate throughout our history has hovered just under five percent. 

 We aim to publish pieces that are electric, pieces that are like a punch in the throat, a match burning against fingertips. We've featured artists including Steven Labadessa, ARINA, Erika Craig, and Amy Guidry, as well as writers including Terese Svoboda, Kyle McCord, Chad Simpson, and Todd Kaneko. We've published National Student Poets, Poet Laureates from across the United States, U.S Presidential Scholar in the Arts nominees, Guggeinheim Fellows, Pushcart Prize winners, and NY Times Best Selling Authors. 

But at the end of the day, that's not what really matters. What matters is the writing and art that we put out every couple of months, the poetry and the short stories and the paintings that hit our nerves, that ignite our minds. From our first volume, we've been absolutely dedicated with sharing gorgeous poetry, prose and artwork with the world, and we're extremely excited for our two new categories, Drama and Film.

We have a volunteer staff of over 50 writers and artists, and a contributor community of over 200 incredibly talented individuals. We have been someone's first publication and someone's hundredth. We have shared such hauntingly beautiful work, honestly, the work that WTR puts out comes from really, really amazing people, and all I want is to be able to continue to find the voices, to find the pieces, that just click, that make a mark right away.

Winter Tangerine Review was initially funded by an IndieGoGo campaign, and as we've grown in the past year, those funds have been entirely depleted, and all sales we've made have gone back into the journal.  We want Winter Tangerine to continue expanding and solidifying its stance as a journal that challenges people to leave boundaries behind and give pages personalities. We need you- right now, WTR is very, very close to going entirely bankrupt. 

Anything helps. Give us the stability to do what we love: sharing art, writing and (soon!) short films with the world.


What We Need

We are asking for 4k. Yeah, it is a lot. 


But here's the thing: if everyone who subscribed to WTR's newsletter or submitted to us or liked us on Facebook donated just one dollar, we'd be done with our fundraiser and be back to business. Four thousand seems like a lot- but with your donation, we'll make it.

"What even do you need four thousand dollars for???" 

Great question! So, unfortunately, we have incredibly high monthly expenses (our website, Submittable, etc) and every time we put out a volume, we've got to throw down over a thousand dollars to print the beautiful all-color copies of WTR. We also have to send out contributor and staff copies of each volume which is so painfully expensive. 

We have Reading & Art Exhibitions in NYC every couple of months, and while I'd love to say we make money from those events- we don't. Our November Reading & Art Exhibition in NYC, which was an absolutely AMAZING night, filled with fantastic poetry performances, art, and good food, cost us hundreds of dollars (and that was with donations from the audience!). We've renamed our events "WTR: Poetry, Art & Film", as we'll be screening the accepted films at these events as well! We plan on holding a celebratory event in NYC on March 22nd, our one year anniversary, as well as several others in the upcoming months. Readings are so important because it connects the artwork with the artist, the poet with their words. To be able to watch poets perform their work, to see artists glow over compliments on their photography, to see art light up and breathe, is such an important aspect of WTR's mission, and truly, the mission of literature and art worldwide.

Since WTR was created, I wanted to establish the "Winter Tangerine Awards", a blindly-read contest for all the lovely writers, cinematographers and artists who submit to us. I think that validation is really nice, and awards are really nice, and I'd love to be able to send someone a letter that says "You are extraordinary. Your poem/short story/screenplay/creative nonfiction piece/painting/sculpture/film/play/etc is extraordinarily". We've been planning this since March of last year (engraved trophies shaped like tangerines! guest judges! an awards ceremony/reading in NYC!)  but haven't gathered the funds to actually put it into action. For obvious reasons, this isn't the first thing on our agenda, but we really do want to create this competition at some point. 

The most important thing for us right now is to stay afloat. During our last Indiegogo, I foolishly thought WTR could survive on the $570 we raised. That was a stepping stone, a starting point, and for a while, it worked. But we've grown and we're still growing, and we do need something solid to help us continue to make a presence with the work we publish. 

You are here because you are part of our community.  You are part of our audience, part of what makes WTR so incredible. Right now, I need your help. 

What You Get

Help, of course, does not go unnoticed, which is why we've got some amazing perks for everyone who decides to defy what our world thinks, and make a movement to save the arts!

$9: A digital copy of either Volume One or Volume Two of Winter Tangerine Review, with a special note from the staff of WTR! 

$16: A digital copy of both Volume One and Volume Two, with a special note from the staff of WTR and another super great email from Editor-in-Chief, Yasmin Belkhyr! 

$25: A personalized & signed print copy of Volume One! Includes the special note from the staff of WTR + the super special email from EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr! 

$50: All of the "Friend" perk + a personalized & signed print copy of Volume Two (may take much longer to receive than Volume One) + a personal letter of gratitude from EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr! 

$100: A one year subscription to WTR, starting with our third volume! You'll be named a bronze sponsor on our website, and you will get a handwritten letter of gratitude from EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr! You'll also receive a book of the staff's choice along with Volume Three of WTR! 

$250: All of the "Bronze Sponsor" perk, but you will receive a two year subscription to WTR + named a silver sponsor in all of our journals + you'll get a WTR tote bag and button once they become available+ you'll get a shout-out at our birthday reading for all of the internet to hear (we will say lovely things about you) + you'll also receive an invitation to our WTR Volume Three release party in NYC! 

$500: All of the "Silver Sponsor" perk, but you will receive a three year subscription to WTR (that's approximately 12 copies of WTR!!) + named a gold sponsor in all of our journals + EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr will send you three books of her choosing + call you to thank you profusely (she will probably cry) + you'll receive updates on the regular of what's going on with WTR! .

$1000: All of the "Gold Sponsor" perk, but you will receive a four year subscription to WTR (That's 16 copies of WTR. Imagine how much good poetry that is. Imagine the art. So much art.) + named a ~platinum~ sponsor on your own special "platinum sponsor" page in all of our journals + you'll be invited to a special Skype breakfast video call with the administration of WTR. You'll dress your best, ignore Yasmin's crying, and eat the best eggs on the market. (We will not provide the eggs, unfortunately).


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay, there are tons of other ways you can help:

  • Share this Indiegogo to everyone you know! Your mother, your kindergarten teacher, your rich friends who decided not to go to grad school, the barista at Starbucks, the cop that gave you that ticket last week. Find him. Tell him to donate. 
  • If you're not that creepy, sharing on Facebook, Twitter, email, Tumblr + all other social media places would be so so wonderful!

-

We frequently receive messages from young writers and artists telling us that we were the first place they ever submitted, thanking us for giving them that push.

So give us that push. Please. We will thank you endlessly, every time we publish another poem, another short story, another piece of art. 

Winter Tangerine Review is a literary & arts journal dedicated to the electric. 

So, go ahead. Ignite.

We have a volunteer staff of over 50 writers and artists, and a contributor community of over 200 incredibly talented individuals. We have been someone's first publication and someone's hundredth. We have shared such hauntingly beautiful work, honestly, the work that WTR puts out comes from really, really amazing people, and all I want is to be able to continue to find the voices, to find the pieces, that just click, that make a mark right away.
Winter Tangerine Review was initially funded by an IndieGoGo campaign, and as we've grown in the past year, those funds have been entirely depleted, and all sales we've made have gone back into the journal.  We want Winter Tangerine to continue expanding and solidifying its stance as a journal that challenges people to leave boundaries behind and give pages personalities. We need you- right now, WTR is very, very close to going entirely bankrupt. 
Anything helps. Give us the stability to do what we love: sharing art, writing and (soon!) short films with the world.What We NeedWe are asking for 4k. Yeah, it is a lot. But here's the thing: if everyone who subscribed to WTR's newsletter or submitted to us or liked us on Facebook donated just one dollar, we'd be done with our fundraiser and be back to business. Four thousand seems like a lot- but with your donation, we'll make it."What even do you need four thousand dollars for???" Great question! So, unfortunately, we have incredibly high monthly expenses (our website, Submittable, etc) and every time we put out a volume, we've got to throw down over a thousand dollars to print the beautiful all-color copies of WTR. We also have to send out contributor and staff copies of each volume which is so painfully expensive. We have Reading & Art Exhibitions in NYC every couple of months, and while I'd love to say we make money from those events- we don't. Our November Reading & Art Exhibition in NYC, which was an absolutely AMAZING night, filled with fantastic poetry performances, art, and good food, cost us hundreds of dollars (and that was with donations from the audience!). We've renamed our events "WTR: Poetry, Art & Film", as we'll be screening the accepted films at these events as well! We plan on holding a celebratory event in NYC on March 22nd, our one year anniversary, as well as several others in the upcoming months. Readings are so important because it connects the artwork with the artist, the poet with their words. To be able to watch poets perform their work, to see artists glow over compliments on their photography, to see art light up and breathe, is such an important aspect of WTR's mission, and truly, the mission of literature and art worldwide.Since WTR was created, I wanted to establish the "Winter Tangerine Awards", a blindly-read contest for all the lovely writers, cinematographers and artists who submit to us. I think that validation is really nice, and awards are really nice, and I'd love to be able to send someone a letter that says "You are extraordinary. Your poem/short story/screenplay/creative nonfiction piece/painting/sculpture/film/play/etc is extraordinarily". We've been planning this since March of last year (engraved trophies shaped like tangerines! guest judges! an awards ceremony/reading in NYC!)  but haven't gathered the funds to actually put it into action. For obvious reasons, this isn't the first thing on our agenda, but we really do want to create this competition at some point. The most important thing for us right now is to stay afloat. During our last Indiegogo, I foolishly thought WTR could survive on the $570 we raised. That was a stepping stone, a starting point, and for a while, it worked. But we've grown and we're still growing, and we do need something solid to help us continue to make a presence with the work we publish. You are here because you are part of our community.  You are part of our audience, part of what makes WTR so incredible. Right now, I need your help. What You GetHelp, of course, does not go unnoticed, which is why we've got some amazing perks for everyone who decides to defy what our world thinks, and make a movement to save the arts!$9: A digital copy of either Volume One or Volume Two of Winter Tangerine Review, with a special note from the staff of WTR! $16: A digital copy of both Volume One and Volume Two, with a special note from the staff of WTR and another super great email from Editor-in-Chief, Yasmin Belkhyr! $25: A personalized & signed print copy of Volume One! Includes the special note from the staff of WTR + the super special email from EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr! $50: All of the "Friend" perk + a personalized & signed print copy of Volume Two (may take much longer to receive than Volume One) + a personal letter of gratitude from EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr! $100: A one year subscription to WTR, starting with our third volume! You'll be named a bronze sponsor on our website, and you will get a handwritten letter of gratitude from EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr! You'll also receive a book of the staff's choice along with Volume Three of WTR! $250: All of the "Bronze Sponsor" perk, but you will receive a two year subscription to WTR + named a silver sponsor in all of our journals + you'll get a WTR tote bag and button once they become available+ you'll get a shout-out at our birthday reading for all of the internet to hear (we will say lovely things about you) + you'll also receive an invitation to our WTR Volume Three release party in NYC! $500: All of the "Silver Sponsor" perk, but you will receive a three year subscription to WTR (that's approximately 12 copies of WTR!!) + named a gold sponsor in all of our journals + EIC, Yasmin Belkhyr will send you three books of her choosing + call you to thank you profusely (she will probably cry) + you'll receive updates on the regular of what's going on with WTR! .$1000: All of the "Gold Sponsor" perk, but you will receive a four year subscription to WTR (That's 16 copies of WTR. Imagine how much good poetry that is. Imagine the art. So much art.) + named a ~platinum~ sponsor on your own special "platinum sponsor" page in all of our journals + you'll be invited to a special Skype breakfast video call with the administration of WTR. You'll dress your best, ignore Yasmin's crying, and eat the best eggs on the market. (We will not provide the eggs, unfortunately).Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute, that's okay, there are tons of other ways you can help:
Share this Indiegogo to everyone you know! Your mother, your kindergarten teacher, your rich friends who decided not to go to grad school, the barista at Starbucks, the cop that gave you that ticket last week. Find him. Tell him to donate. 


If you're not that creepy, sharing on Facebook, Twitter, email, Tumblr + all other social media places would be so so wonderful!

-We frequently receive messages from young writers and artists telling us that we were the first place they ever submitted, thanking us for giving them that push.So give us that push. Please. We will thank you endlessly, every time we publish another poem, another short story, another piece of art. Winter Tangerine Review is a literary & arts journal dedicated to the electric. So, go ahead. Ignite.

story:
Story of My Book

An American Family is a tale of unconventional heroism in the distant future of our world. The story follows Leslie Ratley and her family traversing a multiverse in hopes to find a new world for humanity, while the long standing ideologies of human purpose stand in the way.

My name is Jack Deignan and I am the author of An American Family. I wrote this book because I believe the future of our world is in the hands of empathy, and uncontrollable. This book is my call to recognize the privilege history has created for a select group of people, and manifest a world that prioritizes every life under its citizenship. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some of your own privileges and biases you have always taken for granted, and incorporate empathy more commonly in your daily life. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the intersectionality of race and power in this country, and in this world. You'll learn alongside the Ratley family about the importance of recognizing privilege, but not using it to force your name in a conversation that should be about someone else.  

In the middle of the 2040s in the United States, temperatures across the country have risen to historical rates once again and many cities have become inhabitable. Meanwhile, systemic racism and implicit biases that have infected this country since its conception are still widespread, and the ever-nearing extinction of earth has forced the hand of thousands of Americans to resort to violence. President Slack and his administration sit idly by watching the world burn below them, but Leslie Ratley and her family have a chance to find a solution. President Slack approves of a mission to search for an alternate reality, although he never intends to keep his promise of seeing this mission through. With the President’s deception unbeknownst to them, the Ratley family traverses a multiverse in search of a world to save humanity and escape their dying one. Throughout the progression of their journey, Leslie has to confront a lot of her own biases and privileges in order to accomplish the mission of her lifetime. Eventually, Leslie has to make a decision between the country and her family, a decision looming from the start of the book. 

You will love this book if you are interested in the intersectionality of race and privilege in America, advocation for a revamped policy and approach towards the threat of global warming, and the endless possibilities of alternate realities and multiverses.

An American Family speaks to White people and authority figures who want to grapple with privilege and responsibility in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that An American Family inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How has privilege contributed to or harmed my life?

How can I recognize my privilege and use it to amplify marginalized voices?

How quickly can we re-educate the ideas and constructs of humanity before it leads to our eventual demise?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing race, power, privilege, and the climate will change us all for the better. 

Themes

The primary theme of this book is race, and how Whiteness has caused the erasure of other races in the United States. Since the conception of this country, Whiteness has been held as a standard that has led to inherent privilege for members of the race, whether they recognize it or not. Regardless of whether it is recognized, the only way to use this privilege to enhance the lives of the marginalized is to amplify their voices and struggles. This is an internal battle that Leslie Ratley will struggle with throughout the book, as her original intention in helping the less privileged is still tethered to her desire to be a good example of Whiteness. Eventually, she must learn that she must use her privilege to listen instead of act, but she will have to learn this before it is too late. 

Another theme in my book is the idea of power, especially in the United States. Due to power being so concentrated in this country since its origin, the accountability it has today is little to none. If the power structure in the United States is not reorganized to truly represent the citizens of this country, it will eventually lead to our demise. President Slack is an example of power being unchecked in the United States, and his executive rule could lead to the deaths of millions. 

The last theme I would like to emphasize is empathy, as I believe empathy is the root of securing a future for our humanity. From the beginning of time, there has always been this stereotype that there must be an authority in order to have a purpose, and it has clouded the beliefs about humanity in so many cultures. With so many obstacles facing our country today and we are expected to face in the future, our country must learn to teach and emphasize empathy in order to listen to as many voices as possible. If we do not come together as one human race, it will be the end of every race before we know it. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Jack Deignan is a third-year English major, Spanish, and Film minor at UCLA. His dad thinks he is a hard worker and his mom thinks he is the most handsome son on the planet. 

Jack Deignan wrote this book because he has confidence that the world has enough information available and minds at work to ensure humanity survives for centuries to come, and can become a world where every single person is truly created equal. He hopes to manifest more use of empathy and compassion in the United States, and people choose to listen before succumbing to implicit biases that have always incepted their beliefs. 

Jack loves to play any sport with a ball, as he has been doing his whole life, although his competitive career has reached its end. He also loves to hang out with his two great danes Baron and Rizzo, and hopes to be a big dog owner his whole life. 

For more information, you can connect with Jack Deignan at deignanjack11@yahoo.com and at IG: @jmdwrite, Twitter: @deignanjack11, Snapchat: @jackdeignan, Facebook: Jack Deignan, Linkedin: linkedin.com/in/jack-deignan.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

 

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #AnAmericanFamily and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jack Deignan

story:
¿Qué?

La noche de las brujas nos muestra una distopía en la que, durante generaciones, las brujas se han esparcido por el mundo. Algunas buscaron sitios alejados de la humanidad para vivir como hacían sus antepasados. Otras decidieron convivir entre humanos dando ejemplo de humanidad, escondidas a la luz del sol en las calles de Nueva York o París. Están en todas partes, escondidas, ocultas para no ser cazadas.

Cada familia carga con su pasado, y los Haywire, una antigua familia de brujos, están a punto de descubrirlo cuando la vieja maldición que persigue a toda su estirpe se presenta en forma de lo que ellos menos esperan.

La unión fraternal y familiar que los une se verá puesta a prueba por la sangre que comparten y por los secretos que amenazan con consumir a todos los integrantes de la familia hasta convertirlos en cenizas antes de que llegue la noche de las brujas.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Jose Neva Fernández.

Desde pequeño su vida estuvo marcada por la necesidad de leer o contar historias. Eso lo ha llevado a estudiar Arte Dramático y formarse como actor en Sevilla. Este escritor originario de Cádiz reside actualmente en Málaga, donde se está formando en Dirección y Dramaturgia a la vez que compagina su pasión por la lectura y la escritura.

La noche de las brujas es su primera novela, mientras trabaja en Mi último vals, una obra que reúne trece relatos de sus vivencias y recuerdos tratados con el cariño que solo un escritor puede dedicar a las palabras.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Presagio

Cuando nos dimos cuenta de que el mayor de nuestros “dones” se encontraba en nuestras palabras y nuestra capacidad de evitar toda culpa, era demasiado tarde para todos. Algunos, ya habíamos sido asesinados sin piedad. Otros, los más inteligentes, huyeron a sitios más soleados, arrastrando la culpa pero sin mirar atrás. Y los últimos, los restantes, tuvimos que mirar el odio y el temor en los ojos de los demás, mientras unas manos de verdugo nos amarraban a los postes de fría madera, y justo segundos después, nos quemaban vivos,  bajo la atenta mirada de una ciudad entera que jamás reconocerían sus errores.

Premonición

Todos se giraron hacia el chico. Él estaba aún recuperando el control de su mente y su cuerpo. Parecía realmente fatigada. Todos los presentes lo miraron con solemnidad, temor y expectación. Incluidos Jules y Margaret, a quien por primera vez en la noche, algo le interesaba.
          ―Ocurre en este mismo salón. El suelo está lleno de sangre. Ya no estamos todos. Algunos están… muy lejos. Otros… han iniciado una guerra entre ellos. Los secretos… los secretos destruirán a esta familia. Arderemos hasta las cenizas. Y ni el diablo podrá salvar a más de uno de los presentes.

Hoguera

Todo su cuerpo comenzó a arder, y sus gritos ensordecedores invadieron la casa que la vio nacer, crecer, vivir y finalmente… morir. El olor a pelo quemado invadió las fosas nasales de los descendientes, mientras veían desaparecer cada fragmento de vida dentro de su familiar, hasta convertirse en un cadáver carbonizado.
          Una persona por la que habían profesado tanto amor, y que tanto dolor les había causado. Una despedida más, al fin y al cabo.»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Jose Neva Fernández vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
