Cuando nos dimos cuenta de que el mayor de nuestros “dones” se encontraba en nuestras palabras y nuestra capacidad de evitar toda culpa, era demasiado tarde para todos. Algunos, ya habíamos sido asesinados sin piedad. Otros, los más inteligentes, huyeron a sitios más soleados, arrastrando la culpa pero sin mirar atrás. Y los últimos, los restantes, tuvimos que mirar el odio y el temor en los ojos de los demás, mientras unas manos de verdugo nos amarraban a los postes de fría madera, y justo segundos después, nos quemaban vivos,  bajo la atenta mirada de una ciudad entera que jamás reconocerían sus errores.
Premonición
Todos se giraron hacia el chico. Él estaba aún recuperando el control de su mente y su cuerpo. Parecía realmente fatigada. Todos los presentes lo miraron con solemnidad, temor y expectación. Incluidos Jules y Margaret, a quien por primera vez en la noche, algo le interesaba.          ―Ocurre en este mismo salón. El suelo está lleno de sangre. Ya no estamos todos. Algunos están… muy lejos. Otros… han iniciado una guerra entre ellos. Los secretos… los secretos destruirán a esta familia. Arderemos hasta las cenizas. Y ni el diablo podrá salvar a más de uno de los presentes.
Hoguera
Todo su cuerpo comenzó a arder, y sus gritos ensordecedores invadieron la casa que la vio nacer, crecer, vivir y finalmente… morir. El olor a pelo quemado invadió las fosas nasales de los descendientes, mientras veían desaparecer cada fragmento de vida dentro de su familiar, hasta convertirse en un cadáver carbonizado.          Una persona por la que habían profesado tanto amor, y que tanto dolor les había causado. Una despedida más, al fin y al cabo.»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Jose Neva Fernández vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
Política de Privacidad

story:
The Campaign In Brief

Welcome to the campaign for Galaxy Ascendant books 4 & 5, A Fiery Reckoning I: Ascendancy’s Rise, and A Fiery Reckoning II: Empire’s Fall!

I’m Yakov Merkin, author of the Galaxy Ascendant series, The Dragon Hand, and a few other things. I’m also a recovering academic and active duty soldier in the Israeli Defense Force.

While I’ve been blessed with the ability to write quite a bit during my service, these books being the second and third I’ve written over about a 19 month period, army salaries aren’t anything to write home about, and, as I’m doing all of this on my own, it can be a bit difficult. My aim with this campaign is to raise the funds to be able to pay my cover artist, editor, map artist, and formatters for their excellent services and bring these next two books of the Galaxy Ascendant series to life!

Now, the big question: Why try and fund two books at once? The answer in simple. These two books were originally conceived as one; however, it quickly became apparent that the story was so big it required two books to tell properly, and so we come to the two biggest books in the series so far, if not in word count than in the scope of events that take place. We follow more than eight primary characters through this war which began in Galaxy Ascendant book 3, A Shifting Alliance, and which has only further escalated.

My ultimate goal with my writing is to make this my full time job once I complete my army service, and one crucial stepping stone to that is being able to continue to be able to afford to get the highest quality people to work with me on this project—which will not end when the series concludes with book 7. The Galaxy Ascendant is here to stay.

That’s where you come in. By helping me cover these costs, you assure that this series, loved by its readers, can continue, and you can help ensure that in an age where so many established space opera franchises are reeling, new, fresh, and awesome stories can still be told in—in my opinion—the best speculative fiction genre out there.

Some More Detail

As mentioned above, I need your help to be able to pay my artists, editors, and more for top-quality work.

Of course, you will get things in return for your support. Perks range from a cheap as $5, which nets you ebooks of books 4 & 5, up to levels that get you the entire series in ebook and print, with Galactic level reward tiers that can see you help shape this emerging universe.

With the Travel to the Galaxy Ascendant, A Glorious Death, and Live in the Galaxy Ascendant reward levels, you will get the opportunity to work with me to create a side character who will appear in the last two books of the series.

With the Ship Design reward levels, you will work with me and an artist to design ship concept art. Level 1 sees you get input into the look of ships already established in the series, while level 2 allows you to help create, from the ground up (with some limitations) designs and specs for ships mentioned but not described in detail in the series—or possibly an entirely new ship type which will appear in book 6 or 7. ;)

Lastly, if you truly want to make your mark on the Galaxy Ascendant, we have a new, mega reward tier that will see you work with me to craft a Galaxy Ascendant short story which will be canon to the universe, centering on a character of your choice from the series. Apart from that, you will help determine the type of story that will be written, what will happen, etc (I get some say too, of course), and then I will write the story, which will be dedicated to you in thanks for your generous support. You will of course see it before anyone else. Additionally, when I eventually (within the next year or two most likely) put together a collection of Galaxy Ascendant short stories, yours will be included as well.

If we don’t hit my goal, I will still, thanks to flexible funding, get whatever was raised. I will find a way to ensure the books come out regardless and that the series continues, but that will be much more doable with your generous assistance.

The Impact

Many of the great sci-fi franchises we grew up with and which inspired us are not in a good state today, whether due to poor creative decisions by those overseeing them, or through simple abandonment. The Galaxy Ascendant series is my contribution to an indie space opera renaissance, a vast, expansive galactic setting in which the storytelling options are endless, and in which I intend to write for a long, long time to come. And this galaxy is growing rapidly. Book 1, A Greater Duty, was released in May 2017, and now we’re nearly at the release of book 5. G-d willing, books 6 & 7 will be out by next spring. In total, I’ve already put out four novels, including A Greater Duty, in that time span, along with several smaller works. And as those who backed my last camping can attest, I get the rewards out on time, and the book released promptly. I take great pride in getting my work done, on time, and getting people what they paid for. If there are any unforeseen delays, rest assured that I will be completely transparent about them.

Risks & Challenges

There are none for you! As I mentioned above, I pride myself on getting the work done, on time, and I am easily reachable if there are any issues (due to time delay and army stuff, it might take my a couple days to get back to you, but I always do.)

Obviously, there are more risks & challenges here for me; I have the books to get ready and out, after all, and, as can be seen, I’ve already gotten most aspects of the project done (cover arts, maps, and book 4’s editing) done so that there will be as little as possible time between the campaign’s end and when rewards start shipping out.

This is why it’s all the more vital that I be able to raise the necessary funds via this campaign, so I can properly pay everyone on time. Whatever happens, I will make it work and get the books out, because this is what I do. This series is something I need to complete and share with the world. But it’d be much better, much more pleasant, if this campaign can take care of that. Success here will better enable me to put out more, awesome products in the coming year—and of do I have fun things planned!

Other Ways You Can Help

I knew that there are plenty of people out there for whom money is tight; I’ve been there myself. However, even if you’re unable to contribute at this time, you can still greatly help this campaign by sharing it out with others online, telling people you know personally about it, or even by sharing the campaign video, which is on YouTube. Don’t underestimate just how much even a simple share, which takes barely a second or two to do, can do to help! It only takes the right person seeing the campaign to help ensure that it is a success.

story:
I can give you a detailed run down about my academic career. I could tell you how I started college in 2009 when most of my peers were settling down or starting careers of their own. I can tell you that I graduated from Hostos Community College in the South Bronx and was the first Hostos alum to get into the CUNY BA program, which I will be graduating from with a BA in Multi-Ethnic Literature and Multi-Ethnic Women and Gender Studies in the same month that I will be turning 30 (boy, that return of Saturn kicked my ass). I can tell you all of that in much more elaborate and boring detail.

I can lay out all the gory details....The sacrifices, the time put in, the anxiety attacks, the isolation and hermit-crabbiness, the juggling of work and school and life and love and on and on and on. But the one thing that kept me going was knowing that all the sacrifice, time, hard work, and CUNY bullcrap would leave me with a shiny BA and the long-awaited end of a chapter in my life. The next chapter is VONA. 

I'll be completely honest with you. I have BUSTED MY ASS in undergrad. I have, at times, really struggled with completing it. I have also, at times, neglected the one thing that has ALWAYS kept me sane. And that....is writing. If you know me, you know that writing is my passion. I am proud of my undergrad career and all that I have learned academically and about myself through the process. I will walk PROUDLY down that aisle to accept my degree. And with my acceptance to the Voices of Our Nation Arts writing workshop in Berkeley, California (which I am to-the-stars-and-over-the-moon honored and excited about) I am ready to face the next phase of my path and to dedicate time to my passion.

For those who don't know, the Voices of Our Nation Arts (VONA) writers' workshop in Berkeley, CA is a workshop dedicating to nurturing the work and community of writers of color. It is the ONLY of it's kind in the entire nation and this will be my first acceptance and very first time attending. I have never been more excited or honored to be a part of something. 

BUT.....The reality is that there is an actual dollar sign cost to my first step towards paying my dues. That's where you come in.

Anything will help towards me reaching this dream (though actual dollars will be the most helpful, LOL). If you know me, and love me....help me get to my dream. Help me start this new chapter of my life. You want to celebrate my graduation with me? You want to bring in my 30th birthday with me or congratulate me on achieving my BA? Take the money you'd be spending on a drink/card/gift and instead please donate those few bucks towards my dream. I will forever be grateful to you and if you know me, that means you get mushy super love and hugs and gratitude. 

I love y'all, immensely. Please show me the love.

story:
What is Upside-down World?

Based on a series of children's illustrated books that encourage reading, Upside-down World is bringing to life a world for children (and for children-at-heart) where any creation can be turned upside-down to reveal other amazing characters and objects.

The image below is identical to the one above. It’s just turned upside-down. 


Why is Upside-down World so amazing?

Using our mathematically inspired technique that was initially developed for our books to encourage continuous reading (as the next sections discuss), we are able to create endless fun upside-down interactions, as illustrated by the riddle below: 

                 

                                                       * For the answer, have a look at our Gallery. 

 

Why do children love Upside-down World?

Children, due to their natural curiosity, have an inherent need to play with objects. Children love the creations of Upside-down World, e.g. its books, since they can flip them around to explore them. This encourages reading too, as illustrated below: 

* Children reading the book Upside-down Brothers while sitting opposite one another. 


Why do parents love Upside-down World?

Today, parents know that interactive play is a natural way for children to learn. The interactions of Upside-down World develop children’s imagination and creativity while encouraging reading too. They also show children the importance of looking at things from different angles and that "there are two sides to every coin", thus teaching them to accept another point-of-view.


What are endless books?

Each book in our series of illustrated children’s books is read from one side to its end, then turned upside-down and read to the other side of the book. As a result, the story continues endlessly, which young children love since they often want to hear the same story again and again. 


How do endless books encourage reading?

Since our books are endless, children will be reading them again and again, thereby improving their reading skills. Moreover, the interactive aspect of these upside-down books develops thinking at an early age, further strengthening reading. 

Do your books have positive messages for children?

Yes, they do, ranging from the importance of recycling to a family's never-ending love. For instance, our 1st book, Upside-down Brothers, emphasizes the endless love of two brothers for each other. 

                                  

One side of Upside-down Brothers tells the story of a brother named Messalot, who is creating a mess in the room to make his brother Tidyalot happier.

The other side tells the story of Tidyalot, who is tidying up the room to make his brother Messalot happier. Here is the same page above turned upside-down:


What does Upside-down World include?

In addition to its endless books that encourage reading, Upside-down World includes many other fun creations that can all be turned upside-down, as illustrated below:

 * See Gallery for more products, e.g. iPhone cases, mouse pads and greeting cards. 


Who created Upside-down World?

It was created by Noga Friedman and Moti Friedman for their five children and for all the other children of the world. Noga (PhD) is a writer and artist whose works have been shown in numerous exhibitions, including at Les Artistes Français in Paris. Moti (PhD) is also a writer and artist who has created works that can be found in many countries, including the USA, the UK and France. In addition, both are award-winning educators.

 

How can I help Upside-down World?

With your support, we’ll be able to complete the following 3 illustrated children’s books:

  • Upside-down Brothers – This is our 1st book, which is already fully written and illustrated. Recently, we came out with an ePub version (Fixed Layout Format for Apple’s iBooks) of this eBook. With your help we’ll create other ePub versions (e.g. for Google’s Android) as well as additional versions, including KF8 (for Amazon’s Kindle), NOOK Kids (Barnes & Noble) and PDF (e.g. for Scribd). 


  • Upside-down Riddles and Jokes – This is our 2nd book for which most of the riddles and jokes have been written and illustrated. With your aid we’ll complete the book and build several eBook formats, including ePub, KF8, NOOK Kids and PDF. Here is one example (and there are more in our Gallery):

  • Upside-down Recycling in Space – This is our 3rd book, which has been written and sketched out. It is about a couple, Greenalot and Greenbelle, who go on a space trip to several planets, giving objects to expert aliens to recycle them. Backed by you, we’ll be able to fully illustrate it and create several eBook formats, including ePub, KF8, NOOK Kids and PDF.                                

                                              


Here is how the funds to create the above 3 books will be allocated:

                      


Thank you so much for supporting us!

story:
Overview

My name is Brett Buchanan and I’m hoping to share my new novel, The Money Tyrants, with you and many other enthusiastic readers.

For a little background on me, I'm a web designer and ecommerce specialist by day, and a lifelong writer into the nether hours of the night.  I write out of pure passion.  

A sample of my work can be seen on ZeroHedge.com. This article, titled American Purgatory, is the intellectual property of mine and my good friend Greg Simmons (the real brains of the braintrust), but the prose is all me.

By contributing to this campaign you will help bring an important literary work to a mass audience.  An audience of which I intend to grow and share more work with in the future.  

The novel is near fully-written (127,796 words), with rewrites and edits remaining.  The finished product will be approximately 140,000 words.

The funds from this campaign will all go to marketing and advertising.  Even if I exceed my funding goal I'll plow all the proceeds back into promotion.  All other publishing expenses I'm handling myself.

So what is The Money Tyrants about?

The Money Tyrants is a suspense thriller about Jeff Thomas, a network security consultant who, while working a government contract for the US Treasury in the immediate aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis, discovers an unfathomable truth behind our global banking system. 

Jeff then sets out to bring down a small group of men who secretly planned an economic collapse in their quest to subjugate world governments to the dominion of their central banking empire. This secret organization, known as The Committee, dates back over two hundred years and whose family names delineate to the origins of modern European banking.

Mix in some well-researched intelligence agency foreplay, some realistic hacking, an enigmatic protaganist along with the convergence of vicious competing agendas and the recipe for modern suspense thriller is served.

My Goal

I’m seeking to raise $5,000 to help fund the marketing budget leading up to and upon the book’s release this fall.

Allocation of funds -

  • Press release campaign - 15% of funds
  • Social Media - 15% of funds
  • Amazon Ads - 70% of funds*

Perks

For Perks beginning at $150 we are donating 50% of those campaign contributions to GiveForward.org

The contribution to GiveForward.org will occur the 3rd week of July, 2013 (shortly after we receive funds from IndieGoGo.

GiveForward.org is a fundraising site for people who need help with catastrophic medical expenses - typically for terminal illnesses.  It's an awesome organization.  Check them out at - 

GiveForward.org

Your Impact On My Writing

A first time novelist can only expect to receive a pittance of an advance from major publishers - if you get published at all.

By self-publishing my first novel through Amazon and through my own marketing channels I stand a much greater chance of generating the kind of income that would warrant my dedicating more time to writing.

Your contribution will help me down this path.  I feel I have a voice and something important to say though my readers will be the final judge and jury.

At this point, let me say thank you in advance for your contribution, and/or for sharing my campaign with your friends.  

Have an awesome life.  And I mean that sincerely.

 

Why is this novel important?

History will look back on the events of September 2008 as the moment five transnational banks held a loaded gun to the head of every major government on earth.  To argue that these events were not a de facto coup d'état is to ignore all facts to the contrary.

In a highly entertaining manner this novel sheds light on the destruction a small group of men can inflict on the world by maintaining private control over the creation of money. It exposes the power to create money for what it is – the greatest power of all. 

Weaving a story around the events of September 2008, that to this day keep our illusory global financial markets and public well-being on razor's edge, The Money Tyrants is a novel everyone should read.

It goes to the core of why we are where we are - submissive to the abusive power of central bankers.

Storyline (Teaser)

Our story is revealed through the actions of Jeff Thomas, a network security consultant with Top Secret US Intelligence clearance. 

The stage is set when Thomas, working on a government contract with the US Department of Treasury, stumbles upon a data trail that, initially unknown to Thomas, could expose a concentrated group of men whose financial and political power exceeds all comprehension. 

This group, known only as The Committee and whose existence remains a myth within the Intelligence community, is in fact very real. 

After detecting what Thomas believes to be a security breach of the new network Treasury Department set up to manage the TARP program during the height of the financial crisis, Thomas traces the breach to a mainframe in London.  Later that day Thomas informs his counterpart at Treasury, who summarily dismisses the breach as a routine test.

At home that evening Jeff Thomas receives a phone call from a man named David Voight – an NSA agent gone rogue and one with ongoing access to the NSA’s global surveillance network, ECHELON.  During their brief call, Voight posits to Thomas that the breach he detected places him at the precipice of a historic revelation.  Motivated by his desire to know precisely what he had stumbled upon that day, Thomas agrees to meet Voight late that night at the Jefferson Memorial.

On that dark Washington DC night with the Jefferson Memorial looming in the backlight, Voight, a man with inexhaustible resources tells Thomas the security breach he’d detected leads to an unseen, unknown group of men who secretly control global central banking, financial markets, and political bodies leading as high as the White House.  Known as The Committee, Voight implores Thomas to join his cause and expose these men. 

“The control these men wield can only be had with the protection of governments and intelligence agencies who thwart any attempt to expose their agenda.” - David Voight iterates during the Jefferson Memorial meeting to recruit Jeff Thomas.

Thomas goes home to digest his meeting with Voight.  He has twenty-four hours to give Voight an answer.

The next morning, still undecided, Jeff goes to his office.  Upon entering he is accosted by two armed men who have already taken Jeff’s secretary hostage.  Within seconds a bullet pierces the office window from outside and one of the assailants lay dead.  In a blink the other assailant is eliminated from a silenced gunshot by a man who seemingly appears out of nowhere.

Unknown to Thomas, as he’d left his meeting with Voight at the Jefferson Memorial the night before, Voight had commanded his security team to shadow and protect Thomas. 

With two men lying dead on the floor the security team leader gives Thomas and his secretary a choice, flee with the team for protection or risk waiting for federal law enforcement, whose probably behind the attack as the only other person aware of the breach that Thomas detected was his counterpart at the US Treasury – an apparent mole for The Committee.

Thomas agrees.  He and his secretary leave with the team.  And for the next ninety-six hours Jeff Thomas and David Voight engage enemies from all sides in a battle to expose these men who control the world.

But nothing and no one are what they seem.

 

*Will potentially allocate some advertising dollars to Google Adwords.

story:
Short Summary


Hello and thank you for clicking on my campaign! My name is Anca and I'm a writer. Above is a picture of me reading some of my poems at the Poetry Cafe in London.

Late last year, I published my first book in electronic format. It's called "Hidden Animals", it contains poems and short stories and I like to describe it as a fantasy concept book. Mythology is my main inspiration and I have a fascination with symbols, which is why in this book I use images of fantastical creatures as metaphors for emotions hidden deeply inside the human heart - and that's the concept! Then, inspired by the tradition of Medieval Bestiaries (as well as the modern Bestiary that is J.L. Borges' "Book of Imaginary Beings"), I organised these stories and poems into three parts - Birds, Beasts and Spirits - to suggest a spiritual progression and create a sort of Bestiary of the human soul. (So, in case you're wondering about the weird perk names, they correspond to the three parts of the book!)

Here is the book blurb:

"In this collection of poems and short stories, fantastical creatures stand for all that is deeply hidden inside the human heart. Birds of all kinds live together mysteriously inside a country manor, a nobleman’s careless life is disturbed by an unexpected intruder, a monk travels a dying world in search of a god of chaos, and being the ruler of a fairy court is not all it’s made out to be. The Birds, symbolising hope, faith and sometimes fatality, the Beasts that, in their various forms, embody the allure of danger and of all that is primal, and the Spirits, which have their subtle ways of influencing all action, come together into one Hidden Animal, which is nothing but the part of human nature that always remains mysterious and unexplained."


What I Need


My goal is to publish my book in print and advertise it.

I devised the budget based on the estimates available on the websites of several self-publishing companies.

If the full goal is not reached, I will look for more affordable solutions for printing and advertising my book.

In other words, if the full goal is not reached, giving up is not an option for me!


Other Ways You Can Help


  • Check out the ebook versions of "Hidden Animals" on Amazon and Smashwords. Thanks to the Smashwords "You set the price" option, you can download the full book for free if you type "0.00" in the price selection box.
  • Visit my blog
  • ... and my Goodreads author profile
  • Like my Facebook author page
  • Follow me on Twitter

story:
My name is Jonathan Lynch and i am a 30 year old part - time self published award winning author. i am seeking funding for my next novel which, like my first has been rejected by agents and publishers. So once again i am looking to go at it alone and get the book out there myself. The novel itself is the first in a possible 3 book series (as of writing this i am halfway through the second book) about a zombie apocalypse that begins in Ireland and sweeps throughout the rest of the world.


I am looking for £5000 British pounds. This amount will cover everything from the books cover image, interior, formatting for Ebook and paperback and as well as a large promotional campaign throughout the US and the UK as I would be availing of a package offered by the UK author services company Authoright who have a proven track record of promoting authors. The funding will be making the book to the highest industry standards and will also offer the best possible exposure and availability for the book

    Any amount of funding will go towards my lifelong dream of being a full time author which is something i have dreamed about since i was a young teenager ever since i read my first Stephen King book all those years ago. The funding would also bring me that tiny step closer to being able to do what i love so much full time but also enable me to spend more time with my young son. As i mentioned earlier my first book The Gift was a Readers Favourite award winner but despite it being well received and reviewed  sales have still been low, which I put down to a serious lack of inexperience and promotion on my part which is where the professional help would come in.

      Although I have learned a lot from my first book i still feel that word of mouth and good professional promotion is still needed to help books sell, no matter how good the story may be. If I wasn't to make the target I would still work as hard as I can to get the best possible finished product out there and never give up.

        I understand that we are still living in tough times but even a little means a lot :D, and if you cant donate then the old word of mouth can help me just as much. Thank you


        Sincerely 
        Jonathan Lynch

story:
The Story

My name is Christopher Bernard, and I believe storytelling changes lives.  Iâ€™d like to inspire you with my newest project, entitled â€˜Rainâ€™ that will help end the literary drought brought on by the change in the publishing industry.

Set in a distant galaxy, the story is about a young farmer named Rain who becomes a warrior fighting for freedom against an ingenious nation seeking absolute sovereignty.  When the story begins, we learn that Rain struggles to control his temper and the haunting memories of losing his twin brother to the ruling nation.  When he discovers the arrival of a mysterious stranger named Kimmo, Rain believes heâ€™ll be able to find some answers.  However, Rain soon discovers Kimmo isnâ€™t the man he appeared to be when they are forced to escape to the nation of Guhdar. 

The Impact

Supporting this project not only gives you control on the future of the publishing industry, it also brings a new voice to young readers. 


The Goal

I want nothing more than to take readers on a fantastic emotional and visual journey through Rainâ€™s world.  The graphic novel will present the first part of the story told in four issues. The artwork, showcases the talents of Jason Pedersen, who will bring the first three chapters of the novel to life.  Jason Pedersen has been  helping other starving artists achieve their dreams.  He is an artist from Arizona who has agreed to help me bring my story to life, so I would like to return the favor and pay him what he is worth.  Jason is also a very talented tattoo artist! Visit Jasonâ€™s webpage by clicking here.


After the completion of the young adult novel, I wanted to continue adapting the story to make it more accessible to everyone, and if I hope to realize this dream, I'm going to need major support.  I am asking backers to help with the costs to illustrate the graphic novel, and purchase a high quality cover for the book. Here's a breakdown of the costs I face as an emerging author:

â€¢ $215 per page ($110 for pencils, $80 for colors, and $25 for lettering) x 50 pages = $10,750

â€¢ $1500 for high quality artwork for the paperback/hardcover book.

â€¢ $0 for the writer whoâ€™s payment will be knowing you love the story!  Remember to starve the artist, not the dream!

I hope to raise enough funds to complete the first stage of the 50 page graphic novel.  The money raised will go towards the actual total of $14,550.00 to produce all the art and hopefully there will be some left over for production costs.  Why so much? There are administration fees for publishing, and promotional items to be generated and paid for, printing, and distribution, and a certain amount of advertising costs, not to mention the fees taken by IndieGoGo, and credit card companies.

This campaign is all or nothing, so reaching the goal is paramount! As if supporting a young writerâ€™s dream isnâ€™t reward enough [in most cases, itâ€™s not], supporters can choose from a plethora of awesome rewards! * International Supporters, please add $10 for shipping and handling charges.

Other Ways You Can Help

This project has been a labor of love for the past two years, and now I feel it's ready to be shared with you.  In order for this project to be successful, I need your support to reach 100%!  Every dollar counts, and is greatly appreciated.  With gratitude, I ask that you pass the link to this page and our website to your friends and ask them to do the same.  Everyoneâ€™s got a few friends who can tell a few friends!  Let me know what you think about the artwork and the campaign, and to see more images, visit: thenationofrain.com

story:
Synopsis

Life is formed through circles and lines, some of them cross and some of them don't. When points meet, a collision happens, or a bond forms. -M.H.

In my writing and poetry, philosophy is a core theme. From ancient to modern contemporary times, many thinkers discuss elements of philosophy, which include morality, rationality, behaviour, politics and religion. Partly speaking to Jostein Gaarder’s Sophie’s World, Lubna's World pushes ideas about existence, living and continuity, to the edge! Lubna, at the age of twelve loses her home and witnesses her parent’s fatal end. Her choices become limited. She is fearless. She, her younger brother Jamal, Sakhr and Adnan are the only survivors.

intro

“She hears wind whisper, sees the sea// breaks sudden, she breathes deep.

Hollow…. Void…

Darkness…. Void…

Circles in between, the past unleashed, the future unseen, the mass (ماس), the masses (ماس), the future hints forth.” –Lubna’s World  

Filled with adventure, unpredictable turns and challenges, Lubna’s World raises more questions than answers about faith, hope, strength and courage, life and death.  

Your support for Lubna’s World and contribution will enable the production of the book, and encourage the culture of literature’s long rich gift of stories, poems, myths and mysteries. Lubna will be with you every step of the way, taking you along with her journey in perseverance and faith.  

A budget of $50,000.00 (Fifty Thousand US Dollars) has been estimated over the course of three years, divided into three stages. Beginning with the first: Developing Illustrations and Text, the project will continue until acquiring an ISBN number, taking the final file to print and start distribution. 

Timeline: 

Development Stage [Aug. 2014-Aug. 2015]; estimated budget $10,000.00

-Developing content and completing manuscript

-Producing sketches\illustrations

-Testing layout and design

-Networking: reaching Libraries, Book Stores, and distribution points

Implementation Stage [Sept. 2015-Sept. 2016]; estimated budget $20,000.00

-Editing and finalizing content 

-Constructing book layout and design

-Configuring cover design and structure

-ISBN application

-Networking: reaching Libraries, Book Stores, and distribution points

Print & Circulation Stage [Dec. 2015- ongoing]; estimated budget $20,000.00

-First and Second page proofs

-Finalizing last elements

-Printing and Distributing

Circulation* worldwide

Language** multilingual

All contributors will receive Special Thanks upon the publication of the book. We will keep you posted on every stage, sending you peeks and previews as we move along. Every contribution matters and we are thankful to all of you.*

*$15 contributors, our Believers, receive copy of original sketch from "Lubna's World," with signed copy of the book and personal Thank You!

*Driven $50 contributors receive original illustrations from "Lubna's World" with signed copy of the book and personal Thank You.

**$99 contributions (Noble), receive framed original illustration from "Lubna's World" with your signed copy of the book and personal Thank You.

***Peaceful $500 contributions receive original signed Poster, (19" x 24"), hand-engraved on preinked scratchboard paper, with your signed copy of the book and personal Thank You.

****Contributions of $1000 and more receive from the rare first printed copies of the Book Cover, signed and framed, with personal Thank You and your signed copy of the book!  

ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE THANK YOU PAGE AT THE END OF THE BOOK. 

By contributing to my project, you are contributing to literature and education. Your input emphasizes the importance of the book culture, accentuating the art of craft, hand-writing and storytelling.

If you're unable to support financially, your kind support is highly needed and appreciated. Pass the word around and share the link.  

We extend our gratitude to all contributors and supporters.

Once again, thank you!  

 -Mnar

Manar A. Harb is a poet and writer. She was the Content Editor of This Week in Palestine, (Oct. 2011 – March 2013), an independent print magazine published and printed in Palestine, where she contributed entries and published a number of articles. Her poetry has been published in various online literature outlets. She is now compiling a collection of poems. Lubna's World is her first published work in the form of a book.
story_txt:
Synopsis
Life is formed through
circles and lines, some of them cross and some of
them don't. When points meet, a collision happens, or a bond forms. -M.H.
In my writing
and poetry, philosophy is a core theme. From
ancient to modern contemporary times, many thinkers discuss elements of
philosophy, which include morality, rationality, behaviour, politics and
religion. Partly speaking to Jostein Gaarder’s Sophie’s World, Lubna's World
pushes ideas about existence, living and continuity, to the edge! Lubna, at the
age of twelve loses her home and witnesses her parent’s fatal end. Her choices
become limited. She is fearless. She, her younger brother Jamal, Sakhr and Adnan are
the only survivors. 
intro
“She
hears wind whisper, sees the sea// breaks sudden, she breathes deep.
Hollow….
Void…
Darkness….
Void…
Circles
in between, the past unleashed, the future unseen, the mass (ماس), the masses (ماس),
the future hints forth.” –Lubna’s World  
Filled
with adventure, unpredictable turns and challenges, Lubna’s World raises more questions than answers about faith, hope,
strength and courage, life and death.  
Your
support for Lubna’s World and
contribution will enable the production of the book, and encourage the culture
of literature’s long rich gift of stories, poems, myths and mysteries. Lubna
will be with you every step of the way, taking you along with her journey in
perseverance and faith.  
A
budget of $50,000.00 (Fifty Thousand US Dollars) has been estimated over the course
of three years, divided into three stages. Beginning with the first: Developing
Illustrations and Text, the project will continue until acquiring an ISBN number, taking
the final file to print and start distribution.

story:
My best friend Kelly and I have been planning on backpacking around Europe for 3 months in the summer of 2015 after we graduate college for years now- and it's less than a year away now and I could really use some help funding it. We're both working full time and have been saving for a while now, but this is a lot of money to save up working minimum wage jobs.

This is our last hurrah before joining The Real World, and we're trying to get in as much as we can before we're anchored down by jobs, leases, paying back student loans, and everything that comes with being a college graduate.  

This trip is going to be an incredible and life changing experience, something that we will remember for the rest of our lives, and something that will help us grow as people and change our lives!  We're both planning on trying to write journals and blog posts about our experiences, and even make video blogs to share with the world! 

If you are capable of sparing just a few dollars or want to help me out, I would appreciate it so much, I can't even express my gratitude. Any amount would help- even $5 could buy food for a day while we're over there, and $20 could pay for a place to sleep at night.

Any donations would be going towards lodging and food while we're in Europe and my plane ticket and rail pass.

All together, this trip is going to cost about $6000 or $7000 and any assistance would be amazing.

I know there are obviously a million other causes out there that are so much more important than this, and it seems trivial to be asking for money to travel the world, I recognize that and I agree wholeheartedly- this is immensely unimportant in the scheme of things, But if you have any money to spare and feel like this is worth a dollar or two, it would really help my dreams come true, and I don't think there's any harm in putting this out there, even if no one donates. 

Thank you so much for even reading!

story:
Donar es muy simple. No hace falta registrarse en IndieGogo. 

Sigue unos simples pasos. Completa tu correo electrónico, escribe el monto que quieras donar, escoge una recompensa y coloca los datos de tu tarjeta de crédito. Y listo! Es totalmente seguro y confiable.


Qué es Yanuq?

Yanuq.com es el Portal No 1 de cocina peruana en el mundo. Fue creado hace 15 años y cuenta con más de 4.000 recetas! Y lo mejor, es completamente gratuito!

Yanuq fue creado en Lima por 3 amigas que quisieron compartir sus recetas -y las de sus familias- con el resto del mundo. Las recetas son todas probadas y comprobadas hasta el último detalle así que son casi infalibles! Yanuq comenzó con 350 recetas y no ha parado de crecer. Muchas recetas son aportes de los propios miembros de la comunidad.

Alrededor de Yanuq (que significa cocinero en quechua) se reúnen cientos de miles de amantes y curiosos de la cocina peruana, para celebrar su pasión por ella y compartir sus conocimientos.  

Ahora, a pedido de los miembros de su comunidad, Yanuq quiere renovar su plataforma tecnológica para facilitar a sus usuarios la consulta de sus recetas favoritas en tablets y celulares.

Lo que necesitamos 

Yanuq necesita una ayuda de todos sus amigos y seguidores para lograr una renovación de imagen y de tecnología que permita a todos seguir disfrutando de estas infalibles recetas en todos los soportes. Principalmente en tablets y celulares.

Para lograr este proyecto Yanuq necesita USD 10.000, que se usarán para contratar 100 horas de programación, servicios de diseño y creación de imágenes.

Para compensar a todos los que nos ayuden, ofrecemos en recompensa e-books de Yanuq, así como menciones en la sección de Benefactores del portal.

Los fondos que se consigan se destinarán específicamente para este proyecto. En caso no se consiga la meta, los fondos serán complementados con recursos propios.

La campaña

Durante 45 días haremos una campaña para solicitar la ayuda de todos los usuarios del portal. Es nuestra primera experiencia de crowd funding y estamos muy entusiasmados. También es una oportunidad para medir la confianza y compromiso de los más de 500.000 usuarios que conforman la comunidad de Yanuq y utilizan nuestros servicios mes a mes.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Otras formas de ayudar al lanzamiento de la nueva versión para celular y tablet de Yanuq es difundir esta campaña entre tus familiares y amigos. Además, también puedes hacernos llegar tus recetas y fotos para publicarlas en el portal.

story:
An update from our current kitchen to a commercial kitchen will allow our church to advertise in the community for various parish events which we are currently not allowed to do under Michigan law.

Our hope is to be able to invite the local community to visit us not only for a meal for their earthly nourishment but also a meal for their eternal salvation.

We will then be able to bring more of the local population into our church and have the opportunity to sponsor meal nights for the homeless in the area and also to grow our parish by evangelization.

The additional profits from any of these endeavors would also supplement our ongoing charitable activities with the elderly and shelters for abused women and children.

We are a small parish with a HUGE HEART...God Bless

story:
Who We Are

Room (established in 1975 as Room of One's Own) is Canada’s oldest feminist literary journal, and is published by the West Coast Feminist Literary Magazine Society, a collective based out of Vancouver. 

Room showcases fiction, poetry, reviews, artwork, interviews, and profiles by emerging and established writers and artists who identify as women or genderqueer. Works that originally appeared in Room have been anthologized the Journey Prize Anthology, Best Canadian Poetry, Best Canadian Essays, and Best Canadian Stories, and have been nominated for a National Magazine Award. 
 

About Making Room: Forty Years of Room Magazine

This 416-page book will explore the evolution of Canadian literature over the past forty years, its intersection with the various and ever-changing definitions of feminism within Canada, and the political movements driven by these definitions.

Over the past year the editorial board at Room has read through thirty-nine years of issues and selected approximately seventy-five pieces of writing which showcase the history of the magazine and the evolution of Canadian feminism (and which we absolutely love!). Hundreds of hours of passion have been dedicated to this project, and we're so excited to share the result with you next spring.

Publication Date: March 2017 (for subscribers, at the same time as issue 40.1 "Food" edited by Kayi Wong and Rose Morris)

Cover art by Emily Cooper. This is a rough mock-up of the cover and it will be modified before publication.
 

Contributors

Contributors include Governor General's Award-winners, Pat Lowther Award-winners, authors selected for Canada Reads, and members of the Order of Canada, among other honours and awards. Additional names will be added as we confirm contributors. 

Carmen Aguirre, Najwa Ali, Gail Anderson-Dargatz, Elizabeth Bachinsky, Marie Annharte Baker, Juliane Okot Bitek, Kate Braid, Nicole Brossard, Cyndia Cole, Ivan Coyote, Lucas Crawford, Su Croll, Lynn Crosbie, Lorna Crozier, Danielle Daniel, Amber Dawn, Junie Désil, Sandy Frances Duncan, Dorothy Elias, Christine Estima, Tanya Evanson, barbara findlay, Cynthia Flood, Chantal Gibson, Leona Gom, Jane Eaton Hamilton, Wasela Hiyate, Nancy Holmes, Anna Humphrey, Mindy Hung, Aislinn Hunter, Carole Itter, Amy Jones, Helen Kuk, Matea Kulić, Naoko Kumagai, Fiona Tinwei Lam, Doretta Lau, Evelyn Lau, Jen Sookfong Lee, Tracey Lindberg, Dorothy Livesay, Annabel Lyon, Vera Manuel, Daphne Marlatt, Robin Blackburn McBride, Carmelita McGrath, Cara-Lyn Morgan, Erín Moure, Susan Musgrave, Alessandra Naccarato, Kellee Ngan, Monica Pacheco, M. NourbeSe Philip, Helen Potrebenko, Sina Queyras, Eden Robinson, Constance Rooke, Rebecca Rosenblum, Devyani Saltzman, Sigal Samuel, Nilofar Shidmehr, Carol Shields, Serena Shipp, Carolyn Smart, Susan Stenson, Anna Swanson, Souvankham Thammavongsa, Audrey Thomas, Ayelet Tsabari, Chimwemwe Undi, Betsy Warland, jia qing wilson-yang

Want a sample? A few pieces from the Anthology are available to read for free on our website:

"Best Practices for Time Travel" by Doretta Lau
"Maheen's Collage" by Nilofar Shidmehr
"trans womanhood, in colour" by Jia Qing Wilson-Yang
 

Media & Interviews

BC BookLook
League of Canadian Poets
 

What We Need & What You Get

Room's anthology is published with the support of Canadian Heritage through the Canada Periodical Fund, however, we're still approximately $15,000 short of our budget, and we need your support to fully realize this project. Funding from this campaign will go towards:

  • Printing (~ 2/3rds of funding)
  • Mailing
  • Marketing expenses (including bringing the Anthology to events across Canada)

Any additional funds raised beyond what we need to print, mail, and market the Anthology will go to increasing the honorariums we are paying contributors, and to fund launch events for the Anthology in Vancouver, Toronto, and hopefully a handful of other cities across the country.

We have terrific perks available, including autographed book bundles, manuscript consultations, discounts on boxes of back issues, Room-exclusive enamel pins, Virginia Woolf tote bags, travel mugs, and notebooks, and the opportunity to pre-order the Anthology for only $20 (a small discount off the cover price).

The tote bags, travel mugs, and notebooks are produced by Fairware—sustainable, ethical and eco-friendly promotional products and custom merchandise for socially responsible companies. 

(Pictured above: Bookmarks)

All donors who give $75 or more (regardless of the perk they select) will have their name published in the Anthology on a special "Thank You" page. All donors (regardless of the amount) will be thanked on our website and on Twitter.

Shipping is free in Canada!
 

Risks & Challenges

We have already invested thousands of dollars and hundreds of (mostly volunteer) hours into this project: digitizing our entire back issue catalogue, reading every issue to short-list content (each issue was read by at least two people), rereading the short-listed content to make the final selections, contacting writers, proofreading, and graphic design. 

In other words, the biggest risk of this project is that we're already committed to it! We're going to publish this book regardless of success of this campaign, but without the extra support we're going to have a very difficult time paying for printing and will likely end up printing far fewer copies that we will struggle to successfully market and promote. Room has been an essential voice in Canada's literary scene since 1975, and we want to celebrate the achievements and talents of our incredible writers and editorial teams—we hope you will help us make this happen!

—The Growing Room Collective

Thank you to Kristen Boychuk for donating her time and talents for our IndieGoGo video, to Jeannie Kamins for donating her artwork (which originally appeared on the cover of Room Issue 7.4), and to Canadian Heritage and the Canada Periodical Fund for their support of this project.

Thank you to all of the authors and publishers who generously donated signed copies of their books to create these perks, to the Vancouver Writers Festival for donating tickets to their events, and to the authors who donated their time for the workshops and manuscript consultations.

If you are interested in supporting the campaign and wish to donate your perk (e.g. to a women's shelter), please contact Room magazine after you make your donation. 

Love and thanks to everyone who has supported us over the years.

story:
What is Mynah?

Mynah is an annual print magazine about Singapore, Singaporeans and Singaporeanness. We want to critically and creatively examine the facets of this country that either don’t get enough time in the spotlight or haven’t been discussed in broad ways. We do this with word counts that run into the thousands, allowing our stories depth and context.

What's in Mynah #1?

  • A geographical account of the Outer Islands of Singapore
  • A photo essay created by migrant construction workers
  • A personal narrative of 90s LAN gaming culture
  • A collection of analogue photos of Rochor Centre
  • An exploration of how Traditional Chinese medicine melds with modern medicine today
  • An expose of the internet famous local fashion brand no one talks about
  • Four recipes for local dishes created by Singaporeans abroad
  • The story of how one man left Singapore to grow marijuana in San Francisco
  • Three visual mixtapes by designers who curated and illustrated playlists of local music
  • A totally serious analysis of PM Lee's masterful grasp of social media

In Mynah #1 you’ll find work by emerging writers we’re excited about – Sharanya Pillai, Marie Ee, Daniel Soo and more – and by established contributors we’re honoured to work with – Yu-Mei Balasingamchow, Joshua Ip and Robert Zhao, just to name a few!

Who is behind Mynah? 

The Mynah team consists of three editors (Ruby, Karen and Isabelle), a creative director (Brian), and our moneyman (Bill). We are not working on Mynah for profit. We are also collectively indebted to Google Docs and Telegram.

Why Mynah? 

Mynah began because we saw a gap in Singapore’s publishing landscape where  in-depth Singapore stories should’ve been – the kind that look into aspects of the country that fall by the wayside. We wanted to carve out a space where stories could plumb the depths of understanding Singapore and thrive in exploring the timbres and textures of our country the mainstream media does not cover. We also wanted Mynah to be a space for the architects of these stories – writers, illustrators, photographers and more – to be in conversation with each other.

We’re also print magazine enthusiasts, as quaint as that might sound. Having all of these stories in a physical magazine we could hold and keep was an obvious choice for us. In this issue of Mynah, you can expect 20 well-researched and diverse stories packed into a 132-page magazine. With the 24/7 news cycle going at lightning speed, we wanted to create a slow reading experience, a magazine you can sit with and keep coming back to again and again.

Where does the money go?

The money you pledge firstly goes toward printing the magazine itself and delivering it into your hands. As lovers of the print medium, we prioritise quality. Paper, ink, binding – you name it, we’re aiming for the best. All magazines ordered through Indiegogo are significantly discounted from their usual retail price, so we encourage you to get a copy sooner rather than later! We're committed to getting all pre-ordered copies printed and delivered to you, regardless of whether we meet our funding goal. 

The moolah also goes to our contributors, whom we have been paying out of our own pockets thus far. When we started Mynah, we knew that paying our contributors was going to be one of the most important aspects of the magazine. We value original, creative work, and paying creators is the first step to making sure that their work continues to exist. Because we’re a new, so far self-funded magazine, we haven’t been able to wholly accomplish this: many of our contributors graciously declined payment for their work. Any additional funds from this crowdfunding campaign will go towards honorariums for these creatives who believed in us enough to work for free.

What perks do you offer?

Besides copies of the magazine at a discounted pre-order price, we've got some exciting stuff available that we can't wait to share with you. For one, we've got postcard-sized prints of our very own Mynah Visual Mixtapes. We asked three incredible local artists – TELL YOUR CHILDREN, Kenn Lam and Aeropalmics – to curate five-song playlists to the theme of “Firsts” and illustrate them, with thrilling outcomes. You’ll get to choose your favourite design!

We've also got postcard-sized prints of analogue photos of the beloved Rochor Centre, made by Amanda Sarah Chin. Choose your favourite.

And we've got three volumes of poetry whose authors appear in the pages of Mynah #1: Sonnets From the Singlish by Joshua Ip, Love is an Empty Barstool by Pooja Nansi and A History of Clocks by Jennifer Anne Champion. Limited quantities available!

As we go to print in September, we hope to ship all magazines and perks out in November. Shipping will take a week for Singapore addresses and up to 10 weeks for locations elsewhere in the world.

How else can I help?

If what we've said strikes a chord with you and you'd like to help out beyond just purchasing copies of the magazine, here are some ways you can do so: 

  • If you're a stockist, distributor or bookstore owner who's interested in stocking Mynah, reach out to us at info@mynahmag.com 
  • If you're an educator, programme director or would like to make mass purchases for your school, company or organisation, let us know at info@mynahmag.com 
  • If you like what you see and would like to talk about potentially sponsoring future issues of Mynah, again, info@mynahmag.com is the place to go!
  • Know someone who'd love our magazine? Spread the word by sharing our crowdfunding campaign on social media and telling all your friends!
story_txt:
What is Mynah?

Mynah is an annual print magazine about Singapore, Singaporeans and Singaporeanness. We want to critically and creatively examine the facets of this country that either don’t get enough time in the spotlight or haven’t been discussed in broad ways. We do this with word counts that run into the thousands, allowing our stories depth and context.


What's in Mynah #1?



A geographical account of the Outer Islands of Singapore
A photo essay created by migrant construction workers

A personal narrative of 90s LAN gaming culture

A collection of analogue photos of Rochor Centre
An exploration of how Traditional Chinese medicine melds with modern medicine today
An expose of the internet famous local fashion brand no one talks about
Four recipes for local dishes created by Singaporeans abroad
The story of how one man left Singapore to grow marijuana in San Francisco

Three visual mixtapes by designers who curated and illustrated playlists of local music

A totally serious analysis of PM Lee's masterful grasp of social media

In Mynah #1 you’ll find work by emerging writers we’re excited about – Sharanya Pillai, Marie Ee, Daniel Soo and more – and by established contributors we’re honoured to work with – Yu-Mei Balasingamchow, Joshua Ip and Robert Zhao, just to name a few!


Who is behind Mynah? 

The Mynah team consists of three editors (Ruby, Karen and Isabelle), a creative director (Brian), and our moneyman (Bill). We are not working on Mynah for profit. We are also collectively indebted to Google Docs and Telegram.
   
Why Mynah? 

Mynah began because we saw a gap in Singapore’s publishing landscape where  in-depth Singapore stories should’ve been – the kind that look into aspects of the country that fall by the wayside. We wanted to carve out a space where stories could plumb the depths of understanding Singapore and thrive in exploring the timbres and textures of our country the mainstream media does not cover. We also wanted Mynah to be a space for the architects of these stories – writers, illustrators, photographers and more – to be in conversation with each other.
We’re also print magazine enthusiasts, as quaint as that might sound. Having all of these stories in a physical magazine we could hold and keep was an obvious choice for us. In this issue of Mynah, you can expect 20 well-researched and diverse stories packed into a 132-page magazine. With the 24/7 news cycle going at lightning speed, we wanted to create a slow reading experience, a magazine you can sit with and keep coming back to again and again.

The money you pledge firstly goes toward printing the magazine itself and delivering it into your hands. As lovers of the print medium, we prioritise quality. When we started Mynah, we knew that paying our contributors was going to be one of the most important aspects of the magazine. We value original, creative work, and paying creators is the first step to making sure that their work continues to exist. Because we’re a new, so far self-funded magazine, we haven’t been able to wholly accomplish this: many of our contributors graciously declined payment for their work. Any additional funds from this crowdfunding campaign will go towards honorariums for these creatives who believed in us enough to work for free.



What perks do you offer?

Besides copies of the magazine at a discounted pre-order price, we've got some exciting stuff available that we can't wait to share with you. For one, we've got postcard-sized prints of our very own Mynah Visual Mixtapes. We asked three incredible local artists – TELL YOUR CHILDREN, Kenn Lam and Aeropalmics – to curate five-song playlists to the theme of “Firsts” and illustrate them, with thrilling outcomes. You’ll get to choose your favourite design!



We've also got postcard-sized prints of analogue photos of the beloved Rochor Centre, made by Amanda Sarah Chin. Choose your favourite.




And we've got three volumes of poetry whose authors appear in the pages of Mynah #1: Sonnets From the Singlish by Joshua Ip, Love is an Empty Barstool by Pooja Nansi and A History of Clocks by Jennifer Anne Champion. Limited quantities available!


As we go to print in September, we hope to ship all magazines and perks out in November. Shipping will take a week for Singapore addresses and up to 10 weeks for locations elsewhere in the world.
How else can I help?
If what we've said strikes a chord with you and you'd like to help out beyond just purchasing copies of the magazine, here are some ways you can do so: 

If you're a stockist, distributor or bookstore owner who's interested in stocking Mynah, reach out to us at info@mynahmag.com 

If you're an educator, programme director or would like to make mass purchases for your school, company or organisation, let us know at info@mynahmag.com 
If you like what you see and would like to talk about potentially sponsoring future issues of Mynah, again, info@mynahmag.com is the place to go!
Know someone who'd love our magazine? Spread the word by sharing our crowdfunding campaign on social media and telling all your friends!

story:
Help Publish One Cool Dude

Stockton poet David Waldon never set out to be a writer,  but once he found his voice, the muse inspired thousands of poems on life, love, politics and the ticking clock in a dying man's ear. He is the master of the 55-word poem:


One More Night

Ghosts of lost summers

Always touching, yet never touched

Specters on a guitar note

Kisses sweetened by root beer popsicles

Wildflowers beguiling through rolling hills

Ketchup at the corners of your mouth

Floating carefree down the Mokelumne

Top down in the moonlight

A star, our navigator

I wish I may ... I wish I might

Have ...


E’er Guitar

They were gods to us back in the day.

Mythic figures in black-light armor brought to life by stereo.

Alvin Lee, frettin’ frenetically ‘bout goin’ home.

Hendrix wailin’ along the Watchtower.

Clapton lettin’ it hang after midnight.

Page dialin’ up a communications breakdown.

Oh, to be at Winterland again, lighter in hand, one last encore.


Critics say ...

"Dave Waldon is one of the most talented writers I've encountered in forty years of college teaching. Having him in my class was like team-teaching with an inspired Full Professor of Life."-- Author and English Professor Phil Hutcheon, Nobody Roots for Goliath and Desperation Passes

Record columnist Mike Fitzgerald, who started a local 55-word poetry contest, said this: (Click on live links to read more!)

The Feverish 55er

By Michael Fitzgerald | Published: February 7, 2011 

There are two categories of 55-Word Writing Contest entrant: Dave Waldon and everybody else.

Waldon, last year’s contest winner, submitted around 60 (!) entries this year, far more than anyone else. And he was holding back. “This group was edited down from close to 100 I’d written during the year,” he writes.

And he adds, perhaps unnecessarily, “I obviously enjoy doing this.”

Waldon’s devotion is amazing — and so is the quality of his work. You read his lampoon of Krispy Kreme in the main article. I selected that one because most everybody else’s entries this year  were serious. A bit of humor was needed. But any one of two dozen other Waldon 55ers would have serve as well. Or better. My personal favorite below is “BangThang,” a meditation on humankind’s squandering of creation’s grandeur, written with skilled wordplay.

Here's the complete blog with a sampling of Waldon's wit, wisecracks and woe.
http://blogs.esanjoaquin.com/stockton-metro-columnist/2011/02/07/the-feverish-55er/

What Is Needed to Publish David Waldon

Stockton's new small publisher, Tuleburg Press, is set to publish Waldon's 55-word poems in a book called 55 and Counting. The book will be a 5-inch x 5-inch 2-inch THICK book with about 200 poems -- representing less than a third of his 55-word output.

Tuleburg's mission is to publish regional voices that illuminate the Stockton/San Joaquin Valley experience. The budget for 500 books is about $5000, which includes formatting, cover art, printing and distribution.

Tuleburg Press became a 501 (c) (3) in Dec. 2013. We first published Delta College professor Phil Hutcheon. His novel Desperation Passes is now in its second printing. We cut our teeth on this novel about the exploitation of black athletes by the state university system, so we know what it takes to get Waldon into print.

The Pressure Is On

David Waldon has been ill for a very long time and is getting progressively worse. After 30 years of tinnitus, 3 failed surgeries and years of guessing, doctors have finally diagnosed his condition as Complex Regional Pain Syndrome.

WE need to get this book into print now. He experiences excruciating pain in his head from simple movement and environmental sound. He and his wife Valerie are reduced to communicating in whispers.

What You Get

  • YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO TULEBURG PRESS IS TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. YOU WILL RECEIVE A LETTER TO THAT EFFECT.
  • CONTRIBUTORS OF $100 OR MORE WILL RECEIVE A FREE AUTOGRAPHED COPY OF THE FINISHED BOOK.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Share this campaign and make some noise about David Waldon.

story:
What is First Date?

First Date is a story about two furs looking for love and overcoming their pasts. It will be adult in nature containing violence as well as more intimate scenes.  

Arsenio is a shy bisexual fennec fox, burned by every female date he decides its time to try his luck at dating males. But not all is well with the vulpine, a secret from his teenage days could jeopardize his newest relationship before it can even bud.

Seff is a rough and tumble biker wolf. Under that tough looking exterior is sweet and caring furson. His former ties to a violent biker gang could scare off a new love.

Mainly I am looking to fund a short novella over the next ten months. This includes several pictures and a full color cover. To accomplish this I will need about $300 a month to supplement my current job as a live in care taker as well as pay for art, editing, and pre-copies of the finished book.

Other stories by me can be found here.

https://inkbunny.net/FoxxyFluff

http://www.furaffinity.net/user/foxgold/
