story:
Story of My Book

The Journey is the Destination: The Case for Holistic, Restorative Education is my storied take on how education must transform in order to meet the needs of young people in today’s globalized and precarious world. Rather than being mired in test scores and returns-on-investment, education has to recognize the forces which threaten civilization itself: global inequality and climate change. In response to these macro-trends, education must center the whole student and prepare them to be problem-solvers, change-makers, and responsible citizens of the modern world. Unfortunately, there is no more time to waste.

I drew inspiration to write this book from my journey through public, private, charter, and magnet schools. After attending a magnet high school in Las Vegas, I went to Georgetown University, and this transition put me face-to-face with the scope of economic inequality in the modern United States. My high school was surrounded by convenience stores, liquor stores, and apartment complexes, whereas my college was a billion-dollar school in the nation’s capital with towering stone and brick buildings.

I had reached the promised land my parents had wished for me; with a Georgetown degree, I would probably never struggle to find work. And yet, despite earning a high GPA, I struggled with loneliness, anxiety, and depression throughout college. In other words, I was a Gilded Student; golden grades and a golden smile enabled me to hide my struggle from my peers and professors.

Meanwhile, I studied the ails of society in the classroom—from climate change to global racism—thereby adding an existential twinge to my daily stresses. Eventually, I came to realize that my struggles with mental health, my façade resume, and the problems facing the world were all engaged in a tragic and dissonant dance. Although my reckoning with the education system may seem melodramatic, it is common to many struggling with mental health issues. Each of us is introduced to the path to personal excellence, wealth, and social status—all while knowing that global forces threaten our future.

Fortunately, I believe that changing our core educational framework can provide leverage for change in the rest of society. By prioritizing the flourishing of students in community, education can evolve into a training ground for democracy, a hub for innovative solutions, and a bastion for equality.

In these pages, we’ll explore how we can cultivate a new form of education which channels the individual talents of young people into careers and lifestyles that will lead to both personal fulfillment and global problem-solving. Specifically, we’ll see:
  • How project-based learning might help revive our democracy.
  • How social media is making Gen Z into the “Doomer Generation.”
  • How The Pivotal Network is attempting to reduce economic inequality in colleges.
If you’ve ever questioned the point of education, or believe in its power as a transformative force for good, you will definitely like this book. Regardless of your beliefs, my biggest hope is that you’ll feel a newfound appreciation for education, learning, and growth.

What I Need & What You'll Get

New Degree Press will be publishing my book. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the publishing costs. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I'll work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the pages of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
As soon as I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I’ll publish a paperback and ebook. At 150 copies, I’ll publish a hardcover. At 200, I’ll publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

If you pre-order I’ll give you a huge thanks and these added perks!
  1. Personally signed copy of my book when published.
  2. Your name in the Acknowledgments section.
  3. Early access to the Intro and other excerpts and a chance to give me your early feedback.
  4. Opportunity to help me select my cover and title.
  5. Invitation to join my Author Community, where you’ll see the behind-the-scenes of the publishing process.
  6. And more! :)

About the Author

Michael Pasimio is a Las Vegas native and attends Georgetown University's world-renowned Walsh School of Foreign Service. He works at The Hub for Equity and Innovation in Higher Education and serves as Co-Chair of the Student Experience Committee. Throughout his time at Georgetown, he’s worked closely to organize and promote equity and diversity initiatives. He’s also partnered with various organizations around education and youth development, including Gentlemen By Choice and the International Youth Foundation.

His passion for education comes from his personal journey through private, public, magnet, and charter schools in Las Vegas, which is consistently at the bottom of national rankings. In 2018, Michael enrolled in Georgetown, and in his first year, the school made national news during the 2019 college admissions bribery scandal, but he learned firsthand how the scandal only scratched the surface of the faults within the education system. He took it upon himself to find solutions to these problems by providing college counseling to students from his high school at no cost and promoting educational equity among the student body. Michael also joined The Pivotal Network at Georgetown to help make college more affordable and accessible to first-generation and lower-income students.

In his free time, Michael reads, watches anime, walks his dogs, and hosts education brainstorming sessions with his friends. He always finds ways to attend events and meet new people, and he loves it when other people share their story.

You can connect with Michael at mvp36@georgetown.edu and follow him on Instagram @magic.mikey21.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk of publishing a book is mailing a physical copy to my supporters. Fortunately, I’ve included the cost of mailing and shipping into my pre-order goals, so we don’t have to worry.

This risk itself depends a lot on the publisher, but New Degree Press is extremely reliable in making sure that all the perks of pre-order are delivered ASAP. I’ll keep all my supporters in the loop on my book publishing date, and you’ll know when you can expect the physical book to be in your hands.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. You can use #EduJourney and tag me (@magic.mikey21) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress).

  1. You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  2. Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message.
  3. Send me words of support and encouragement.
  4. Connect with people you know who work or are interested in education.
  5. Ask to review some of my content!

Thank you so much for all the support you’ve given me already.

Sincerely,

Michael
story_txt:
Story of My Book
The Journey is the Destination: The Case for Holistic, Restorative Education is my storied take on how education must transform in order to meet the needs of young people in today’s globalized and precarious world. Rather than being mired in test scores and returns-on-investment, education has to recognize the forces which threaten civilization itself: global inequality and climate change. In response to these macro-trends, education must center the whole student and prepare them to be problem-solvers, change-makers, and responsible citizens of the modern world. Unfortunately, there is no more time to waste.I drew inspiration to write this book from my journey through public, private, charter, and magnet schools. After attending a magnet high school in Las Vegas, I went to Georgetown University, and this transition put me face-to-face with the scope of economic inequality in the modern United States. My high school was surrounded by convenience stores, liquor stores, and apartment complexes, whereas my college was a billion-dollar school in the nation’s capital with towering stone and brick buildings.I had reached the promised land my parents had wished for me; with a Georgetown degree, I would probably never struggle to find work. And yet, despite earning a high GPA, I struggled with loneliness, anxiety, and depression throughout college. In other words, I was a Gilded Student; golden grades and a golden smile enabled me to hide my struggle from my peers and professors.Meanwhile, I studied the ails of society in the classroom—from climate change to global racism—thereby adding an existential twinge to my daily stresses. Eventually, I came to realize that my struggles with mental health, my façade resume, and the problems facing the world were all engaged in a tragic and dissonant dance. Although my reckoning with the education system may seem melodramatic, it is common to many struggling with mental health issues. Each of us is introduced to the path to personal excellence, wealth, and social status—all while knowing that global forces threaten our future.Fortunately, I believe that changing our core educational framework can provide leverage for change in the rest of society. By prioritizing the flourishing of students in community, education can evolve into a training ground for democracy, a hub for innovative solutions, and a bastion for equality.In these pages, we’ll explore how we can cultivate a new form of education which channels the individual talents of young people into careers and lifestyles that will lead to both personal fulfillment and global problem-solving. Specifically, we’ll see:
How project-based learning might help revive our democracy.
How social media is making Gen Z into the “Doomer Generation.”
How The Pivotal Network is attempting to reduce economic inequality in colleges.
If you’ve ever questioned the point of education, or believe in its power as a transformative force for good, you will definitely like this book. Regardless of your beliefs, my biggest hope is that you’ll feel a newfound appreciation for education, learning, and growth.What I Need & What You'll GetNew Degree Press will be publishing my book. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the publishing costs. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I'll work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the pages of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
As soon as I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I’ll publish a paperback and ebook. At 150 copies, I’ll publish a hardcover. At 200, I’ll publish a hardcover and an audiobook.If you pre-order I’ll give you a huge thanks and these added perks!
Personally signed copy of my book when published.
Your name in the Acknowledgments section.
Early access to the Intro and other excerpts and a chance to give me your early feedback.
Opportunity to help me select my cover and title.
Invitation to join my Author Community, where you’ll see the behind-the-scenes of the publishing process.
And more! :)

About the Author
Michael Pasimio is a Las Vegas native and attends Georgetown University's world-renowned Walsh School of Foreign Service. He works at The Hub for Equity and Innovation in Higher Education and serves as Co-Chair of the Student Experience Committee. Throughout his time at Georgetown, he’s worked closely to organize and promote equity and diversity initiatives. He’s also partnered with various organizations around education and youth development, including Gentlemen By Choice and the International Youth Foundation.His passion for education comes from his personal journey through private, public, magnet, and charter schools in Las Vegas, which is consistently at the bottom of national rankings. In 2018, Michael enrolled in Georgetown, and in his first year, the school made national news during the 2019 college admissions bribery scandal, but he learned firsthand how the scandal only scratched the surface of the faults within the education system. He took it upon himself to find solutions to these problems by providing college counseling to students from his high school at no cost and promoting educational equity among the student body. Michael also joined The Pivotal Network at Georgetown to help make college more affordable and accessible to first-generation and lower-income students.In his free time, Michael reads, watches anime, walks his dogs, and hosts education brainstorming sessions with his friends. He always finds ways to attend events and meet new people, and he loves it when other people share their story.You can connect with Michael at mvp36@georgetown.edu and follow him on Instagram @magic.mikey21.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest risk of publishing a book is mailing a physical copy to my supporters. Fortunately, I’ve included the cost of mailing and shipping into my pre-order goals, so we don’t have to worry.This risk itself depends a lot on the publisher, but New Degree Press is extremely reliable in making sure that all the perks of pre-order are delivered ASAP. I’ll keep all my supporters in the loop on my book publishing date, and you’ll know when you can expect the physical book to be in your hands.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. You can use #EduJourney and tag me (@magic.mikey21) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress).

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message.
Send me words of support and encouragement.
Connect with people you know who work or are interested in education.
Ask to review some of my content!

Thank you so much for all the support you’ve given me already.Sincerely,Michael

story:
Campaign Overview


I am Denise Bossarte, an author preparing to publish my first fiction novel: Glamorous: A Grace Bishop Novel. This novel will be the first in my Grace Bishop series of paranormal thriller novels, and it will be self-published.

I have been writing stories and poems since early elementary school. Three years ago, I had a dream about a private investigator with supernatural powers. I thought and dreamed about that PI's world for quite a while before I was left with no choice but to write it down!  And after all the hard work, I am ready to self-publish my novel and share the protagonist Grace and her friends with the world.

Because I am self-publishing, there are considerable upfront costs associated with this process. I have had a book cover designer create a one of a kind cover for paperback and ebook versions. I am now hiring a professional editor to ensure that my manuscript is ship shape for publishing. There are also associated costs for websites, software, and marketing.

Note: This campaign is limited to those with US mailing addresses. Sorry, but the shipping costs are just too prohibitive outside the US.


The Novel

A serial killer preys on homeless girls. Only her power can stop him.

Grace is a survivor.
Haunted by the memories of the car accident that killed her brother and brought her police career to an end, she's determined to bring wrongdoers to justice as a PI.
Little do her clients know that the accident gave her more than nightmares.
It gave her paranormal abilities she can't explain.

When she agrees to help a friend solve a mystery of missing homeless girls, Grace is drawn into a secret world of Paranorms and The Family that rules them. It's a supernatural safe haven for potential friends and deadly evil. This discovery alters her reality forever.

With the killer still at large, Grace must use her powers to put an end to his murder spree. If she succeeds in finding him, then she could be the one who ends up in the cross-hairs.

Glamorous is the first book in a series of urban fantasy and paranormal thrillers. If you enjoy intriguing mystery, new and distinctive paranormal worlds, and a riveting plot, then you'll love this new series starter.


Costs For Me and Perks For You

Cost breakdown:

  • Professional editor: $2,600
  • Book Cover Design: $300
  • Technology (website, social media, etc.): $200

Total: $3,100

Indigogo charges a fee of 5% on the total funds raised. So, for $4,900, that's a total of $245 in fees. There is also a 3% fee on credit card transactions, adding another $147 in fees.

The rest of the funding will go toward creating/ordering/shipping the perks!


Your Perks:

Warning: Book spoilers!! Two of the perks I am offering are a crystal pendant and a crystal geode. Both of these play key roles in the story: Grace is able to store her "energy" in the crystals that Danny and other ghosts can then use to physically manifest in the world. Damn cool, right?!

$5 - A personal, direct from the heart, thank you from me!

$15 - A Glamorous bookmark

$20 - A copy of the Glamorous eBook in the format of your choice (.epub, .mobi, .pdf)

$30 - A crystal pendant similar to the one Grace wears on the book cover. Sorry, the crystals will not be loaded with Grace's energy, so don't try materializing any ghosts with them! (Even Grace's powers are no match for the postal system process.)

(not actual size - pendant will be similar in blue color)


Bundles:

$40 - The Reader Bundle: a signed paperback copy of Glamorous, plus a copy of the eBook in the format of your choice, and a bookmark

$50 - The Crystal Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus a crystal pendant like the one Grace wears (see above)

$75 - The Clairvoyant Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus a beautiful phone skin using one of my own personal fine art photographs. Please indicate your skin preference (by number) and phone type AND version during checkout (e.g. Phone 6 Plus), or by contacting me. Phones covered: iPhones and Galaxy.

(not actual size - choose 1 of the above)

$100 - The Crystal Power Bundle: everything included in the in the Crystal Bundle, plus a small crystal geode.

(not actual size - Geode will be similar to this)

$150 - The Paranorm Bundle: everything included in the Crystal Power Bundle, plus a beautiful phone skin using one of my own personal fine art photographs. Please indicate your phone skin preference (by number), phone type AND version during checkout (e.g. Phone 6 Plus), or by contacting me. Phones covered: iPhones and Galaxy.


Shipping is free to the United States!


Why Self-Publish?

The world of publishing is changing.

Authors no longer have to wait for the traditional publishing companies to select books for readers. Independent authors, like myself, can get entertaining and exiting books into the hands of readers directly!

Self-publishing gives the author complete control of all aspects of the book creation process: the story, the characters, the cover, and the time and place of publication.
I get to tell my story the way I want it told. You get to hear it straight from me!

And let's be honest, that 15% royalty the trad pubs offer has nothing on the higher royalties being an independent author gets me.


Risks & Challenges

Writing and self-publishing a novel is challenging, but I'm in the home stretch! I've finished what many people consider the hardest part: actually writing the novel. Now it's time to get the help of professional editors to make the book shine!

I have successfully written and self-published an illustrated poetry book, so I am not new to this self-publishing thing. I have complete confidence I have the skills to get the Glamorous into the hands of readers.

Regardless of whether I meet my funding goal, Glamorous will be self-published. However, the process will be more difficult without your help, as I will have to find alternative ways of covering the costs.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your family, friends, coworkers, fellow avid readers...anyone you think might be interested in being a Patron and helping to get this paranormal thriller novel published! You can share quickly by using the Indiegogo Share Tools!

story:
Story of My Book

I Am Racist?!: And other things I knew but was too ashamed to talk about is my memoir and research project exploring the collision course of the middle-class, progressive, motherhood midlife crisis and anti-racist practice.

My name is Holly Harper and I am the author of I Am Racist?! Millennial and Xennial progressive women are often shamed into a position of believing that our own experience of individual trauma is invalid because “We have it so good that we have no right to complain.” This story is how I pushed back on that narrative, suffered openly, and transformed into a stronger, happier, and more empathetic human, embracing the matriarchal values that are the only path forward for a truly equitable, anti-racist society.

As a first-generation college graduate and a newly minted East Coast elite, I would frequently look in my rear-view mirror and see all of my segregated white peers in their small white Oregon town and think: “I got out. I made it. I’m living the perfect, progressive version of Stepford Wives.” Smug AF.

And then my ivory tower came crumbling down. I went from being a smug newlywed to a new mother coping with postpartum anxiety, to an entrepreneur, to a feminist, to a divorced, single, traumatized, and midlife-crisis-having adulteress. Those experiences revealed that I had everything backward. I had fucked it all up.

Having the world tell you “you’re lucky to have what you have” when you feel like a shameful failure of a woman, mother, wife, and person is a painful, humiliating, and isolating experience. I know I have more than so many others. I know I am privileged and have advantages from my white skin, middle-class upbringing, and stable income through marriage. But I am still broken.

If the pain is real, then the reasons behind that pain must matter, right? Pain matters.

I started writing. I was typing 10,000 words a weekend. I felt myself moving through my trauma.

And then George Floyd was murdered.

You need to read this book if you look at your wedding photos and don’t see a Black person (thank you Robin DiAngelo for that suggestion). You need to read this book if you feel overwhelmed by life and feel shame because you are privileged and whining about it. You need to read this book if you are absolutely certain you are not racist, or that racist, or maybe just were “sheltered” in a mostly white community, or get annoyed by #blacklivesmatter when Indigenous lives matter, too. You need to read this book if you’re a college-educated, white, cis, mom who wants the world to be better and America to live up to its ideals.

I Am Racist?! speaks to white women, white moms, and progressive white people who want to grapple with living their best lives, self-care, healing from trauma, and finding your highest joy while also figuring out how to do all of that self-focused work without feeling overwhelming guilt and helplessness about the larger problems in our society.

Ultimately, I hope that I Am Racist?! inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Am I building a life of joy for myself, my partner, my children?
  • How do I overcome shame and childhood trauma to find my purpose?
  • What if I royally fuck up and cheat on my husband or become a binge drinker or otherwise do some really big damage? Will I lose everything? Am I worthless? Why do I feel trapped and alone?
  • What is the path forward for me if I truly am ready to start self-care and realign my values?
  • How can I have both maximum personal joy AND be committed to social justice and anti racist practice? I mean can we indulge in all-inclusive vacations and kitchen renovations and still become allies? (Hint: Yes.)

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing this complex dynamic will change us all for the better.

I Am Racist?! And other things I knew but was too ashamed to talk about is written in Four Parts....

  • Part 1 is about the very real and very painful experience of the female midlife crisis, based on expert research and interviews, we talk about how therapy, self-care, coaching, and lifestyle influencers are selling us bandage solutions to real, persistent sociological problems for middle-class, college educated Millennial and Xennial moms and womxn.

  • Part 2 centers on how individual context - who you were raised to be as a woman, mom, professional, and “wife” confounds our progress further, creating a trap where we feel guilty and indulgent when seeking ways to heal our souls and bodies.

  • Part 3 is how we can meld together the high ideals of social justice - feminism, racial equality, gender equality, all the equalities - into one, more powerful perspective that gives us the grace be individually whole, brave, and happy while also fighting for what’s fundamentally the most important issue in our society today - social and racial justice. In short, we can walk and chew gum at the same time.

  • Part 4 is where I am today, at the dawn of ‘woke’ and not an expert, but a practitioner in a lifelong journey with my compass pointed more firmly in the right direction.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press of Potomac, Maryland. In order to fund the editing, printing, marketing and publication, I am offering book pre-orders:

  • The editing team I will work with to revise and publish the manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The cover design - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The interior layout (physical copy and ebook formats)
  • Copyediting
  • The launch & promotion efforts, like the cool video they made me!

My goal is to pre-sell 200 copies in order to publish in hardcover (vanity project), softcover, and eBook. Audiobook is on the docket, too. I have lofty goals.

To my beloved community of pre-orders, you’ll be getting the Cadillac treatment. You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (I know, don’t get overly excited about this part). Additionally, you may get:

  • Your name the Acknowledgements Section.
  • Early access to the Introduction of some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book.
  • Your very own rose gold pen to underline all of the important sections you’ll be referencing later at Book Club.
  • A personalized pack of Kleenex to wipe up all of your fragile, white woman tears.
  • A set of versatile drink coaster/postcards to protect your furniture while drinking heavily after reading this shit (and then for mailing to all of your other potentially racist friends.).

About Holly Harper

I am a strategic marketing consultant and copywriter at the helm of her my own consulting practice, Blue Bike Communications. I work with organizations tired of feeling buried under all the marketing stuff they have to do and want to do, and they’re ready to tighten up their marketing machine so they can do what they do best: make a difference in the world. As the ad hoc marketing director, we brand, strategize, plan and implement phased change for measurable results.

My writing was framed by a desire to take my personal perspectives, mostly in blog form, and translate them into a “larger picture” that addresses complex intersectional issues that are rarely addressed (racism, feminism, capitalism) in my own peer group (college educated, white, cis, married women who grew up in largely racially segregated worlds).

I’ve always been curious - devouring books, asking questions, solving puzzles, learning about new places, and helping others - resulting in the development of an eclectic collection of interests, skills, and relationships. When I started writing, it felt a little know-it-all-y to be giving advice, so I just turned the lens back on myself.

What I went through, learned about, have experienced, and then have put into action is much more accessible than me telling anyone what to do with their own lives. It’s just my story. A love story to me, meant for my 24-year-old self, written two decades too late for its intended audience, but still valid for my daughter and my friends.

For more information you can connect with me at holly@choosebluebike.com, @choosebluebike on Instagram and Facebook, and @hollybluebike on Twitter.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #matriarchyascendant and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page or with this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/i-am-racist-...
  • Please share my presale page with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it, not on social media, but something more personal, like a text message or DM.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

What is the path forward for me if I truly am ready to start self-care and realign my values?
How can I have both maximum personal joy AND be committed to social justice and anti racist practice? I mean can we indulge in all-inclusive vacations and kitchen renovations and still become allies? (Hint: Yes.)
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing this complex dynamic will change us all for the better.I Am Racist?! And other things I knew but was too ashamed to talk about is written in Four Parts....
Part 1 is about the very real and very painful experience of the female midlife crisis, based on expert research and interviews, we talk about how therapy, self-care, coaching, and lifestyle influencers are selling us bandage solutions to real, persistent sociological problems for middle-class, college educated Millennial and Xennial moms and womxn.
Part 2 centers on how individual context - who you were raised to be as a woman, mom, professional, and “wife” confounds our progress further, creating a trap where we feel guilty and indulgent when seeking ways to heal our souls and bodies.
Part 3 is how we can meld together the high ideals of social justice - feminism, racial equality, gender equality, all the equalities - into one, more powerful perspective that gives us the grace be individually whole, brave, and happy while also fighting for what’s fundamentally the most important issue in our society today - social and racial justice. In short, we can walk and chew gum at the same time.
Part 4 is where I am today, at the dawn of ‘woke’ and not an expert, but a practitioner in a lifelong journey with my compass pointed more firmly in the right direction.
What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press of Potomac, Maryland. In order to fund the editing, printing, marketing and publication, I am offering book pre-orders:
The editing team I will work with to revise and publish the manuscript in December, 2020.
The cover design - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The interior layout (physical copy and ebook formats)
Copyediting
The launch & promotion efforts, like the cool video they made me!
My goal is to pre-sell 200 copies in order to publish in hardcover (vanity project), softcover, and eBook. Audiobook is on the docket, too. I have lofty goals.To my beloved community of pre-orders, you’ll be getting the Cadillac treatment. You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (I know, don’t get overly excited about this part). Additionally, you may get:
Your name the Acknowledgements Section.
Early access to the Introduction of some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book.
Your very own rose gold pen to underline all of the important sections you’ll be referencing later at Book Club.
A personalized pack of Kleenex to wipe up all of your fragile, white woman tears.
A set of versatile drink coaster/postcards to protect your furniture while drinking heavily after reading this shit (and then for mailing to all of your other potentially racist friends.).
About Holly HarperI am a strategic marketing consultant and copywriter at the helm of her my own consulting practice, Blue Bike Communications. I work with organizations tired of feeling buried under all the marketing stuff they have to do and want to do, and they’re ready to tighten up their marketing machine so they can do what they do best: make a difference in the world. As the ad hoc marketing director, we brand, strategize, plan and implement phased change for measurable results.My writing was framed by a desire to take my personal perspectives, mostly in blog form, and translate them into a “larger picture” that addresses complex intersectional issues that are rarely addressed (racism, feminism, capitalism) in my own peer group (college educated, white, cis, married women who grew up in largely racially segregated worlds).I’ve always been curious - devouring books, asking questions, solving puzzles, learning about new places, and helping others - resulting in the development of an eclectic collection of interests, skills, and relationships. When I started writing, it felt a little know-it-all-y to be giving advice, so I just turned the lens back on myself.What I went through, learned about, have experienced, and then have put into action is much more accessible than me telling anyone what to do with their own lives. It’s just my story. A love story to me, meant for my 24-year-old self, written two decades too late for its intended audience, but still valid for my daughter and my friends.For more information you can connect with me at holly@choosebluebike.com, @choosebluebike on Instagram and Facebook, and @hollybluebike on Twitter.Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #matriarchyascendant and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page or with this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/i-am-racist-...

Please share my presale page with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it, not on social media, but something more personal, like a text message or DM.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

story:
Como nació la idea.

Dragón Glotón esta creado por mi y por mi hijo de 4 años. El ha sido el que me ha guiado en cada prueba que le daba para jugar. Un adulto no ve igual que ve un niño y para lo que nosotros puede ser original ellos ni lo ven.

Desde que tuve mi primer ordenador un Amstrad CPC 6128 he creado mis propios programas y juegos siempre limitados por mi edad y por el código de lenguaje que usaba  BASIC, ahora con las nuevas tecnologías y subcontratando a profesionales he llegado a crear a Dragón Glotón.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Por el momento están creados 4 niveles y un solo poder (la invisibilidad), tengo muchas ideas para desarrollar y hacer de Dragón Glotón un juego de referencia. 


El juego fue diseñado y pensando para niños con la ayuda de mi experto probador de 4 años...

Sus reacciones y comentarios me han hecho rectificar y añadir lo que él demandaba.


¿Pero de que trata el juego?

Dragón Glotón tiene unos gráficos muy coloridos y divertidos, una música muy estimulante y uno efectos sorprendentes  que mantendrán la atención  incluso del niño más inquieto. Dragón Glotón deberá comer todas las frutas  y golosinas para poder pasar a la siguiente isla.  Cuanto más come el dragón, más gracioso y grande se hace, mi hijo ya dice: "ME LO VOY A COMER TODO COMO EL DRAGÓN GLOTÓN!!"

Aunque nuestros exploradores pueden desbloquear el siguiente nivel comiendo  todas las golosinas, si encuentran todos los cofres secretos de la isla, se desbloqueará una poción de invisibilidad que despista a los enemigos para ayudarlos en el siguiente nivel.


¿Porque necesito tu ayuda y para que usaré los beneficios?

Necesito vuestro apoyo porque no puedo seguir haciendo el juego más y más largo con el mismo nivel de detalle y esmero como hasta ahora he realizado las 4 islas. Dado que es un juego para niños necesito implementar al menos 4 islas más para lanzar el videojuego en el mercado.


    Riesgos y desafíos

    He pasado malos momentos y comentarios típicos y fáciles como el ¿Para que haces un juego asi? ¿Pero si tu no te dedicas a esto? No gastes el tiempo, estas empleando mucho tiempo para nada..

    Pero el resultado lo tenéis a la vista, no soy profesional del sector, no soy informático, tan solo tengo un sueño y voy a conseguirlo gracias A TI. 

    Ya he recorrido los 40 primeros km de esta maratón, estoy a punto de llegar a la meta y necesito de tu aliento y colaboración. Creo haber puesto diferentes formas de recompensa, pero no es dinero todo lo que necesito, tambien puedes ayudarme a:

    • Difundir el juego en facebook, puedes hacerte FAN en https://www.facebook.com/dragongloton   y  decirles a tus amigos si te gustó.
    • Apoyarme en twitter, siguiendonos en @sweetoothdragon (su nombre en inglés)
    • Corregir fallos, enviarme quejas o comentarios. También es importante escuchar las malas opiniones. Solo así se llegar a conseguir el exito!.
    • Compartir en tu blog, en tu escuela, tu centro de trabajo, tus amigos, tu negocio. El bis a bis siempre ha sido la mejor publicidad. Revisa todo el material de fotografía y video y opina.

    • O con cualquier cosa que se te ocurra, entre mucha gente se consiguen grandes cosas.

Difundir el juego en facebook, puedes hacerte FAN en https://www.facebook.com/dragongloton   y  decirles a tus amigos si te gustó.
Apoyarme en twitter, siguiendonos en @sweetoothdragon (su nombre en inglés)
Corregir fallos, enviarme quejas o comentarios. También es importante escuchar las malas opiniones. Solo así se llegar a conseguir el exito!.
Compartir en tu blog, en tu escuela, tu centro de trabajo, tus amigos, tu negocio. El bis a bis siempre ha sido la mejor publicidad. Revisa todo el material de fotografía y video y opina.
O con cualquier cosa que se te ocurra, entre mucha gente se consiguen grandes cosas.

story:
What do YOU think is a reasonable price for a 64 page full-color hardcover adventure?

Rafael Chandler and Lamentations of the Flame Princess are teaming up to bring you No Salvation for Witches, a supernatural historical horror adventure for traditional tabletop role-playing games. It is an A5-size 64 page book (plus endpapers), in full color.

And you decide how much you want to pay for it.

We have an advance review! Read it here!

Things You Really Need to Know:

  • This campaign ends on August 26th. All backers will receive a link to download the PDF version of the completed book on August 27th. The book will go to press on September 1st. If all goes well at the printer the book will ship in early/mid-October.
  • We're going for a high-quality book here. Stitched binding, proper offset printing by a printer that's been in business since 1890. Every backer meeting the final campaign average contribution will get a version of the book with a bookmark ribbon sewn in.
  • Your payment here will not include shipping charges - you pay those later. Once the book is printed you will need to 'order' the book through the LotFP webstore. You will receive a 100% discount coupon for the base price of the book so you pay only the shipping charges. For Economy Class shipping to anywhere in the world, we estimate that the cost will be right around 5€, but we cannot guarantee that postage costs will not rise (they tend to not give a lot of warning), nor do we know for sure the exact shipping weight of the book before it's printed.
  • One book per backer. Multiple contributions from a single backer will not gain that backer multiple copies of the book.
  • Rafael Chandler conceived of all the concepts in the book, did all the writing, and was the creative director. LotFP has paid for all the artwork and graphic design and other production bits (except printing) and is taking care of promotion, order fulfillment, warehousing, and all that fun stuff. Any profits will be split 50/50 between Chandler and LotFP. That said, the minimum contribution is 1€.
  • No Salvation for Witches is a bit of a horrorshow. It is NSFW, after all. In the US it would be probably be considered Rated R. In Europe, it would probably get an 18+ rating.
  • Check out a sample chapter from the book!
  • If we hit the 10000€ mark, every backer meeting the final campaign average will get a bonus card with an additional encounter, including a new monster. (And another card if we hit 20000€!)

What's this "Pay What You Want" all about?

For the past couple years, publishers and musicians and creative types have been offering digital versions of books and albums and all sorts of things on a "Pay What You Want" basis, letting the customer set the price based on their means and generosity and interest in the project at hand.

In 2013, LotFP began trying out the model for physical books at convention appearances. Sales figures skyrocketed, usually earning less money per item sold but selling many more items in the process, and earning larger total profits as a result.

So LotFP is bringing the Pay What You Want model for physical product to the internet and crowdfunding. We are risking one of our major releases of 2014 for the sake of an experiment in trust.

Because the Pay What You Want model is one based entirely on trust.

And we trust you.

About No Salvation for Witches

England, 1620.

To strike a blow against the Patriarchy, six women perform a dangerous rite in an abandoned priory. Through their art, they commune with Terpsichore, Greek muse and patroness of dancers.

Starving demons slither across the moors; monstrous nuns shriek in the infirmary; and within the Attic, a great unraveling awaits.

The fate of the world rests in the hands of the player characters. Will they bring about an egalitarian utopia? Will they skulk away in the night, pockets bulging with treasure? Will they bring about the destruction of all things?

Will they find the Tract of Teratology, a randomly-generated creature-summoning ritual with 3.6 trillion combinations?

After this adventure, nothing will be the same.

The adventure is intended to be used with the Lamentations of the Flame Princess Weird Fantasy Role-Playing game (you can download a free, no-art, PDF of the full rules here), but is readily compatible with many other traditional role-playing games.

About the Team Behind No Salvation for Witches

  • Rafael Chandler is a veteran American game designer who has published RPGs such as Pandemonio and ViewScream on his own. He has also released two traditional RPG supplements, Teratic Tome and Bad Myrmidon, as 'Pay What You Want' PDFs that you can download cost-free to evaluate his style. You can read more about his projects here.
  • Lamentations of the Flame Princess is a traditional RPG publisher based out of Helsinki, Finland. You can read all about us here.
  • Jason Rainville, who did the cover art and a lot of the interior art on the project, is a Canadian artist who has worked for Wizards of the Coast, Paizo Publishing, Rite Publishing, and more. Learn more about him at his homepage here.
  • Ian MacLean, interior artist and cartographer on the project, is another Canadian artist who has worked for a number of tabletop gaming companies as well as giants like Sony and Google. Read about him here.
  • Sarah Richardson is our layout and graphic designer, based out of the US. You can see some of her previous design work here.
  • Otava Book Printing Ltd. is the Finland-based company we will use to print the finished books. In business since 1890, they print millions of books annually and have taken good care of LotFP's printing needs since 2011. They do amazing work. Read more about them here.

FAQ

What if 5000 people all just pay the minimum 1€ to reach the campaign goal? Isn't the campaign screwed?

The campaign goal of 5000€ is how much LotFP was prepared to spend out of pocket to print the book anyway and then sell in the traditional manner. Granted, that would have paid for only 2000 copies, but books get cheaper to print as more of them are printed. The fact is, we can cover the difference if the campaign is beset by a horde of cheap bastards. But you're not a horde of cheap bastards, so there's no problem.

So what is the real price of the book? How much will copies not sold through this crowdfunding campaign be sold for?

Who knows? Should we use the usual formula based on expenses to come up with the final price? Do something radical like decide that the average price gained through this crowdfunding campaign becomes the wholesale price of the book (and therefore the retail price is twice that amount)? One thing's for sure - it's a cheat on the Pay What You Want model to suggest a price. You decide what such a book is worth to you.

3.6 trillion combinations? Seriously?

Seriously! 3,600,698,572,800 to be exact, if our arithmetic is right.

Can LotFP really handle producing a quality hardcover book and process a potentially large number of orders?

Take a look at these pics from a delivery of 4000 books a few years ago:

We have produced a number of additional hardcover books since then. We're solid. But if you don't believe us, before the campaign started I asked in a public posting for people to give their opinions of LotFP's hardcovers without telling them why their opinions were being solicited. Their answers are here.

story:
Short Summary

Voice In The Jungle | Inspiring 'a new way' for Karamoja

My Name is Grace Nakajje, a professional journalist from Uganda.

With my experience working in Journalism across African cultures, I am combining my passions to to speak out for thousands of girls in Africa, who are silently facing the horror of the knife of circumcision, and early marriage without consent.
I am publishing in a book titled “Voice in the Jungle”.
  1. This book is a unique exploration of the complex cultural beliefs of the Karamojong people in the perspective of the girl child; how girls are seen as a symbol of wealth; forced into early marriages without consent, and the silent horror of Female Genital Mutilation.
  2. It presents a snap of efforts across Communities, powerful change agents being inspired to press through great obstacles, cultural barriers, and societal pressures to bring change,
  3. It introduces the “Macedonian call” a clear window into the precious opportunity for spiritual ministry and the redeeming gospel of Christ into the unreached Karamoja.

What I Need & What You Get

I need funds to support the publication, so I have started this fundraising campaign.

  1. My goal is $2200. This allows me to fund the entire book project and obtain 500 advanced copies of Voice in the Jungle.
  2. Any support you are able to offer would be greatly appreciated! You will receive an e-copy before anyone else! 
  3. For a gift of $100 or more, I will autograph the book and mail it to you as soon as it is printed. Plus I will include a personalized gift card.

The Impact

  • By helping me fund Voice in the Jungle, you are investing in the appeal to end Early Marriages and Female Genital Mutilation in Karamoja and beyond. You are giving hope to girls.
  • 100% of the funds go for two purposes: 1. Fund the entire book project. 2. Once the project is funded, HALF the sales from the books go to fund House of Hope trauma home in Moroto, and spiritual ministry- ILI/HM in Karamoja region, and the rest goes to Support Grace Works Initiative

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share;

And that's all there is to it.

story:
WATCH THE VIDEO!!! The picturesque, the fascination, the mystery of Italy

«The very air of Italy is embued with the spirit of ancient mythology» (Anna Brownell Jameson, 1826). The gods of the classical world still dwell under the shadows of the Italian woods and beneath the rocky slopes of solitary peaks. Weird legends, as creepy as a gothic tale, still live on in remote areas of the country.

When I first discovered the story about the Sibyl - a pagan divinity and priestess - I got the shivers, and decided at once to write a novel on the subject. Three years ago the legend of the Sibyl became a book: the original novel - written in Italian - is entitled "Il Mistero della Sibilla Appenninica" (The Mystery of the Italian Sibyl).

The book narrates the quest for the divine dweller of the cave carried out by the novel's main character: a "gothic" investigation through old books and fragments of truth retrieved on the slopes of the Mount Sibyl; an enquiry which will take the hue of a sinister journey into a mystery dating back to the Roman age.

And, in a final encounter with the legendary Queen, the Sibyl will prove as dreadful as a terrifying dream.

Fiction is only a part of it. This story has really occurred. A mountain called "Mount Sibyl" actually exists in Central Italy. On top, the wrecks of a cave indicate the very place to where people used to come for centuries to worship the divine Sibyl, in search of her subterranean palace, full of wonderful treasures, and in longing for her unholy love.

Yet the Sibyl was an evil being. Price for her love was eternal damnation, and many visitors never found their way out of the magical cave, as recorded in old books dating to the fifteenth century. Her call would resound through the centuries to attract travellers to her concealed palace and satisfy her hunger for souls.

The belief in this legend was so strong that since five centuries ago the place has achieved remarkable renown in France, Germany and other countries as well; in 1930s, the Fascists themselves made attempts at breaking into the cave on the mountain's top by using explosives, in search of the eerie Queen.

This was an awe-inspiring story that needed to be told, by adding a little bit of fiction as well.

"SIBYL" was written in Italian and distributed in Italy. Now, my design is to translate the novel into English to achieve worlwide distribution.


Translating SIBYL into English

"SIBYL" is a fascinating novel taking the reader into the mystery and picturesque of an ancient Italian legend which dates back to the Roman world. The novel can be easily enjoyed by non-Italian readers who love Italy and Italian traditions, charme and picturesque sights.


The setting of the novel is Norcia (hometown of St. Benedict, not far from Rome) and its beautiful, breath-taking surroundings: the Sibillini mountain ridge, which is named after the legend of the Sibyl.


In a first phase, translation in English will be edited by myself to ensure accurate rendering of the literary fiction quality of the Italian text. Next phase will involve the submission of the translated text to a native English professional translator, who will be carrying out the post-editing work.

The whole translation process will last eight to ten months ("SIBYL" is a 200-page book). Total cost will add up to Euro 8.000 considering the time devoted to the translation as well as the subsequent post-editing phase.

That's the money I wish to raise with your help!


Read translated "SIBYL" as your perk!

Once completed, the English edition of "SIBYL" will be made available as a perk to all contributors. Just leave me your email address and I will send you the English edited version in PDF format.

If you are interested in reading each chapter of the novel as soon as it has undergone the first translation phase, you can ask me to send you each chapter one after another. In this scheme, I will be glad to receive from you hints and suggestions to improve my translation.

Contributors who wish to read "SIBYL" in the existing Italian version can ask for a PDF copy of the book: this is a perk too, and it is available right now.

The Impact

According to Italian readers, "SIBYL" is a fine and enjoyable piece of literary fiction, to be made available to English readers as well.

In addition to that, the "picturesque" character of "SIBYL" may be of interest to foreign readers who love Italian art and heritage, and Italy's picturesque settings and sights.

Finally, the book is a poweful tool for increasing tourism in Norcia and the Sibillini range area: throughout the centuries, the places have been part of the "Grand Tour" journey for travellers in search of the Sibyl, and today this tradition may undergo a significat revamp basing on "SIBYL".



Risks & Challenges

The challenge, with the associated risks, is to achieve a high-quality translation in English. This will also be achieved by means of the post-editing phase carried out by a native English translator: she will check the overall quality of the translated English, from the point of view a mother tongue professional.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please spread the world to all readers you know who may be interested in literary and gothic fiction staging a picturesque Italian legend.

    Thanks for your support! Hope you may enjoy the book if you like literary fiction and gothic literature!

story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my campaign page. My name is Virginia Davis, and I am a Head Start Teacher, a poet, creative writer, advocate for literacy, and an aspiring novelist. Since I was a teenage girl, I have been strongly captivated by creative writing. I have absolutely fallen in love with composing poetry, short stories, long stories, prose etc…For me, writing is a mental vacation, a pain reliever, and everything that l need to survive.

I have always had a strong desire to one day make a positive impact on the lives of others through my own creative literature. A few months ago, the plot of a children’s novel dropped on my heart, almost out of nowhere. Before I had even finished writing the story, I felt assured that it was going to positively affect the lives of many young boys and girls who may be suffering from low self-esteem, self-doubt, or hopelessness.   

Unfortunately, in today’s society, we have cultivated a stern belief of what is beautiful and what is not. We have adopted an unfair reasoning of what and who is acceptable, and who and what is not. Regrettably, there are a multitude of young women, men, boys, and girls who are affected by the narrow-mindedness of our beliefs, and view themselves as inadequate or inferior. Growing up, I too, had these painful thoughts and beliefs about myself, and was often hurt by the words and actions of others toward me.

About the Book:

This compelling children’s story is about a young girl who is excited to start her first day at a new school. However, once she enters her new classroom, she finds herself constantly being teased by her classmates because of her darker skin.  Her peers will not play with or even sit by her; they simply call her mean names and proceed to bully her.  The young girl quickly develops low self-esteem and wishes that she were lighter, so that she could have friends and wouldn't be made fun of.  The young girl grows to resent herself and her dark skin, and begins to hate going to school. Every day, someone reminds her that she is not pretty or worthy to be friends with because she is dark-skinned.

However, with the help of some very important people in her life,  at a young age, she  embraces her dark skin and realizes that her black is just as beautiful as anyone else’s.

Why I wrote the book:

 I wrote this story based off of my own real-life experience of dealing with low self-esteem as a young girl and as an adult. As a child, I was teased for being dark-skinned, and eventually I began to dislike myself and my skin color as well.  However, I overcame my low self-esteem and grew to love everything about myself, including the color of my skin. It is my belief that this book will teach another young child how to overcome the same obstacles that I eventually overcame.

 I strongly believe that this story will greatly impact many of our troubled youth who feel that there is no one who cares for them and who can relate to their pain. I deeply yearn to reach out to that hurt child who feels rejected by their peers, family members, associates, and society as a whole; I feel compelled to touch the heart of the pained young person who thinks that they are inadequate and does not believe in himself. By reading this book, many of our youth will acquire a stronger and higher value of themselves, and they will gain a confidence that will be invaluable to them throughout the course of their lifetimes.  It is my very strong belief that this is more than a children’s book on the horizon; it is a touching story and movement that will evoke positive change in the lives of many.

What you can do:Contribute and/or help us share the news of the campaign!

With the help of a few caring individuals, we can change the lives of many children and young adults. We can offer a book of hope to an individual who may bask in hopelessness, and empower someone who feels powerless. With that said, we are striving to raise a grand total of $1,200 that will go toward:

-Illustration

-Graphic Design

-Printing

-eBook formatting

- Cost of utilizing Indiegogo

 
Please, see the awesome perks to the right in order to choose your contribution. After you have contributed or even if you cannot, please spread the word of the campaign by sharing the link to this campaign via email, twitter, FB, etc… At the top, you can utilize the Indiegogo share tool, and copy and paste the link.

Thank you so much for your time, and feel free to leave a comment if you have any questions.

Blessings,

Virginia A. Davis

story:
I will use all of the funds towards building a new computer for myself. It will be used for school (Working on my Computer Information Technology Degree) and my Freelance work for 3rd Party developers (Currently FatGoblin Games, Total Party Kill Games and Adventureaweek.com) of the Pathfinder roleplaying game system and others.

My current computer is old and starting to show it's age. I would like to be able to work with Adobe, Photoshop and other book layout type programs. My current computer is not up to the task. While $1000.00 might seem high, this computer needs to last me at least 4 years or more. I will be salvaging as many parts as possible from my current computer, but as old as it is, they may not be of much use.

Thanks to everyone in advance
